review_content: From bottle to glass.  Pours clear golden-yellow with bubbly white head.  Mostly seems like corn and grain, with a dry finish.
Old Untappd checkin, April 17, 2016. Light golden color, moderate head, clear appearance. Sweet aroma. Malty body, dry, crisp finish. Very serviceable lager.
Dorada, clara, la espuma no dura mucho, poco aromatizada, ligera, fácil de tomar, refrescante, aguada, seca, sabor leve a Malta

RObe dorée limpide, mousse abondante mais peu durable, reste un disque de bulles irrégulières, carbo correcte. Nez de lager classique, pointe herbacée. EN bouche, c'est herbacé, un peu de grain, et rapidement assez amer. Facile à boire, peu aromatique, lager indus pas mauvaise fraiche, mais pas des plus agréables.
Pale clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is grainy and lightly fruity. Taste is light sweet and light bitter.

0.33 bottle from Univerexport. At first I was excited to try Japanese beer, but later I learned it is actually Italian made, by Bira Peroni. Contains both rice and corn, typically Asian. 5.2% alc.

Pours golden color with nice long lasting head. Aroma of bread. Weak, watery - drinkable. Bit higher bitterness. Actually nice taste, fine carbonation, well balanced - but weak. I liked it.

Orangey gold with a full white head that swiftly diminishes. Faint aroma of hay, grain, malt. Flavours of malt, straw, slightly spicy aftertaste with a lingering bitter note. A touch chemical and artificial. Unexceptional. Typical mass market lager. Ok cold on a sunny day. Otherwise, meh...

Dose 0,33 (ABV: 5.2%): Golden, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + leicht fruchtige Nase, malzige Süße, dezente Hopfennoten, leichte Zitrusnoten, leichte fruchtige Säure, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, leichte malzig-süßliche Bitterkeit; leicht fruchtiger + dezent würziger Körper, sehr leichte Hopfennoten, dezente Zitrusnoten, Limetten, Malz, Getreide, spritzig, mäßige Kohlensäure; leichter malzig-dezenter Nachgang
De color dorado, con un dedo de espuma de baja durabilidad. De cuerpo y carbonatación media. Aroma a malta y cereal. En boca es amarga con un un retrogusto seco.

330 ml Bottle. Pours pale yellow, dense carbonated head. Aroma, Rice, instantly recognised as a rice adjunct beer. Taste- What taste? Almost nothing apart from slight dryness on swallowing. Surely most tasteless mainstream beer available. Have yet to taste a Japanese beer that is worth drinking. Makes Coors seem a barrel of flavour. This is the premium beer of the corporation that bought some great beers like Fullers, Tyskie and others, they are already reducing the quality of them.
Grassy nose, light, crisp, unchallenging but refreshing. I like this. Great lager.
Old rating from 2014 - 330ml bottle. Pours golden with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of lemon, grain, rice & yeast. Light to moderate body. Dry mildly bitter finish.
Clear, bright golden color and a nice white head. Dry, grainy, slightly bitter. Crisp.

330ml bottle. NOTE. this the Australian version made under license. Pours a pale green/gold with a decent white head. Aroma is a malty wet paper. To drink this is far too reminiscent of a zero ABV beer. It's sweet with little malt & less hops. Not good. 
NOTE. I have also drunk a bit of this in Japan (the Japanese version). Maybe it is a bit like Guinness tasting supposedly tasting better in Ireland, but my memory is that Asahi D was a bland but competent lager which was great on muggy Minikami 30 degree days & with delicate Japanese food. 
The score is for the Aussie brewed version.
Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. https://www.instagram.com/czgr_
From bottle to glass.  Pours clear golden-yellow with bubbly white head.  Mostly seems like corn and grain, with a dry finish.
Old Untappd checkin, April 17, 2016. Light golden color, moderate head, clear appearance. Sweet aroma. Malty body, dry, crisp finish. Very serviceable lager.
Dorada, clara, la espuma no dura mucho, poco aromatizada, ligera, fácil de tomar, refrescante, aguada, seca, sabor leve a Malta

RObe dorée limpide, mousse abondante mais peu durable, reste un disque de bulles irrégulières, carbo correcte. Nez de lager classique, pointe herbacée. EN bouche, c'est herbacé, un peu de grain, et rapidement assez amer. Facile à boire, peu aromatique,…
Pale clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is grainy and lightly fruity. Taste is light sweet and light bitter.
0.33 bottle from Univerexport. At first I was excited to try Japanese beer, but later I learned it is actually Italian made, by Bira Peroni. Contains both rice and corn, typically Asian. 5.2% alc.…

Orangey gold with a full white head that swiftly diminishes. Faint aroma of hay, grain, malt. Flavours of malt, straw, slightly spicy aftertaste with a lingering bitter note. A touch chemical and artificial. Unexceptional. Typical mass market lager. Ok cold on a…

Dose 0,33 (ABV: 5.2%): Golden, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + leicht fruchtige Nase, malzige Süße, dezente Hopfennoten, leichte Zitrusnoten, leichte fruchtige Säure, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, leichte malzig-süßliche Bitterkeit; leic…
De color dorado, con un dedo de espuma de baja durabilidad. De cuerpo y carbonatación media. Aroma a malta y cereal. En boca es amarga con un un retrogusto seco.

330 ml Bottle. Pours pale yellow, dense carbonated head. Aroma, Rice, instantly recognised as a rice adjunct beer. Taste- What taste? Almost nothing apart from slight dryness on swallowing. Surely most tasteless mainstream beer available. Have yet to…
Grassy nose, light, crisp, unchallenging but refreshing. I like this. Great lager.
Old rating from 2014 - 330ml bottle. Pours golden with a white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of lemon, grain, rice & yeast. Light to moderate body. Dry mildly bitter finish.
Clear, bright golden color and a nice white head. Dry, grainy, slightly bitter. Crisp.

330ml bottle. NOTE. this the Australian version made under license. Pours a pale green/gold with a decent white head. Aroma is a malty wet paper. To drink this is far too reminiscent of a zero ABV beer. It's sweet with little malt & less hops. Not good.…
Pite jakiś czas temu. Ocena w celu uzupełnienia profilu. https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

W zapachu słód, w smaku słód i może jakaś lekka chmielowość, ale tak delikatna, że mogłem się pomylić. Pite zimne, więc piło się całkiem przyjemnie, prawdopodobnie wpłynęło to na ocenę. Barwa bardzo jasna, klarowna. Ładna piana.

Aromat: skunks, nawet lekko pachnie chmielem w typie ziołowym, poza tym wyczuwalny słód (zboże) i mokry karton. Pachnie jak Carlsberg, Heineken i Lech razem wzięte.
Smak zbalansowany, piwo wodniste, jakieś nikłe nuty słodowe i coś tam jeszcze było, ale nie mogę rozszyfrować nabazgranych notatek.
Nagazowanie wysokie, pełnia niska, goryczka średnia.
Una cerveza de color oro pálido, con espuma generosa pero fugaz. La malta se aprecia un poco, y el sabor que deja al final es un amargo extraño.

12 oz bottle from PK Noodles in Jacksonville, FL.  The beer poured a clear amber color with a small white head and limited lacing.  Lots of grain or cereal in the aroma.  The taste is dry with only mild hop bitterness mostly  wheat malts. The beer has a medium body with average carbonation.

Light and crispy.
Bitter and sour at the start, some corn, and a metallic tang. 
Crisp and dry. Would go well with any food just like the rest of the macro lagers.
Słabe, smakuje jak zwykły koncerniak. Bardzo słaba goryczka, piana szybko opada.

Brewed in Italy.
Golden in color with a fine foam.
Nose. Malty, with faint notes of mushrooms and fruits.
Taste. Malty, sweet notes, with dry bitterness in the aftertaste.
Aromă de porumb măcinat şi orez. Gust apos de cereale , orez şi porumb mai mult decît orz şi hamei, amărăciune scăzută.

HARIMOTO JAKATOTO PIWOOO
TAKO TAK TO PIWO WY BO RO WE 

Tak mniej więcej wyglądałaby reklama w polskiej tv. 

Rzeczywistość mniej kolorowa - jak dla mnie chała. Chcę być wyrozumiały ponieważ Japończycy próbują sił we wszystkim, (absolutnie wszystkim) co im obce kulturowo:
skoki, whiskey, kupowanie w KFC na święta. Niestety nie mogę. Rozwodniony pils, nudny do bólu. Eurolagery są lepsze z racji tego że są euro. Ciekawe jak sytuacja by się miała gdyby piwo było eksploatowane głównie w Azji?

Opening with a loud crispy sound, yeasty smell...heavy carbonation which is not a bad thang. The carb and hops underlayed with a more malty based character finishes with a satin smooth ending. Good and must be delicious to a kobe tepenyaki in kyoto.
Zlatnozute boje, tanka bijela pjena, kratkotrajna. Aroma citrusa, trave i kvasca. Blage prema srednjoj gorčini, duzeg gorkog finiša. Vodene teksture, srednje karbonizacije. Ništa posebno.
Pours clear bright golden.  Medium body, oily mouthfeel.  Grassy corn and rice aroma.  Macro lager what-did-you expect taste.  Malty unpleasant finish.

Light golden color. As the name says, very dry and crisp beer. This is my first beer that I ever had and one of the most popular beer in Japan. So when it comes to beer, this is the first beer which comes to my mind. A bit watery but still good malty, gain flavor with high carbonation. Considering that this is mass product and the low price, it’s very good beer.

0.33 bottle bought at Idea supermarket, Belgrade. Clear golden colour with thin, frothy white head, aroma is grainy, malty , hint of honey, taste is malty,  medium sweetness, low bitterness, extremely high carbonation, thin bodied.

500ml bottle. Pours a light gold with high carbonation and a white head that dissipates quickly. Not much aroma but get malts, hops and grain. Taste is malt, water and a moderate sweetness. Slightly bitter and dry finish. Occasionally I can taste a note of hops which combine with the bitterness but its frustratingly fleeting.

This is my first Japanese lager and its a little disappointing as its not unlike most international mass produced lagers. Nothing unusual or impressive here.

szuperszáraz, szénsavas, kesernyés, hab nélküli.
igazán szomorkás borongós ital.
Raiden nagyapáink is ezt ihatta mielőtt harcba vonult.
Une petite bière surprenante avec un goût appréciable. Une bien belle découverte.

Looks: clear golden with small white head.
Aroma: malts, corn, a bit of hops, maybe some slight rice. 
Taste: malts, a little sweet, a little bitter. Decent hop presence on the finish, even though it's not very durable.
Mouthfeel: thin body and average crisp carbonation, feels nice and refreshing on the mouth.
Overall: considering it's a macro pale lager it's actually not bad at all. Refreshing, balanced and quite nice on the palate.
12 ounce bottle in Kent Ohio. Smell light and grainy. Light yellow with small white head. Taste sweet, dry and grainy.  Light bodied and smooth. Very drinkable beers. Cheers!
Aroma 4. Appearance 3.Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 9. Malt aroma. Grain taste, dry aftertaste and quite watery.
Clean, clear and crisp. Bright and bubbly on pour - some rice and grains aromas, with a dry finish.

Can from local shop. Clear gold with bright white head. Looks good. Nose is syrupy malt. Dry hay. Little juicy fruit. Medium body with sharp, bubbly carbonation and a dry, leaf finish. It's lager, very much as we know it.
Bevuta in bottiglia con sushi. Normale birra bionda senza nulla di particolare.
Pretty cum. At the price point, it's probably my preferred drink. Looks like a lager and tastes like one too!!! Does what you need it to do and not much else. The can designs are nice too.

Pale golden color, weak white head. Aroma: corn, light malt and hops. 
Taste is the same. 
Forgettable weak mass lager.

0,33 l bottle at Takenoko Bar, Zagreb. Clear golden, minimal head. Fake grainy aroma, candy like green apple flavour. High carbonation, bland grainy flavour. Dry, boring, light and kind of refreshing.

17-JAN-2019, bottle @Ulkløbben Generalforsamling, @Frank.
Clear golden with a low, white head. Straw, a little sweet malt. Slightly bitter, thin.

Aroma is hops and grass. Some metal and cereals.
Malt flavour, hoppy bitterness, some sweetish notes. 
Fine lager, would buy on sale.
No trochę słabo. No taki przeciętniak, ale bez wad. W sumie da się wypić, ale nie powtórzę.
33cl bottle. Clear yellow with thin white head. Aroma of hops. Taste is grassy and light malty with a water like texture. Finishes light bitter.
can't believe i haven't rate this yet.  draft in hk airlport lounge.  great taste and less filling; it contains alcohol.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget (5.2%, made in Italy). The aroma is pleasant. Light tones of malt, rice and flowers (jasmine?). The flavor is quite pleasant for the first 1-2 seconds, but then becomes quite sour and watery. Not a lot going on unfortunately. Weak finish. Other than being one of very Japanese beers you can buy through Systembolaget, this beer doesn't really have a lot to offer.
Sporo było wypitego piwa swojego czasu. historyczna opinia i ocena z pamięci.
Im großen und ganzen für ein Lager ok. Mehr aber auch nicht. Zum betrinken ok. Für den Genießer eher nichts
Regular Japanese beer by Asahi. golden colour. Rich malt taste and flavour. can be found all over Japan.
Sporo było wypitego piwa swojego czasu. historyczna opinia i ocena z pamięci.
Bottle at home this is just another mass produced lager. Very bland and sweet
Nice drop every now and then. Dry taste means this is not one to be drunk in repeated fashion. Ok beer at good price.
Malt tadı ama sanki pilsner ama genede İçimi tatlı  hafif bir Japon birasıdır.

Color naranja claro, transparente. Espuma blanca de apenas un dedo de espesor y muy corta retención. Aroma escaso a cereal, arroz, ligeramente herbal. Sabor igual, mucho arroz, final corto, levemente seco, sin atisbo de amargor, alcohol casi inapreciable. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media baja.
I think this beer is an example of why I don’t really drink those “big brands” - just nothing special going on here.
Soğuk koku, sarı gövde, normal asitlik. Bira tadı hiç yok neredeyse. Boş bir tada sahip.
Aroma of lemongrass, citrus and banana. Slim malt taste, rice and corn starch makes this hardly a beer, but it is drinkable due to dry hoppy finish

A crisp and aromatic lager, dry yet refreshing and slightly fruity. Tarte and vibrant when first sipped, with the taste becoming softer and more refreshing as it sits on the tongue. An easy drink, though perhaps slightly too sweet.
Bottle @Home, vintage 1999!. A hint of grass, other than that, it has aged incredibly well and tastes nothing.
Simple beer, the Japanese version tastes a bit different. It has that bitterness and simple beer taste. Nothing too strong or sweet.

To be honest i expecting some more things from this beer despite is an "Ok" beer overall.. First of all you must have back in your mind what you want from some beers.. This beer has one style and it means "must be one light and refreshing beer".. And like that you must judge the beers i think..
Anyway the aroma remind me very hard "Heineken" and that wasen't good sign but the taste was little different and that save the whole thing.. I see outside some badass japanese writings and you can't imagine this beer can be in the same level like the "Heineken" and "Amstel.. The taste is little sour and very bitter and i'm not fan for that but in this specific case the taste wasen't so bad.. Is really dry beer and that perhaps make it little more unique for some others similar beers.. The beer punch you little more than usual and this difference matters for me.. She say you "i'm here" in every draught.. And when it become little more warmer still this beer is punchy in your palate.. Also i feel some rice here and the aftertaste is little metallic but don't affect me so much that.. I enjoy the aftertaste..
Overall is a decent and refreshing lager.. Is not one pleasand and sweet beer.. Is really dry and punchy and that make it more unique for me.. I really enjoy this beer despite i expecting some more things..
Złote i klarowne, piana drobna i średnia, dość szybko redukuje do obrączki. W aromacie słodko i słodowo. Wytrawne, pustawe z lekko kwaskowym finiszem. Nasycenie wysokie.
Pours silky smooth through my fluffy white head, down the throath into my medium but sturdy body, making me feel good. I like it a lot!

Bottle. Pours golden to yellow with a frothy white head that is fully diminishing. Faint aromas of grain. Sweetcorn lager flavour, some citrus. The clear alcohol notes are poorly managed, making it less palatable. Alcoholic finish, medium body. Similar flaws to many "strong lagers", but the strong alcoholic note is not excusable at 5.0%, nor is the lack of flavour. A poor macro-lager.

I'm not going to pretend I'm a sommelier and that I know what I'm talking about with regards to maltiness like everyone else. Bloody nice beer, great taste of Japan. It must taste good because I keep buying it!
Extremely satisfying first sip on a hot day, with bright, crisp finish.  Dry carbonated feel.
Ocena dodana na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w celu uzupełnienia profilu
Musty aroma of hops and malt. Yellow, clear with big white head. Strange taste of grass, some unpleasant bitterness. Medium body, carbonation is light.

0,33 l bottle. Pours crystal clear golden with small almost immediately dissipating white head. Aroma of rice, corn and cardboard. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and low bitterness. Body is watery, carbonation medium and mouthfeel slick. Finish is short and sweet. Quite terrible and pointless.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden pour, one finger soapy white head, short lasting. No lacing on the glass. Pleasant on the nose, grassy and grainy notes, malty background. 

Thin body, soft to medium carbonation. Average mouthfeel, smooth and soft, easily drinkable. Usual bittersweet taste. Aroma of malt, grains, grass. Corn. Slightly dusty. Sweet aftertaste, short finish. 

A bit bland but pretty much an average macro lager.

Don't let the other reviews fool you. This beer is a very drinkable and acceptable drink, refreshing with an initial malty burst and a lasting savoury sensation with just a modicum of sweetness and a very brief rush of hoppy bitter notes. 

Despite its super dry monkier it is truly up there with the likes of Budweiser and other such similar macro brews.

The variety that I am sampling is the 330ml can available in the UK, which I am led to believe is the only imported version from Japan available on UK shelves, purchased at my local Co-Operative.

Please don't let the reviewers fool you, they may be sampling domestically brewed versions.

This is a very drinkable modern beer, the only slight downside is that it seems to be rather too heavily carbonated when compared to other brews.

To drink it ice cold is a must.
Pours light yellow. Nearly non-existent aroma with hints of chemicals and corn. Tastes like bitter, carbonated water.
I have bought this beer mostly for bottle cup. In aroma some malts, in taste just regular pale lager.

1/2021. Featureless aroma, slightly malty. Gold body, white head. Slimy, rice, vague. Bad beer. 0,33 l, bottle, shop witha asian food, Pilsen (Bohemia, CZ).

# 95, 8/2015. Nevýrazný pivo se spoustou nepříjemných chutí a vůní (kukuřice, siláž). 1-2-1-6 overall 1,3
Pours clear pale golden with a medium head that dissappears quickly. Aroma of malts. Taste of malts, and little else. Very one-dimensional and simple. Light bitter aftertaste
Wodniste, lekko kwaskowate w smaku podobne do budwiazera , bez rewelacji ale całkiem przyjemne do wieczornego sączenia  :)
If angels cried, this is what their tears would taste like. Goes down easier than a woman on dollar beer night. Would recommend.

Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji.
W celu uzupełnienia profilu.
Zwyczajny sikacz bez cech szczególnych.
Pale and translucent, fizz and head dissipates almost immediately. Such a mild lager, certainly nothing offensive in there, it’s just a bit anonymous
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.
Clear golden color with a big white head. Grass and grain aroma. Light bodied with light bitter taste.
Burk 330 ml från 7Eleven i Thailand. Guldgul med skum som snabbt lägger sig. Maltig doft med bröd och citrus. Smak av malt, bröd, aprikos och citrus. Medelstor torr beska.
Opinia dodana na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w celu uzupełnienia profilu
Boca 0,33L - kupljena u Lidlu - ništa posebno, malo je drugačiji zbog riže ..
No nic szczególnego dziwna goryczka. A poza tym to nic tu nie ma ani w zapachu Anię wizualnie.

Butelka 0,33 l. Piwo jasnozłote, klarowne. piana biała, obfita, gęsta, trwał, ładnie oblepia szkło. Aromat rachityczny, nuty słodu , siana, kukurydzy. W smaku wodniste, typowy koncerniak, słód, jakieś sianko w tle. Pełnia niska, wysycenie wysokie, goryczki brak. W upalny dzień mogłoby się się sprawdzić w celu nawodnienia organizmu, nie ma wyczuwalny wad, ale tak ogólnie to po co takie piwo?
Brewed/bottled in Italy ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) Just checking off, I expected nothing out of ordinary and got nothing out of ordinary.

Pours a clear golden color with modrate white head, smells malty and sugary, tastes sweet and has a watery texturue. Marginally better than shitty ex-yu lagers I have access to at home.

330ml bottle
Populair Japans bier met een iets te zoetige variant van pils. Wat mij betreft had het wat kruidiger kunnen zijn.
Bottle sample. Pale yellow with a white head of foam. Grassy and floral grainy notes. A bit sweet, but predominantly dry and floral. Lighter body and medium carbonation.

Fles @ Sushisamba. Wederom een smakeloos Japans biertje met nauwelijks smaak en pit. Helder geel bier met weinig koolzuur en witte schuimkraag. Licht zoet en heel vlak.  Maar de sushi was daar misschien een beetje prijzig maar wel fantastisch :-)
Przyzwoity lager, wodnisty, goryczka jakaś nawet jest, choć bardzo delikatna.
Clear, sofy head da easily disappesr, easy to drink and barely alcoholic. It's good to drink it while eating Japanese with friends, if that's not your case it's not a great beer overall
Quality beer, reasonable taste and nice mouth taste. Definitely a beer that has a situational allure to me.

Golden, watery, cristal clear body, medium carbonation, one finger white head which quickly disappears.
Intense aroma of malt, metal, wet cardboard, corn, cereals, bread, a bit floral, some citrus especially lemon.
Bitter taste, watery, metallic, very light of florat, citrus and malt. Very industrial lager.
Aftertaste a bit sweet at first, then bitter, very vague, weak.
This beer is easy drinking, light and crisp, goes well with Japanese food and friends.
Drinking one at Yamato Sushi in Howald. Transparent clear appearance with a head that doesn‘t stay long. Grainy smell, smooth in the throat, but rather boring.
The second best Japanese thing that’s been in my mouth. P.S; my uncles from Japan
Pale golden body and white head. Sweet malt, grains, some grass and bread aroma.  Sweet and some biiter flavor with dry finish, grains and some corn taste. Medium Body and carbonation. A medium body.

Bottle brewed in Italy. Faint vegetal aroma. Amber with effervescence. Sizeable foamy, bubbly head that disappears in short order. Mild-moderate carbonation informs the mouthfeel. Nondescript grainy taste quickly turns into a lengthier but mild malty finish. Crisp and "dry" as the label says, focusing on the roof of the mouth and avoiding the bottom, thus avoiding that "watery" mouthfeel. Would appear to be going for this effect over exploring or perhaps even achieving a particular flavour. The beer equivalent of fizzy pop, but gets points for tasting decent and not being overly fizzy. Very hard to complain about a beer that seems to go out of its way to stay out of your hair, so to speak (as the bottle says, a "quick, clean finish", but it brings very little to the table besides its vaunted "Karakuchi" dry taste.

A very ordinary beer, without any special characters. Ok as thirst quencher. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a bottle to a glass. Pours a murky light copper color or amber color with minimal head. Aroma is slight grains and darker fruits. Taste follows the aroma with some caramel meltiness aswel in the sip. Light to medium mouthfeel. Not good beer. No date on it not sure how old it is to be fair for now.

No strong taste, lighting beer
easy to drink without much alcohol
I can feel a small of wheat

1 finger white head.
Clear, pale golden coloured beer. 

Aroma is corn, grains, slight caramel and a light pilsner fartiness. Good but standard.

Taste is lightly tart grapefruit, corn, farty hints and soft white bread.

Mouthfeel is light and watery but refreshing and crisp. Lightly oily. Low bitterness. Medium-low carbonation.

Overall: To my surprise, this macro lager is actually decent! Sure, corn sweetness is present but other than that it manages to deliver a crisp beer without any off-flavours

US draft pour in NYC market, pale golden color, nice tight head due to the Asahi proprietary draft system and specialty creamer faucet. Served in proper branded glassware that was beer clean which allowed for lasting head retention and nice foam lacing effect. Crisp taste similar to many other pilsner malt based international style lagers. Light in body with carbonic tingle and clean finish.
Draft at Daruma in Austin. Light lager. Almost a hint of apple cider. Refreshing though. Not bad.

330ml bottle at home. Pours cleear pale golden with a white top. Aroma: sweet, cereal, corn, grassy. Taste: moderate sweet with minimal bitterness, dry, grains, maybe a tiny smidge of citrus, metallic. Dry-ish metallic finish. Light body with average carbonation. Nasty
Nagyon kellemes sör,jól csúszik.Kissé édeskés íz jellemzi.Egy melegebb napon jól tud esni.
Pale yellow color, small white head. Aromas of bread, rice and light citrus. Taste of rice and malt. Dry finish.
Bottle from beerwulf. Clear yellow appearance with big bubbly white head. Aroma is wheat and malts. Flavour is sweet, crisp, herbal and dry.

Dose im Hotel in Tokio.
Aroma Zitrushopfen, etwas künstlich.
Wenig bis kaum Geschmack im Antrunk.
Moderate Malusüsse, kaum Bitter.
Dry, as it says on the bottle. Get hit with obvious notes of yeast immediately after the first few sips. Inoffensive and easy to down, although a little too watery for my taste.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. A pillowy 2" white head drops slowly with abundant lacing. Color is clear light gold, moderate streaming carbonation. Aroma of toasted malt and some floral hops. Mouthfeel is light and crisp with a very dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, cracker, floral and herbal hops. Overall: very enjoyable.
On sent énormément le goût de céréale et de sucre/alcool sympa entre deux sushi plutôt désaltérante pour 5,5%
Kissé édes, minimális utóíz. Nagyon enyhe, alig szénsavas. Kellemes, lágy sör.

12 oz bottle. Pours a bright gold with tons of champagne bubbles and a dense white. Scents of dry grass, malt and some citrus. Crisp and very astringent with a dry ash note to the finish. Surprisingly low carbonation. Good if you like the style.
On tap. I mean, it's a basic lager innit? Not a particularly good one but nothing unpleasant knocking about. Crisp, clean and entirely inoffensive.
Lager, dorata e trasparente. Schiuma bianca non omogenea, abbondante e non persistente. Al naso sentori di orzo.
When in a Japanese restaurant.... not the worst beer. Looks pretty bad in the glass.
Arômes de malts légers. Robe dorée sans mousse. Attaque sur des céréales légères qui restent en bouche. Désaltérante, c'est tout...
가볍습니다. 시트러스함 없이 적당히 무겁고 깔끔하고 시원한 맛을 내 좋습니다. 부담없이 목욕 후 마시기 좋은 맥주 중 원탑이라고 생각합니다.
Piwo słabe zwykły eurolager. Dużo dms nikła goryczka, piana szybko opada bez lacingu
33cl bottle. Gold colour, weak foam describe this beer. Taste is bread, a little earth, and a little bit hop at the end. Really dry. A normal lager for a higher price.

I've come from adoring IPAs to coming back to lighter beers. And this is one of the best lighter beers around. IPAs make me sick afterwards if I take more than one bottle or can. This one doesn't. Guess which one wins.

Color amarillo pálido, cristalina. Un dedo de espuma con retención baja. Aroma casi inexistente a cereal. Gusto ligero a cereal en grano, malta tostada, ligero amargor herbal y final de trago seco. Cuerpo acuoso. Otra Pale Lager normal y corriente, se agradece que no tenga gusto de óxido.
Golden color with average white head. Has a grainy aroma with malty, bitter flavor, dry and a bit bready mouthfeel. Still not a bad lager unlike most of the others in my opinion.
Bottle@Lennart's Summer Tasting, Malmö (30/06/2018) - golden coloured pour with a white head. Grassy and grainy, notes of cereal, light vague citrus notes, light to medium body, grassy dry finish.

Boca 0,33 l ,madjarska verzija (puni Dreher)..pivo nikakve arome,bez pjene,bljedunjave boje..okus vodenkast,minimalno gorak..
Japan's No.1 beer nije nista posebno,cista komercijala..
Bottle purchased at Hy-Vee. Poured clear golden, white head. Aroma was grainy, rice, burnt malt. Taste was mild sweet, malt, biscuit, grains.
Birra molto chiara dall'aspetto poco invitante. Consistenza acquosa e sapore simile a quello di una pils industriale.
500ml can, Definition of "casual" not really interesting, but not actually bad.

Warm and crisp, like a raspberry cobbler of beer, I wouldn't call it "super" dry by traditional American standards, but maybe "quite" dry. Its smoothness could be mistaken for creaminess. Its easily a casual beer you'd drink during a variety drinking of various other beers.
This beer tasted did not leave me satisfied. It just seemed very bland and boring. The taste was very plain. No personality. Nothing that stands out and makes a statement. Too bad!
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Keg at Swan, Farnborough. Sweet if musty aroma. Light gold. Bubbly. Thin translucent white head. It has a crispness to it which caps off the saccharine sweetness before it can ruin proceedings. Light. Thin. Fizzy-soft carbonation. Abrupt finish. Could be worse. Would choose over sweeter more saccharine industrial stuff.

04.11.2018 -- 0.33l bottle from an asian shop in barcelona, bb 16.04.2019, abv 5.2%.
clear pale golden. aroma of hay and corn. flavour of hay and citrus, quite dry, fizzy carbonation. drinkable
Smagt på en sushi restaurant og lad os bare blive ved det. Tak for mad, er vidst det bedste at sige om denne “øl” der bare smager af øl
It is the perfect beer when its hot and you just need something cold to drink. It is like water, but this time in a good sense. In my opinion, it only lask a little of taste.
Bier wat wordt gekenmerkt door veel koolzuur en niet vele schuim. Veel smaken van hop die het bier bitter en droog laten smaken. -backlog de BierApp-

Can from Boise Coop. Beautiful pour, clear golden, tons of fine carbonation, thick rocky head. After that kind of a generic lager. Aroma doesn't  give much away,  light grainy notes. Taste is a tad more pronounced, and yes it is dry. None of the vegetal character some mass produced lagers have. Fairly clean,  but light. Note: says it  was brewed by Molson in Toronto, and imported by Asahi. ???
Bottle @ Ping Pong London. Sweet but also a bit watery, ok with dinner but thats it
Light yellow and fizzy.  Has a hop bitter flavor and dry finish, poor aftertaste.

Pours very light gold with a thick white head. Typical lager aroma. Tastes like yeast and bread. Slight malt palate. Very dry mouthfeel, very little body to the beer. Kind of what you'd expect from a beer engineered to go down easily.

15/09/2018 - 33cl bottle @Lilly's Noodle House, Kortrijk.
Clear golden, nice white head. Nose is faint malty, low hops. Taste is bit sweet malt, hint of hops, bit yeast.

This proves ratebeer consists of spoiled beer experts who in 2018  can’t appreciate a simple lager before a super duper double ipa or bitters/sours.. this is why I had to register and make this review. this lager is the bomb. It has a very nice and light taste with this wonderful butterscotch nuance that isn’t too sweet. When comparing this to other lagers it comes on top taste wise. Colour and aroma is nothing special but all is about the palate and taste. Pleasantly dry.
I like it cold on the golf course. Light, refreshing run of the mill beer. The Japanese Budweiser. I like it.
I've had this many times, just never the 24oz. can. Not as good as the bottle, but still one of the better Japanese beers. Very refreshing.

Piana średnio pęcherzykowa, z sykiem opada. Barwa bardzo jasna, słomkowa, idealnie klarowne. W aromacie mokry karton, trochę estrów. W smaku pustka, minimalna ziołowa goryczka, mokry karton i aldehyd octowy. Unikać.

Pale gold pour, fast head, no lace, tiny ring of bubbles. Grainy aroma, malty, grassy. Grass up front, corn, pretty much no bitterness. Light body. About as exciting as this review. Suggested pairing: chicken livers with soy sauce.

330 ml bottle. Poured a golden yellow color with white foam. The aroma is grainy and malty with a growing sweetness and a bit a doughy corn thing happening. The taste of corn and sweet malt. Light and watery with a brighter carbonization.
Bardzo lekki, głównie słodowy aromat. Smakuje natomiast praktycznie jak woda z lekką, gorzko-słodką końcówką. Patrząc na nazwę, można by stwierdzić, że w sumie mniej więcej tak to miało wyglądać.

Tasting from a 330ml bottle at 101Beer Fest, Flora, Burgas. Pours clear with a finely frothy head that soon settled to a surface mist with a collar of lacing, no visible rising carbonation. Pale straw in colour. On the nose, a light biscuity malt, well balanced by floral hops. In the mouth, light to medium carbonation, flavours consistent with the aromas, with e addition of slight honey and caramel, little sweetness or alcohol presence and a short finish. Overall, for a mega macro, it is actually pretty good.

Enjoyable but painfully average. Cool on the palate yet lacking in any originality. Altogether though it is a very refreshing beer on any day/night it lacks a certain spark that makes a person really love the beer.

0,33l bottle. Clear yellow colour with lots of bubbles and a quickly disappearing white head, Aroma: Corn and soft boozey notes. Taste: Has a very short sweet start with sourish sidetones and a decent bitter mouthfeel but the sourish feel keeps growing and ruins the feel. The beer is watery but has a strong alcohol taste. Light body with fizzy carbonation. Medium lasting unpleasent sour/bitter/dry finish.
Robe très pâle, en bouche c'est assez neutre bien qu'assez équilibré. Une lager sans subtilité mais avec une grande buvabilité et qui permettra de se rincer la bouche entre 2 sushis.

Bottle. Pours clear straw colour with decent head and retention. Arima is grainy malt. Flavour is grainy malt, cardboard, mettalic. Dry. Medium carbonation. Typical, commercial lager. Unimpressive to the bone.
Barwa jasna slomka. Piana srednie pecherze. Aroamt slodowy. Goryczka niska. wysycenie ok.

Bottle. Cracker malt aroma with notes of grassy hops. Pours clear, pale golden colored with a half a finger of white head that has decent retention and lacing. Starts with crackers malt flavors. Finishes bone dry with grassy hop flavors. Simple, refreshing lager that is what it is.
Me sorprendio el sabor, pense q era una lager común, pero tiene un toque especial, rice japonese lager, la recomiendo
在沙田的超級市場$105，12罐連玻璃杯（玻璃杯有磨砂，ashai字樣則是透明的，漂亮）的價錢買下；顏色是漂亮的金黃色，聞起來有淡淡的麥香味，但很快被酒精味道蓋過；氣泡有活力，有一層微弱的泡沫；冰冷的時候喝，有一點辛辣感，微弱的焙麥味，但稍遜即逝，沒有令人深刻的層次，只能夠說，喝起來不抗拒。

Un lager bun, curat, bine carbogazat. Nu are gustul acela metalic de lager industrial. Bun, dar overpriced. Deschisa pentru a celebra golul lui Messi in poarta Islandei, dar aparent portarului Islandei nu-i place asahi))
Espuma blanca pero efímera, color amarillo con tonos dorados y bastante transparente con apenas burbujas brotando, aroma muy ligero en nariz, sabor con notas a lúpulo y final seco.

Bottle 0.33 cl. This is a great example of how the marketing fools us: how to try sell the shit out of an average beer. I don't really understand "super dry", is it smthg special? "It goes very well with every kind of food" - yeah just like water. Anyway, Asahi is everywhere, it's ruiling the world, mine was made in London, if i'm not wrong, but as i know, the original Japanese is a bit more fruity, but still not a big deal. I think being the biggest is not equal to produce the best beer, so this one is definately not my fav. Everybody bought the marketing bullshit says it contains rice and corn grits because of "round the palate more" - yeah, of course, there's no connection between cutting the cost and earn shitloads of money. Very average with a strong roasted malty aroma, short aftertaste. Not good at all...

Helder blond bier met wit schuim. Geur: mout, licht hoppig, floraal. Smaak: licht moutzoet, licht bitter en iets floraal met een klein zuurtje. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: ietwat moutzoet, licht droog bitter.
Bière que l'on trouve en restaurant japonais. Elle n'est pas si mauvaise et son goût est bien meilleur qu'une HK!!

Ar: Clean lager-yeast character; slight sulfur; crackers and dried rose petals. Ap: Very light gold; crystal clear; medium white head with moderate retention, leaving a medium-small cap of foam and some chunks of lacing. T: Crackers, almost like dried flour essence; very clean lager character; a bit of sulfur; medium bitterness, firm; dried rose petals for hop flavor, with a little lemon and pine; finish is clean bitterness and dried flowers. P: Light body with high carbonation; very dry finish. O: A clean and quenching lager; deserving of its "super dry" designation; all around easy to drink; has some nice hop accents, and the lager fermentation character is pristine.
Megteszi szomjúságra. Nem nagy dobás persze, túl szénsavas. Csak nyáron ajánlom.

I see many people hating on Asahi here. It's a lager, what else more do you want from it? Pours a golden colour, regular head, with aromas of malt, wheat and grain. Taste of roasted malt. PERFECT for a hot day, and even better if you get it draft from an Izakaya in Japan.
Pale clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of straw, hay and malt. Taste is watery and boring.

Barwa prawie przezroczystej słomkowej cieczy. Piana redukuje się szybko. Aromatów właściwie brak ale da się wyczuć nutę ryżu i kukurydzy. Smakuje lekko inaczej niż nasze lagery. W zasadzie piwo bardzo leciutkie, lekko drapie i rozgrzewa przełyk. Pije się przyjemnie, nie męczy.
Not something I would buy at a store but not the worst choice when you’re going out for sushi

In Shanghai, China, can, pour a pale golden color. Grainy nose, with a flat grainy taste. Finishes on the grainy dry flavorless notes. Up there with Bud , Corona and all the other flat watery grainy lagers. Did not even quench my thirst on a hot humid night in Shanghai. Guess I will go back to Tsing Tao,....ugh !

Közepes, nagyon tartós hab borostyán szín. Illata kukoricás, zöldséges, leheletnyi zöldfűszeres vonással. Komlós, kissé kukoricás ízek. Száraz, enyhén vizes, közepesen szénsavas, közepesen keserű. Szegényes ízvilágú ipari láger.

Gisteren 27 april van 33 cl fles geproefd bij Amatsu.
Blond helder bier met witte schuidmkraag. 
Aroma: zwak en vooral moutig. Lichte body.
Smaak: klein zoetje, moutig, toch ook een bittertje die even blijft hangen.
Droog.
Voor een pils best drinkbaar, er zijn hier bij ons mindere
en eerlijk beter dan ik had verwacht.
Light bubbly yellow. Mild inoffensive aroma. Light body. Off-dry, there's a touch of crispness and malt Basically ok for this style.

Ordered this out while eating Sushi tonight. Somebody else was paying, and insisted I get a beer, so I figured I'd try this to add a review. Wanted something light and had Kirin and Sapporo before. This reminded me sort of like a pilsner. Semi-smooth mouthfeel, flavor is decent...not really skunky like the aroma is. Next time I'll probably order the Sapporo though.....now that I'm looking I need to review that still, so yeah.....Sapporo it is!

Bottled, 330 ml.
Clear golden one with a medium sized white head on it.
Almost no smell, some malt comes through... Clean aroma with biscuits and dough, some taste of rice, mouthfeel is rather thin.
Short, malty, minimal grassy finish.
Ugy csuszott le a 0.33-mas uveg, hogy fel sem tunt - azert ez eleg sokatmondo. Nem kifejezetten rossz egyebkent, de borzasztoan jellegtelen.
a good beer to have a good night you can get 7-8 and dont get full , one of best beer to party :D

Bottle 0,33.The tasted piece was made in Italy. Poured acceptable nice clear color, Medium foam, which disappears. The aroma is reminiscent of the beers of the Rei times, corn is not felt. Some strange sour taste but acceptable aromatic bitterness. Of the beers that contain corn, the best so far, of course, shouldn’t be included. Pleasant surprise. I drank after a Hungarian-made Kozel "pilsner" and it was a classic better! ** there is adequate bitterness even when tasted again, maybe a little too carbonated but drinkable "stuff".
***
 A kóstolt darab Olaszországban készült. Kiöntve elfogadható szép tiszta szín, Közepes hab, ami eltűnik. Az illata a réi idők söreire emlékeztet, kukorica nem érződik. Némi furcsa savanykás íz, de elfogadható aromás keserűség. A kukoricát tartalmazó sörök közül az eddigi legjobb, persze nyilván nem kellene bele. Kellemes meglepetés. Egy magyar gyártmányú Kozel "pilsner" után ittam, és egy klasszissal jobb volt! ** újra kóstoláskor is van megfelelő keserűség, talán kicsit túl szénsavas, de iható "cucc".
bottle @ supermarket (budapest) pale yellow colour, normal body, average carbonated, bitter, corn, easy to drink, typically lager beer, nothing special
Bottle. Had in a Japanese restaurant- average as they come, but not totally terrible.
Just a little above average lager with an ending that quicly slips by. The beginning is nicely dominated by hop and malt.
500ml bottle.  Pours nice light golden colour.  No real aroma.  Good carbonation with an inoffensive flavour.  Not a bad larger.
Correct sans plus, bière commerciale japonaise, importé. Le côté dry la rend plus agréable.
Cerveza muy pobre, sin apenas sabor, debido seguramente al alto contenido en maíz

From notes. Enjoyed at Yume Japanese & Asian Restaurant with the team for dinner on February 06. 12 oz bottle. The pour is a golden yellow color with a thicker white head that falls away quickly and actually leaves a little lace behind. The aroma is grainy and malty with a growing sweetness and a bit a doughy corn thing happening on the end. I’m not crazy about that at all. The flavor matches pretty well. The corn is pretty hefty and the sweet bready malts don’t do a lot to change any of that. The syrupy thing happening on the end definitely isn’t “dry”. The mouth feel is light and watery with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly sweet grainy and malty finish. This is one that I feel I would get a raging headache if I tried to drink too many (more than 2). Ugh. 4 3 4 3 10
Fles 33cl thuis. Beetje grassmaak, licht, drogige nadronk, zoettonen. (12-2013).
Zakupene v peach. Vona velmi lakava sladkasta. Farba zlatista. Chut taka vodova.
Bottle, pours a light yellowish colour, medium white head, Not a bad dry beer from a mass produced large Japanese brewery.

Pours a clear, straw colour with thin white head and average carbonation. Aromas are lightly bready and grainy, some malt sweetness and a hint of spicy hop bitterness. Taste is clean, crisp and refreshing and very dry. Nicely balanced, sweet malt flavours present themselves first and there's a slight bitterness at the end. Not a bad beer, would probably have enjoyed this more if paired with food.

Btl pours a clear light golden color with an alka-seltzer type head that fades fast leaving spots of lace on glass. Aromas of corn, dough, some sort of spice and a hint of booze. Tastes of sweet corn, crackers,metal and a hint of white pepper. Light body, decent carbonation, slightly astringent mouthfeel and a watery, back of the throat bitterness. This was a strange brew. Below average @ best!
Backlog, z czasów przed założeniem konta na ratebeer w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

From the 355 ml. bottle that may or may not be dated because the neck stamp is smudged. It is a bright yellow pour with a long lasting white head that never disappears entirely and leaves spots of lacing. The aroma has rice, sweet brown bread, grass, and a little citrus below it. The body is light but creamy. The taste is sweet, crisp, clean, and refreshing but the finish is not as "super dry" as promised. Still, rating this on style it is right there with others in its class and would be refreshing on a hot day.

Not impressed, altho it states superdry thats not really what it is. Bit sweetness in it. Lager on the bottom of the lagers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. aroma and flavor of rice, malt and some biscuit. Bit watery, but otherwise an allright pale lager.

Aroma: sweet, grass, little malt
Appearance: amber, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
Taste: lightly bitter, light sweetness, little malty
Palate: medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation,

@ Izumi Antwerpen.
Blunt aroma and taste. Typical metallic taste with some sweetness and bitterness. Yawns...

330ml bottle from Pop Inn, Reading. Light gold colour with white head. Sweet bready malt, biscuity malt, sweet green vegetables. Standard macro pale lager, somewhat better than usual for the style. The most interesting thing about this beer is that Tatsuhiro Satou drinks it all the time.

0,33l from bottle at a Japanese restaurant in Vienna. BB 09.11.2018. light yellow clear colour, very small white head. smells tobacco, breadish, grassy, peppery, lightly earthy. decent smell. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes bready, tobacco, some sweetness, caramel, metallic. finishes bitter sweet with notes of tobacco, caramel and some grassy notes. drinkable but not a favorite of mine, bit watery towards the finish.

"The beer is golden in colour with a nice amount of bubbles in it. No significant foam on top and it tastes light and malty. It finishes off on a more sweet note that doesn’t last for too long. All in all a normal massproduced lager." - beersoftheworldproject.wordpress.com

Date: 11/05/2014

Bought at: Takeya Japanese Steak House in Ormond Beach, USA.

Bottle at Korean-Japanese restaurant, pours clear gold with white head. Aroma ver light, malty. Taste moderate sweet and citric. Soft cargo. Nothing special but the citric element gives it some nice freshness.

Pours gold from the bottle. The frothy head makes a quick exit. Aroma is old sweatshirt, uncooked rice. Taste has a dry, flat, metallic light bitterness that immediately causes the heart to despair. The bottle immediately looks bigger, there are huge amounts of the stuff still in there. A hard day for the amateur rater. Body is medium, carbonation mild. Pretty bad. Even worse, there’s still another down in the cellar.

Bouteille de 33 cl achetée Super U. Robe dorée limpide sans mousse. Arômes maltés, céréales.Texture aqueuse, carbonatation moyenne, légère. Notes maltées, citron, miel, céréales. Finale sèche et maltée.
Butelka 0,33 l. Wypita podczas podróży po Tajlandii. Barwa wręcz słomkowa. Aromat bardzo nikły. W smaku bardzo przeciętne.

Clear pale yella, head dissipates to almost nothing. Aroma is quite blank. Hard to comment on tastes since they're limited but there is a decent bitterness for a moment, then silence. No surprise it pairs well with wasabi, ginger, soy sauce, rice n fish. And for a thirst quenching table beer it's cool.
Not much flavor...very flat tasting. again, very similar to the typical beers you get outside of the US

Pours a clear golden coloration with a small, fizzy, quickly receeding head. Smells faintly of sweet, grainy malt and corn. Taste is similarily bland, being dominated by sweet, slightly grainy malt and corn, with very little hop aroma coming through, except perhaps a light grassiness. Finishes with a light, dry bitterness and slightly metallic aftertaste. Light body with lively carbonation. Crisp and dry, yes, but also very sweet and bland. This is basically a Japanese AAL.
Uniquement goûtée lors de rares visites dans un restaurant japonais local. Une bière blonde très claire qui se laisse boire, mais sans plus.

Weak watery dry pils.
Weak, stinks, but that could be due to the overload of durian in the Malaysian street. Had a nice trip, but not for the Beers.

Asahi - 12oz can w Hong Kong sticker, somewhere in Seoul, but the same can as I had on airplane ride here. Interesting how beer tastes different on airplanes, maybe it’s the short plastic cups they offer, gotta try taste testing some in those one of these days. Great bitterness, like what normally would take generations to build up in a feud. Similar to Heineken but more dry. Nice hop aroma too, builds anticipation of what beer culture in Korea might be. Assertive body up front, like someone trying to rush way onto a flight, but then vanishes like realization that we are all going to leave at the same time regardless. Very dry end, or is it just the climate on the plane? Not a lot of foam, but it’s nearly frozen. If i poured it out the window, would it make a chemtrail?
Bought from tesco, thin white head, pour lacing . high carbonation  with a sharp bitter taste

On tap at various pubs. Pours a pale biscuity gold with a white head. Sweet malt, bread, and mild citrus notes. Weak aroma. Sweet mslt, biscuity malt, mild citrus and very mild caramel flavours. Thin bodied. High carbonation. Not a good beer.
Überraschend positiv für ein asiatisches Massen Pale Lager. Sehr runde, aber monotone Noten von Malz und Kräutern. Ordentlich ausbalanciert mit ein wenig Hopfenbitterkeit. Überraschend geschmackvoll.

lattina 33 cl, schiuma bianca media grana evanescente, colore giallo pallido limpido, al naso lieve malto e lievito, in bocca non sa di niente, carbonatazione decisa, corpo inesistente, acidula, amaro percettibile. Una birra molto scarsa. Acqua sporca...... 19.11.17

Bottle. Golden body with white head. Aroma is malty some herbs in the background. Taste is sweet malty with some herbs in the background. Aftertaste is sweet slighty balanced by some hoppy bitterness. Average but not really bad

Well, it's a pale lager, so clear pale yellow with bubbly white head, minimal lace. Aroma and taste of crsip rice and light bread. Super clean and not much going on, but if that's what you like, go for it.
Like every other makro with no personality. Only beer they served at the sushi restaurant so it was easily drinkable but ultimately boring
Pretty smooth but unremarkable commercial lager, that has a reasonable hoppy dryness and a little malt flavour.
330 ml bottle. Clear golden, small head. Corn aroma. Bitter. Light bodied. Soft carbonated. Bland.

This pale yellow lager. Tolerable super cold. Thin body, ok carbonation. a bit of skunk, just a hint of bitterness, mostly just a typical lager. It's saving grace for me is that it has low gluten content.
Clear gold with a lasting head. Fair amount of carbonation with a light malt aroma. Dry as stated with a very light body. Clean crisp finish. An okay summer beer.
Standard macro sweet aroma, light golden amber pour with thin white head. Flavour is similar to a budweiser, light, a bit of rice, with a short finish and a hint of bitterness.

330mL bottle, bottling date 4/7/17, brewed in China. Into a clear plastic cup. 
Appearance: Clear pale yellow-gold, white head which breaks down.
Aroma: Cardboard, industrial, off. 
Taste: Skunk, straw, mild sweetness, industrial grain waste, no hop taste. Low bitterness. Gross with every sip. 
Palate: Medium carbonation, watery thin body. 
Overall: Putrid and tough to finish, even for a free beer. 1/1/1/1/1

Bière blonde, très peu de mousse, brassée en République Tchèque sous la supervision d’Asahi, légère et titrant à 5 degrés. Goût de céréales et de malt. Passe bien avec un plat de sushi (il me semble qu’elle est proposée dans certains restaurants japonais), bière commune.

Acheter à Carrefour Wasquehal.
Canette de 33cl.
Couleur blonde dorée belle brillance.
Mousse diffuse mais vite effervescente.
Au nez : c'est le céréales et la levure petite note citron .
En bouche : plutôt faible intensité, sensation aqueuse et pas assez pleine en bouche .
Sensation céréales mais peu être du riz ?
Un p u de levure et un peu citronné.
Geproefd in Haarlem bij een wokrestaurant. Het ziet eruit als pils, het heeft alleen een rijstachtige smaak. Weinig geur.

Не самый лучший пример от марки Асахи. Пиво имеет необычный приятный аромат. Думаю что это из за риса, который входит в состав почти любого знаменитого пива из Японии. А на вкус достаточно посредственно. Легкий солодовый привкус, тоже самое и на послевкусие.Нечего необычного.
Lager normal y corriente, carente de aromas y con poco sabor. Deja espuma blanca de poca duración. Se olvida fácilmente.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso trova l'orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è normale e la continuità olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una discreta resistenza. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. La carbonazione è bassa. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è medio. L'amaro è medio. L'intensità gustativa è normale e la costanza gustativa è sufficiente. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. Il finale è dissetante e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L'aroma in bocca riporta sentori di cereali.

A: Clear gold with a small white head
N: Some DME
T: Medium bitterness for the style, crisp
P: Thin
O: Standard light lager

Pretty standard adjunct lager, corn and rice sweetness mixed with slight lager esters and a mild noble hop bitterness on the finish. Equally drinkable and forgettable, but goes well with shishito peppers and ramen.
velmi prijemna vona. farba zlatista. chut na zaciatku nejasna potom hlavne kyselkava.
33cl bottle - Very malty aroma, sweet watery taste. Feels a bit like drinking beer-flavoured water. Not much to be satisfied with.
Decent dry hops with a bit of rice in the mix that makes the malts more mellow​ and less sweet. I think it really hits the spot but let’s face it it’s.pretty.boring.
Muy suave en nariz y boca, y algo plana. Buena bebestibilidad. Muy aceptable en días de calor.

12oz bottle pours a clear pale golden with a medium white head. Faint aroma of malt and saw dust like hops. Taste of dry grassy bitter hops mellowed by mild malt. Simple dry and bitter, overall nice and drinkable, would go well with spicy food.

12oz bottle. Clear gold with a medium white head. Malt aromas. Flavors are malt, sweet corn, dry hops, pennies. Fizzy carbonation, short dry finish. I remember this being better, but oh well. Drink it cold.

Flaske fra Vinmonopolet Straensenteret, delt med skibsrederen ombord på Fridtjofen (Fjordsteam 2017): klar gylden med ok skum. Intetsigende aroma og smak av lys malt, kokte grønnsaker, mais. Lav bitterhet. Noe maltsødme i avslutningen. Røvkedelig.

Bottle shared with JMD on board Fridtjofen at Fjordsteam 03.08.17. Clear pale golden. Diminishing white head and lacing. Aroma and taste of pilsner malt, grass, maize and a hint of boiled vegetables. Low bitterness.

Aroma: Cereals.
Appearance: Gold color with clear liquid and white head.
Taste: Light bitterness.
Palate: Light body with thin texture and soft carbonation. Short and subtle bitter finish.
Overall: Very subtle features. Very easy to drink and refreshing without metallic notes.

Gedronken in een Japans restaurantje in New York, waar Yukie ons mee naar toe had genomen. Zaak waar zij vaak met Cees kwam. Bij elk eetrondje bestelden we een nieuwe fles om te delen. Bier niet heel bijzonder, maar mooie herinnering.
robe blonde pale mousse blanche. Nez malt, céréales. Bouche Miel, malt. Lager correcte sans plus.

Bebi no restaurante Arigato Av. dos combatentes em Setúbal
Gostei muito, recomendo.
Pours light golden with a large frothy white head. Aromas of bread, citrus, minerals, dew grass. Taste is citrusy and bready. Mouthfeel is crisp and dry and light bodied with moderate carbonation.
A crappy lager-style beer. Tastes like the mass produced crap that it is. Piss yellow color, smells like bud light, tastes watery and uninspired.
sweet and sticky, it was quite nice off tap. havent done the bottle yet but for a basic lager it was good. I also got it for free which was a plus haha.

Pale golden body with white head. 

Aroma of malts, sweet corn and grain. Slight hop presence. 

Taste is clean, with little sweetness and little to no hop action. Corn, rice and malt can be detected. 

Watery texture. Thin body.
33cl bottle au restaurant japonais. Lager très classique pour accompagner des sushis.

I feel this beer is very misunderstood by europeans trying to enjoy it at 12C as you would any good western craft beer.

The ’super dry’ concept can only be enjoyed when the beer is served as it is in Japan at -1C. Ideally the foam should freeze but the beer stay unfrozen. It is essentially a dry cheap lager but cheaper and dryer still. At +6 it’s just a more bland bud light or maybe a pabst, but at -1 the palate sensation is a truly unique experience, and a very pleasant one on a hot japanese summer day coupled with a sushi lunch.

The looks of the beer are op and top pale lager. The color of the beer is a beautiful golden yellow. It is very clear. On top there is a nice layer of rough fast collapsing foam.
The smell is simple, but not bad. Simple, sweet and slightly bready malts, bitter and a tiny bit fruity hops. Not bad, but not extremely special or strong.
The same for the taste. Bready malts and bitter and slightly refreshing hops. Nothing more, nothing less.
The palate is fine, perfectly average and just as expected. Light body, a tiny bit thin texture and rather low carbonation. The finish is short and a bit hoppy. All in all, an average beer. Not good, not bad...just drink it and order another one.

Can. Pale gold, fine white head that lasts OK. Meek aroma with hay and some very vague fruit. Just so vacuous on the palate - where there should be malt there is just a little sweetness. I suppose it’s a bit corny but really it’s mostly nothing. A tiny bit of bitterness at the end.
660ml bottle. Pale golden with an average white head. Very faint corn syrup aroma, taste is almost non existent. What is there is syrupy, slightly metallic. Easy drinking but not great
0.33ml from tap in Tokyo. One of the best representations of the Japanese lagers. Clear, light,sightly strong for a lager, but well balanced in general
On tap at Salvatore Cuomo. Cloudy yellow and heavy white head. Three finger. Pale malt, corn, wheat, yeast aroma. Bland. Dry. Boring.
Clear light and yellow color. Not much of an aroma. Strong carbonation, light in body, light in bitterness. Good balance.
From old tasting notes. Clear light gold color. Big creamy white head. Faint malt nose. Light fruity malt flavor with a dry finish and aftertaste. Decent balance, though light in body.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow with an ordinary head. Weak aroma of grains and earthy hops. Taste is corn, rice, grains and cereals. Sweetish. Low hop presence. Strong carbonation. Offensive in its inoffensiveness. Neither super nor dry.
Canette de 500 ml. Arômes de grains et de malt. Goût de pale lager industrielle, donc pas intéressante.

660ml bottle. Pours a light golden amber with a white fluffy head. Not much in the nose apart from a touch of lemon and some bread. Very crisp, clean and refreshing as a good Lager should be. Nothing nasty here, just nothing amazing either. Touch of breadyness and some corn, lemon and a touch of bitterness at the end. I get a bit of that dry rice in the taste too. Would choose this over most Lagers you get in the supermarkets here, but would still prefer a decent Pilsner.

This draft? beer poured a clear yellow colour with a bright white head. Minimal lacing. Scents include cereal, light eggs and vinegar. First swig was really watery but even though thin, had not bad flavour. Flavours of malt, very light hops and cereal. Finish is hay like with light hops lingering.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, golden and dry-bitter, backbone is typical lager, noble hops, simple stuff but eminently quaffable.

soms ben je op plekken waar de keuzes beperkt zijn, rijst Lager ; heel licht bleke kleur en een schrale geur van zetmeel , er ontbreekt gewoon smaak en de vage hinten van zetmeel resten van rijst en de droogte na geven meer wansmaak

Draft at Yamamoto sushi bar in Graz. Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of grains, cereal, green hops, hints of citrus. Taste is dry, bitter, hints of sweeter grains showing. Pleasant, lively carbonation. Medium body. 
One of the best Asian macro lagers I?ve head so far. Good, crisp mouth fell. Went well with sushi and kake udon. Very similar to portuguese Super Bock. And much like a Super Bock on the portuguese beach, this, with the right atmosphere, was very enjoyable.

Bottle at home. Everything started ok but things went downhill. Tastes better in Japan.
on tap in Japan, 2.2 to 2.3. (1/3/19)
-----
Can on Finnair. 2.3 to 2.2

solid god drinking my beer. smells sweet. not much there. taste is smooth and inoffensive. slight chemical taste. no aftertaste. great carbonation. overall I was happy with this one and would buy again. MB The Beer Bear on

Botella 33 cl en restaurante japonés calle Cervantes León 27..12..2016. (r1758) Fcpref 08..06..2017 Lote M1105. Color dorado pálido transparente con espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales suaves y ligeramente aguados. Cuerpo ligero muy suave. Normal y corriente. Sin mucho que decir.

500ml can brew in Tokyo Japan, date F216. Pour clear gold whit a small non lasting white foam. Shy aroma of malt, hard to find something else. I’ll ask my neighbour’s dog. Taste of pale cereal and residual sugar. Medium carbonation, high body for the style, to sweet for the style, but it’s make it more enjoyable and less thirst quencher at the same time.
330ml bottle. Sugar syrup, grass, little peach, acidic, bit metallic. Nice clean finish makes it easy to drink. Far too sweet for my liking.
lear gold beer. Dry crisp palate. Dry malt and a little citrus hop that has a distinct metallic edge. Dry finish with more unpleasant metallic things in the aftertaste.
Can from local Albert Heijn supermarket. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Straw, some metallic dusty flavour and herbs. Mediocre.

Bottle at M’s. Big white head quickly diminishing. Yellowish gold colour. Subtle honey and herb taste alongside a light and bubbly mouthfeel. Faint lemony finish under the dominant malt. Crisp and cold is the best way to drink this lager.
Aroma of malt. Pale and clear with a white head. Medium sweetness and light-medium bitterness. Average lively carbonation and a dry finish. Refreshing but not one I will choose again.
Soft carbonation, "typical pale lager" colour, dry, minimal head, abrupt finish. Corn.

Aroma is a mild hop scent with a hint of caramel. Upon tasting it has a wonderful hop taste with spice and a little burnt caramel. On the palette it’s rather fizzy but goes down well. The aftertaste is pleasant with a crisp finish.
Was better than I was expecting but still not great. An acrid sort of smell but surprisingly crisp and fresh taste. Unpleasant ’dusty’ artificial notes to finish though.

This is like a superior version of Bud. The American Version It is a beer suitable for when you throw a BBQ. But very very expensive. Bottle of bud a is about a quid. this is nearly twice the price and not easy to source. A mediocre light beer, nothing special.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of grain, subtle rice, some lemon and slight spicy hops. Taste of grain, some bready malts, subtle lemon and slight spicy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A dry, slightly oxidised, malty bitterness in the finish. It’s dry as expected and subtlely hopped. Decent but still a bland lager overall.
Bottle. Clear golden colour, Very quickly disapearing white head. Aroma, malts, grain, corn, oxidized hops. Taste is watery, corn, grain. Empty. Not Good.

Clear golden beer with white head, smell very light citrus and after metal, light bitter, thin texture, medium body, lively carbonation, short finish with bitter
(I have 0.5l can with best-before 11.07.17 and batch L1939)
330ml bottle. Can’t comment on the pour, as I had it from the bottle. Inoffensive but stale aroma, grassy hops and stale grain flavour, watery finish. Like every other lager.

Pretty much no smell but lightly sweet malt, taste is super smooth and lightly sweet..Hops barely decernable on mouth at end...Flavors go away as you drink faster, which is unfortunate because it’s a really good flavor...Day after 4th year anniversary (spent time at Meg’s parents house yesterday)
Sweet and dry. Not much going on, but I guess that is the intention of the beer. Faint bitter finish. It’s all right.
Very sweet, almost sickly. Aroma has hints of cotton candy and sugar. Dry as expected. Would not buy again.
Pretty dry as expected, also rather sweet. Sweet aroma, yellow with very little head.
From the bottle. Pours golden with practically no foam. Aroma is malty/bread. Body is light with good carbonation. Taste is sweet, though with some bitterness and a relatively short finish.

Chalk this up as another pale lager that fails to deliver. No real aroma except a faint graininess. Yellow and fizzy looking. Big head. Taste was bland with nothing noticeable except corn and rice. Highly carbonated. Best served real cold.
330 ml can. Pours a clear yellow-gold with a white head. Lightly malty aroma. Medium sweetness with a slightly bitter finish and some prune notes.

33 cl bottle served in lager glass. Pours bright golden with greenish shades. Off-white dense head. Low-intensity aroma is porridge, lemon, juniper. Taste is dry, fresh, watery, not really fizzy. Nice bitter finish with a hint of wood.

33 cl. bottle in Fischfabrik, Berlin. Not many things to say, it is quite a generic pale lager. Clear light straw colour with a minimal white head. Aroma is rice, corn and bread; but it is weak. Taste is mild and sweet though it gets bitter towards the finish. Light body, quite a thin texture, average carbonation, dry finish.
Can in Thailand. Aroma of corn and toasted malt with light citrus notes. Light metallic. light bitter. light and watery. Characterless.
Pours a clear pale golden color with medium white head. Malty aroma, grainy and grassy. Taste follows the nose, bready, malty, grassy, slightly citrusy and grainy. Bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Light straw colour. Slightly malty but minimal aroma. Malty yet dry flavours. Clean and relatively refreshing when ice cold. Better than Australian macro lagers and unsurprisingly good with Japanese food 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bière sans saveur particulier. Manque de corps. Se laisse boire, sans plus. Je n’en reprendrai pas
Piwo o barwie slomkowje i slabej dosc pianie ale nie zadnej. Slodowy pozsmak i smak

Not interested in clocking up ticks, promised myself I’d only rate the really good ones. However, since they’re so widely available in Taipei, and since I actually worked in Japan for five years, I’ll rate this one just for fun. A bottle from Wellcome supermarket. Aroma: bready. Appearance: clear amber, head has disappeared! Palate: light body, rather thin in texture, average carbonation, somewhat bitter finish. Taste: predominantly bitter with an unfortunate sour aftertaste. Better than I remember, flavour hangs around a while.
Sweet grain, golden with a good white head, light body, medium carbonation...not bad.

[2016-10-22] Pale yellow in appearance, clear. Small, rapidly disappearing head. Mild aroma, which consists mostly of barley malts; perhaps rice too. The taste begins quite mild and malty, but turns slightly bitter towards the finish, leaving a lingering taste of grassy hops to the back of the tongue. Quite well balanced in terms of carbonation. Nevertheless, a typical Asian pale lager.
Ihan ok keppana. Lappari, jossa asteen verran korteisempi maku, mutta eipä sen kummempi.
Can at my parents. Clear golden yellow. Not much depth of flavour. Light malts. Slight touch of hops. Dry-ish finish.

Bright pale straw color with moderate activity. Foamy white 3 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with faint legs. Flavors of rice and grains, a bit corny and skunky, with faint herbal hops. Sugary with a bitter feel. Oily medium body with prickly carbonation. Light finish but feels more than 5% ABV, very dry and bold, with lingering sweet rice, grains, and faint skunky herbs. Flavorful lager, lots of character, yet not pleasant on the palate. Lacking some freshness, and thick on the tongue. Overall below average quality.

633ml bottle.
BB 13/5/2017
Light straw color with good head which quickly dissipates.
Grainy aroma.
Medium bitterness with thin (albeit sweet body) and clean finish.
Also a touch of wet cardboard lurking in the background.
Japan’s No. 1 Imported Beer ? Why one asks ??
Given this and a Tiger Beer, I’d take the Tiger any day.
Average.
has weak aroma but it has heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, taste
Beer with light color, light body, average carbonized, some foam in the top, (drunk a 50cl tap beer at "Charcoal-grilled preeminent Ya" in Nagoya, JP).

Aroma is rice, corn and some malt. Appearance is a very clear pale yellow. The taste is typical macro lager and some rice flavour comes through as well. Palate is thin. And fairly carbonated. Overall- nothing crazy, but I enjoy it more than your average American macro. The rice adds a touch of complexity and I like the dry finish.

Review: Bottle of Asahi Super Dry: ABV: 5% 

Asahi Super Dry, dry as in crisp with no sweetness in the taste, light and not much aftertaste. Super dry as in more of all that. I guess. The labeling on the bottle is very stylish I must say, shiny silver background with a black printed "Asahi" catching the eye

On pour got a lovely clear light golden looking beer, with a nice big white foamy head, which unfortunately did die quite quickly.

Lots of carbonation which was very crispy looking, can hear it bubbling away, was lively

Slight lacing all over, but not much

Overall, looks very good and refreshing, and nice carbo...

Has a lovely beery smell, very, very sweet and some lemon and grass found. The lager yeast, and the rice coming to the fore. I liked the smell, faint aroma but not bad.....

On tasting didn’t pick up anything of note, no flavours, nothing, didn’t taste anything at all! Also very light, is there really 5% in this!
Ok there was some sweet rice, as you’d expect from an Asian beer, some grains and malts, and a bit of an aftertaste, but nothing to shout home about.
Was a very slight taste in the back end, minimal hops

Generally tasteless, not great at all. actually feel cheated. It says on the label beer, but this tastes like bottled water. And the fact it looked good and smelt ok, was very disappointing that the end product was so bad. A shite feel to the beer, very flat. One to avoid in the future!

Looking at reviews online there seems to be some who say that in Japan it tastes so much better. Perhaps that is so, but I bought mine in a Chinese supermarket and can only go on that. Big beer companies should expect some flack when they put their name to bad exports and poor imitations........

33 cl bottle from Alko, Pietarsaari. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste are mainly sweet and light malts. Taste is quite sweet for a pilsener. Light bodied, watery, thin and boring
Terrible. Es extrañamente acidilla y no se qué más añadir para llegar al mínimo de caracteres excepto que no os molesteis.
Botella 33cl Nigiri (Madrid) Cerveza rubia suave sin un gran sabor ni aroma, por probar una cerveza en un japones pero poco más
Aromatu tu prawie że nie ma, lekko słodowe jedynie.Barwa złota, piana niska. W smaku takie nijakie, wielkiej tragedii może i nie ma ale nic poza tym. Lekkie
Gold, minimal head. Aroma is almost unnoticeable, Very light and refreshing. Nothing special but still enjoyable. Nice pair to sushi.
330cl bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pours a light golden colour with minimal white head. Aroma of corn, rice. Crisp, dry, refreshing taste. Rather watery mouthfeel. Fair Asian lager.
Pours a clear golden colour with half finger of white head. Aroma of bread with a hint of citrus. Completely tastles. Easy to drink.

(Cas) Se trata de una cerveza tipo Lager de espuma fina y aroma muy suave y un sabor ídem pero en contraposición es muy refrescante, no sólo por la temperatura a la que se sirve, sino por la climatología de su país de origen.
(Gal) rátase dunha cervexa tipo Lager de espuma fina, aroma moi suave e un sabor ídem pero en contraposición é moi refrescante, non so pola temperatura á que se serve, senon pola climatología do seu país de orixen.

[backlog] 17-04-16 / bottle at Sushileecious, Wiesbaden. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 2.75/5
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is musty hops, sour corn. Taste is grainy sweet and awkward sour. Same in the finish. Bad.

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, M21525 bottle code. Pours crystal clear golden straw color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of lemon, cracker, corn, rice, white bread, grain, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Okay aromas with good balance of pale malt, adjunct, and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. A bit too fruity in the nose. Flavors of cracker, corn, rice, white bread, grain, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of cracker, corn, rice, white bread, light pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt, adjunct, and light earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Very clean on lager flavors with minimal yeast ester notes present. Moderate dryness, but not too dry. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, fairly crisp, and grainy/bready/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a very solid rice lager. Good robustness and balance of pale malt, adjunct, and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, and clean to drink. A pleasantly enjoyable offering.
Rice, Malt Aroma With a clear Golden hue,frothy, white head, medium sweetness, slight bitter finish
Golden yellow color, little white head. Aroma: something metallic reminds me. Watery taste. Whent it´s cold then it might be refreshing beer for hot summer, but nothing more.

Bottle into a standard shaker glass. Served chilled. I’ll give it credit for being Crisp and clear as per the label. Otherwise a pretty bland beer, which unfortunately about all you can get at most regular pubs / bars and clubs in Australia and where Asahi is seen as "exotic" and special. OK in a pinch.
Rather metallic and malty flavour, and clear rice influence it leaves a dry tongue.

D’ampolla a casa. Cervesa color groc-daurat amb escuma blanca molt abundant i fina, poc duradora amb retenció i adherència mitja. aromes de sofre, gra, i palla. En boca es aigualida i un punt metal-lica, amb aromes similars i una mica d’herba. No m’agradat.
Not much to this beer. Yellow color with white head. Looks refreshing but isn’t when it comes to flavor. Very watery with a strange bitter aftertaste. [Booming voice] Disapprove!

Twelve ounce bottle from useless Asian restaurant in Delhi Township, tasted on July 2, 2016. Medium gold hue, cheap perfume smell, sweet adjunct taste with some perfume character. Not as bad as nose would indicate but not worth it unless you’re really thirsty.

Keg at Bi Bim Bap. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of chalky lemon and grass. Flavour of grain and a light peppery finish. Thin to medium body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft fizz. Very dry and crisp. I really enjoyed this.
Bottle @ random burger joint in Tallinn. Very light nose of malt and lager yeast. Malty with bread and some earthy yeast. Very light body. Pity Japan if this is their no. 1 beer.

Bottle at Lucky Voice Karaoke, Islington. Bit sticky and sweet, where’s that attenuation gone then? Doesn’t live up to the "dry" in its name or in my distant memory. Clean but not crisp. Drinkable but bland, remember this being better than it is.

I got this from Friar Tucks. Pours gold with a white head. Taste grain, bland, corn. I thought this was ok. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Japanese version of typical under-average euro-lager. No reason to drink it again.
Bière blonde avec mousse blanche qui disparaît rapidement. Pas de nez, on sens une petite amertume au goût, un peu de malt.
33 cl bottle at home. Clear golden with low white head. Aroma and taste are mainly sweet and light malts. Taste is quite sweet for a pilsener. Light body, thin texture and lively carbonation.

Draft at a sushi restaurant, served in a pils glass. Clear bright yellow color with white head. Aroma notes of pale malt sweetness and some breadiness. Taste adds some corn and faint grass. Light body, moderate-heavy carbonation, crisp with clean finish. Yep pretty bland standard pale lager, actually may be over the top bland. Take that bud!
so this was actually not bad for a boring lager, but i only really bought it for the country tick. fuck yerrrrrrrrrr another one off the list, the ride never ends

When pouring the beer, you get a clear bright yellow color. The foam is white and very thin. The foam has small bubbles and disappear rather quickly, leaving no trace. The aroma is malty element that wicks be a little toasted. A little lemon, bread, and so far found little honey. Thin scent general and some sweet corn. The taste is even a bit malty, but now the corn produced more. Is a small roasted tons of malt and sweetness from the corn. After going a little lemon, toast. The flavors are quite thin and very little bitterness. Light body. Carbonation is high. Slightly bitter with a lightly toasted tonnes.

As a lager, it’s quite okay, as something i’d take for a degustation, this is an other story. Pretty much uninteresting, weat taste and unoffensive alcohol level... Okay, there’s nothing disgusting here and it’s better than most commercial lagers on the market, but that’s not a reason to think it’s any special for that reason. PARTIALLY APPROVED BY TAVERNY’S BLACK METAL CREW !

Japan’s number one beer should have alarm bells ringing. If you think Heineken or Budweiser are Number one beers in their countries of origin then this is for you. Smells lager, tastes lager. Pours down the sink in a good downward fashion.
Can from the local sushi place. Pale yellow with a white head. Generic lager, bitter-sweet, with notes of malted barley, corn and metal.
