330ml bottle at home. Pours clear golden with small white head. Aroma of bready malts. Really dry like the name suggest, reminds me of many czech pilsners in that regard. The carbonation is not there though, more like soft to average.

33.8oz can 5/5/16 (Jewel-Osco Clearance Rack)-Pours a clear golden with a big white head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma of sweetness and dough. Taste of corn sweetness, and slight hops. This light bodied brew is just another pale lager.
Pint in restaurant. Pours light gold colour. Straw, dried banana, bread, dough on nose. Slight fruit, biscuit sweet flavour with light watery finish. Highly carbonated.

Straw color. Very mild aroma with some light malts and noticeable hops. Balance between biscuit malt sweetness, acidity, and bitterness. Has more flavor than most pale lagers, but ultimately another boring brew.
Pours gold with a small white head. Aroma is corn, grass and light citrus. Taste is light bitters with sweetness. Light bodied, dry finish.
Poured from the bottle, light yellow beer. a bit tasteless in the mouth. Not very good, but fresh while enjoying some food.

This is way less offensive than I was expecting. Kind of a yeasty sweet aroma. Pours super clear, gold, with a big white head. Taste is a little sweet, get a little bit of citrus flavor. It’s totally fine.

Not a very good beer at all. Very few redeaming qualities for this beer. It looks like a good beer and it has an ok palate.
Check out my video review here.
https://youtu.be/yVnYcWQPVWA
Ryzowy lager. Czyste piwo. Kto pil, ten wie. A kto nie pil, niech nie pije.

Only had it because of limited choice in Japanese restaurant. Nothing but a low-level lager I’m afraid: very little aroma and taste, annoying carbonation, leaves you very unsatisfied. Avoid as much as possible.
Not bad for a pale lager. Goes well with spicy sushi rolls. No foul tastes Or funk.
Bottled at Omi. Odd sweet taste. Clear yellow appearance. Small white head. Okay I guess.
One from well know lager beers from Japan. This one is also much better then most of EU and American lager beers. Pretty much neutral, but tasty and with some discreet qualities. Good for any food.
Smells like Coors light. Nice in a frosted glass, no head. Nice dryness. Great bite to it. Not bitter, almost sweet? "The beer for all seasons"
Fles meegenomen van vakantie. Goudgeel bier met witte schuidmkraag. Weinig aroma. Ietsje fruitig in de mond. Licht bittere smaak blijft even hangen.
Aroma and taste is swwet grains, rice and grassy hops. Its dry an a very quick ending.

Appearance: clear straw with two fat fingers of fluffy white head, excellent retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: biscuity, corn and rice adjuncts, grassy, light citrus. (4/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate-low bitter. (4/10) Palate: light body, lively to moderate carbonation, crisp lightly bitter and metallic finish. (3/5)

Eh. Standard pale/Euro lager with lots of adjunct character and a slightly metallic finish. Marginally better than a Coors Lite, but that’s not exactly a high bar, is it? (10/20)

Tap at Harrys Bar, Boat Quay, Singapore. Poured a clear straw colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, dry mineral malt. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light grainy, slightly floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Enjoyed in a can. Smell is basic lager - corn and sweet hay, grains, etc. Taste is solid, some good balance between bitter and sweet. Nothing too drying about it, but it’s a decent Japanese beer. Goes well with sushi

’Super dry’ version of this original dry lager, shared by Craftmember. Loose, egg-white, quite thin, quickly dissolving head, pure golden blonde colour, cristal clear, with vivid fizz. Aroma quite heavily skunked, stale cat pee, some grass, iron, rice. Very neutral taste, faint rice sourishness, thin and watery mouthfeel, low in carbonation, metallic; little hop bitterness in the end, but a kind of bready, not unpleasant flavour remains. Very bland, even for the style.
330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear pale golden with a two finger size white head, some lacing. Sweet malty aroma with grains. Grassy and sweet taste, rice, grains and a dry finish.

From Carrefour. In Teku glass. Playinh Clicker Heroes. Like a standard macro lager but with rice, nearly no foam and a more stingy bitterness. Too expensive for what it is. Better drink a Cruzcampo or Mahou. Avg 2.5

7 Jul 2018. From Club del Gourmet of El Corte Ingles. 50cl. In Ikea's pint glass. At lunch, with grilled chicken. Not as dry as its name suggest and without any off-flavors. Soft, smooth and refreshing. Nice maltyness, with light rice notes. Neutral taste
Backlog.................. @ Havregatan 20121223. Bottle from Systembolaget.
Una curiosa lager muy seca hecha con arroz que marida bien con la comida japonesa, curiosa para beberte una. Poco cuerpo, poco aroma pero refrescante.
Well I had one with sushi. Should have stuck with water or green tea. Yuck.

Erm.. When u very desperately want to drink a beer and there is no other option.. 

No taste, just bitter, metallic aftertaste. Commercial beer that suits people who drink for the sake of drinking
Crap. Smells chemically, flat watery, tastes like draught beer with dirty pipes, also strange metallic after taste, stay away

Dorata limpida, schiuma bianca di buona persistenza.
Aroma di malto d'orzo e mais che si ripresenta al palato con un po' di gomma bruciata, classica lager industriale molto carbonata e di corpo leggero.

33cl flesje via Amazing Oriental, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 5%
Uit het flesje gedronken

Pilsener conclusie: weinig smaak, wegdrink, uit Tsjechië met Aziatisch etiket

Gylden og klar japansk Pale Lager med mindre hvid skumtop på et par cm. Svinder til kant og overflade. 
Sødlig domineret aroma af korn, lidt banan og pilsnermalt. 
Ganske fin, dog almindelig pilsner/Lager smag. Let sødme og let bitter. 
Let krop og middel karboneret. Sprød og let mundfølelse. Olieret konsistens med en afslutning, der er let bitter og kort. 
Ikke den værste Lager, men også ganske almindelig. 
330 ml, flaske, 5.0 % ABV, BB: 02/07/15, købt i Asian Market på Østerbro.

A beer to be had when no other options available. Too bitter for my taste, nothing remarkable.

.33l can had this beer when working graveyard at my internship in Amsterdam. The can said: super dry but it’s not (fortunately :))

Standard beer, Nothing special
Bière rafraîchissante. Arôme de pain. Pasteurisée et un peu fade comme beaucoup de bière industrielle.

Wednesday, January 06, 2016	8:08 PM	
Bottle poured to pint glass very cold beer 
Sight: Light yellow head, a lot of lacing 
Smell: aroma of malt, 
Taste:  low bitterness,  low sweetness 
Feel: good carbonation, good follow through,  abrupt finish bitter aftertaste,   sticky feel

0.33 bottle. Clear, gold color and a very small, white head. Aroma of hops, pale malts, DMS, and some grains. Taste is sweet, malty, simplistic, hackneyed. Light body, slick texture, and a fizzy carbonation. Finish is short and tasteless. Overall a very mediocre beer.
A nice Japanese rice lager. It indeed has a ’dry’ taste, but it keeps the freshness of a normal lager.

Kolor: z?oty. Piana koloru bia?ego, znikoma, momentalnie redukuje swój rozmiar.
Aromat: lekko kwiatowy, odrobina bia?ych winogron no i nuty metaliczne.
Smak: nic szczególnego, tylko delikatnie bia?e winogrona, ponownie metaliczno?? i tyle.
Goryczka: sucha, niezbyt wyra?na. Wysycenie: niskie w kierunku do ?redniego. Alkohol niewyczuwalny.

Nice gold color with small white foam. Aromas of wheat, malt and has metallic smell to it. Palate, light body with thin-ish texture leaving nice dry/bitter finish. Taste is quite dry, wheaty and malty. Overall as a pale lager not bad.

From a bottle at a Japanese restaurant. Surprisingly good aroma for an Asian pale lager, but the flavor was pretty much as expected. Light and dry with some rice in there too. Update and downgrade: my friend brought some over in a cool liter can outfitted with a plastic handle (!) He was impressed by its being brewed in Japan and shipped all the way here. Why did they bother? It is mediocre at best - a bit bitter for the style. hi
Flaske. Næsten gennemsigtig gylden med et hvidt skum. Aroma og smag er lyse malte og hø. Den er vandet og kedelig.
Bottle, 0.5L. Brewed in Baltika breweries in Russia. Clear, light, white head. Bit corn, but otherwise light water. Nothing special.
Very dry and ricey. Not much else to say about this. Backlog from 2014/05/04.
Not the worst but also not the best. Really nothing special. No real distinctive taste.
Dose - Durchsichtig goldene Farbe mit weißem Schaum. Aromen von Heu und Malz. Wässriger Körper.
2015 - 11 - 25 330ml bottle (brewed in czech republic, my son brought home from Berlin) golden colour, small white head, hay in aroma, light bitter taste.

Tasted from bottle. Very little aroma. Some grains that's about it. Taste is very clean and crisp. Not much skunk for a macro lager. Also not much flavor. Some corn and rice with a little sweet caramel. Overall above average for a pale lager.

330ml Flasche, gebraut in England unter Lizens. Hellgelbe Farbe. Süsslich getreidiger Duft. Geschmack etwas Maissüsse. Geht so.
500ml bottle brewed in the UK under licence. Aroma sweet cereal, caramel. Flavour medium sweet and lightly bitter. Very pleasant lager.
Une bière de soif un peu plus agréable que les classiques Heineken, Carlsberg, Stella Artois ou autre.
Pale, malty & slightly sweet. Almost a must when drinking with sushi. Good pale lager.

* Bottle. Pours golden, clear, with white head. * Aroma is medium, malt, grain & copper. * Palate is light body, high carbonation, fine bubbles. * Taste is slightly sweet malt & rice. * Finish is crisp, clean, dry & bitter. * Overall slightly sweet malt & rice.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Stange. Supplier: Noa (Bristol). Fizzy with slight tinge of bitterness.

Dorado pálido, con transparencia, espuma baja y sin adherencia. Malta maltoso moderado bajo, aroma a dulce de arroz moderado bajo, lúpulo herbal bajo. En boca malta maltoso moderado bajo, lúpulo de amargor moderado bajo, con ligera astringencia, notas a arroz presentes. Final seco prolongado con ligera astringencia

Cor amarelo palha, cristalina e com pouco brilho; espuma branca de alta formação e resistência de uma fina camada com excelente lacing.
Aroma discreto de pão-doce.
Sabor de biscoito com final de amargor gramíneo; retrogosto gramíneo.
Corpo leve e baixa carbonatação.
Bottle 633 ml. It seems that those Asian lagers are even worse that eurolagers. A hardly drinkable beer and it gets even worse when you consider the price.

Sample from a 35cl can (26 IX 2015), shared with De Meetjeslandse Bierproevers. This Japanese can was a gift from a colleague at work. Served in a taster glass, the beer colours golden and bright, even pale with minimal foam. The nose has keen hay and grass features, with a yeasty dough hint. The taste is rather light, with mild bitterness. This is a pale lager with a light to medium body, thin texture and average carbonation, and a bitter finish. A beautiful lager drink, this one.

330ml bottle from Tesco (UK brewed I believe). Pours clear golden colour with small white head. Not much of an aroma, light malty taste, as the name suggests it does indeed have a dry finish with a light bitterness. Quite refreshing. 22nd May 2013.
Poured from a bottle it is a clear light gold with a slight white head. The aroma is a sweet malt and the taste is thin with a hint of rice and malt Nice try
From a bottle. Pours a clear pale gold with a white head. Grainy nose. Flavors of rice. Crisp clean finish. Not bad for an Asian pale lager.

Bottle at Kobe Portopia Hotel. Quite drinkable, but completely unremarkable lager. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flasche (Asahi Draft Beer Super "Dry", 633 cl) aus dem Pyongyang Shop, Pyongyang (dürfte demnach das in Japan gebraute Original sein). - Goldgelb, blank, schöne Schaumkrone. - In der Nase schwach seifiges Malz, ganz schwach hopfenwürzig, etwas leer. - Antrunk dünn hellmalzig mit zitronig-herben aber etwas künstlich wirkenden Hopfennoten (Spülmittel). Gut rezent, sehr schlank, fast dünn, trockenes Mundgefühl. Auch diesem Bier fehlt es deutlich an Körper - der Einsatz von Reis ist eben nicht ohne Einbußen möglich. Im Abgang milde aber etwas schroffe Zitronenschale. Leicht trockener, schaler Nachgeschmack. - Angenehm trocken und auch etwas herb aber aromatisch sehr einspurig, dazu arg dünn. Nicht weiter bemerkenswert.
soft malt aroma poos clear golden faint head taste bit malty some pretty soft can’t say it’s very dry as the name implies

Can. Bought in Belgium. Brewed in Czech republic for European branch of Asahi London. So what do you expect? Taste? Aroma? Joy? Forget about it. It is plain, no aftertaste, I won’t remember anything about this beer in 5 minutes.

Bottle - Pale yellow colour, thin disappearing head. Aroma of hay and maybe some malt. Taste of water, nothing more I can identify. Very thin, watery body, fizzy carbonation. Completely featurless industrial crap.
Pale-yellowish colour without proper head. Watery . Some weak notes of malt. Exotic mistake
15 cl taster, thanks to Hamirubi. Malty aroma, clear golden beer. Medium bitter taste. Ordinary lager.
Een zeer flauw biertje, weinig smaak. Het is wel ideaal te combineren met sushi.

Aromat - delikatna czekolada, co jak na lagera jest dosyć niespotykana ale daje fajny posmak.
Piana - bardzo słaba, nie utrzymała się dłużej niż 2 minuty.
Goryczka - nisko-średnia w stronę niskiej
Smak - nic ciekawego, powiedziałbym, że nawet lekkie żelazo gdyby nie to, że go nie czuć w aromacie ;)
Nic specjalnego naprawdę. Ciekawsze od standardowych lagerów, bo czuć trochę goryczy i czekolady, ale nic więcej.
Heldere gouden kleur en een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, pils, beetje muf. Smaakt zoetig, dun, waterig.
Pale yellow pour with minimal aroma of hay, grass, and lemon. Sweet malt flavor with lemon, hay and some cereal.

Old rating rerated 19.04.2014, 0,5l bottle @ Arigato Sushi & Wok, Stockholm:
 
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry, hay, corn, cereal, grass, paper. Taste is dry, paper, hay, cereal, corn, grass. Medium bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Meh!
Bottle (Asia Store, Zagreb); pours clear yellow with a white head; aroma is malt and cardboard; taste is malty; finish is dry with a light bitterness with some cardboard notes to it
From bottle at Kinn Thai restaurant. Pours golden and clear with grassy aroma and lively CO2. Interesting mix of grains (barley, corn, rice) to deliver a crisp, dry taste.
335 ml can. Actually a great lager! Wheat smell and taste with a pale golden color, ugly white head, but with lots of bubbles. The aftertaste was great. Different from the usual lager.
une bière assez simple, fraîche, et légèrement houblonnée, agréable mais sans grand intérêt.
Tomada na versão lata apresentou coloração dourada,creme médio de pouca duração,mas que deixou marcas no copo,boa carbonatação,aroma levemente maltado,sabor seco e refrescante,
Bottle from Lidl. Pours crystal clear pale golden. Aroma is metallic, vegetable, grain. Tastes grain and sth unpleasant. Maybe they try to make it even worse by adding corn and rice.

Slightly citrusy hops. Mild bready malt flavors. 

Moderate length finish with the citrusy hops, bready malts and a pleasant mild sweetness. Dry and crisp pallate.

Overall pretty undistinguished but pleasantly sweet and crisp with some balance of hops and malt.

F: white average quick diminishing.
C: yellow gold clear.
A: malt and grassy hops.
T: malt, grassy and floral hops, watery, dry on the palate, low to medium body, commercial pale lager as well, neither good nor bad.

Pasteurized, so it is crystal clear with no sediments. Golden to straw colour. Lively carbonation. Not much aroma other than hints of grass and sweet bread. Taste is average light lager, a bit sweetness and some flower and bubble gum. Mouthfeel is dry, yet quite refreshing at 8 degrees Celsius. Rather have this one instead of, say Efes.
Botella, BBD: 07/04/16Color amarillo dorado,sin aroma, cuerpo ligero, alta Carbonatación. Una Lager industrial más.

Nez: Malté, miel
Bouche: Maltée, miel
Un verre d’eau légèrement aromatisé...
Bottle from Tesco. Pours golden with a fast diminishing white head. Bog standard boring lager. Some sweetness from the hops, meh!
Bottle at home golden beer, small head, aroma is malt. Taste is malt, sweet bitter, quite fizzy. average

Pours a clear golden color, topped with a big frothy white head that vanishes soon. Malty aroma with some grainy notes in there. Taste starts lightly sweet, a bit grassy in the body with mild bitterness. Not unpleasant, drinkable when ice cold, but nothing spectacular. Decent macro lager.

330 ml bottle brought from Asia by a friend.

Golden, clear body, with a big, frothy, white head.

Aroma of grass, flowers, bread, sweet fruits, some honey.

Taste is quite thin, but not unpleasant, with about the same aromas.

Light mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.

Finishes moderate bitter, quite dry, also sweet, a bit fruity.



Not as bad as expected. Actually clean and fresh, with some interesting sweet, fruity notes. Overall too light, but a nice thirst quencher and one of the better pale lagers I’ve had.

I can’t remember if this beer has taste. It’s very gassy indeed. I burp and fart a lot after drinking this beer. Don’t consume this beer in confined area. Not much flavour. Just cold and gassy. Light colour, no body, gassy and quite big head almost like a volcano.

Japanese beers often have a dry aftertaste, and this has in particular. It smells not of much, have a reasonable foam and tastes reasonable. The taste has a little hop, a little flower is also in this dry aftertaste. Actually it has nothing special to offer.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is malts, grains and some resin.
Pale gold, slight aroma with a bit of hops. Taste is fairly clean, boring mouth feel, grainy, a bit sweet. Not terrible.
Drank from a bottle. Very light taste in the tradition of your typical macro lager. Nothing memorable.
Probably one of the best commercial pale lager around. Nice golden pour, malty aroma, bitter dry taste, quite decent above average for this type of product.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a glass. Clear light golden with small white head. Aroma is nice light malt, light body, low carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is light malt, rice, some corn, and slightly dry finish.
From a liter can. Pours a straw with decent carbonation and lacy head. Tinny nose. Quite bitter and skunky. Akin to a cheap beer you drink in college.

Dorada, espuma media que pronto se queda en la mitad. Aroma plano a cereales. Sabor sorprende al principio (ese toque de arroz quizás), pero que no por lo agradable, para pronto convertirse en una cerveza bastante vulgar y artificial sin nada destacable. Tiene el mérito de no ser dulce, porque si no sería insoportable. Algo mejor que otras mediocres. Olvidable
pours a quick vanishing head, clear yellow colour. Hints of bitterness, high carbonation, refreshing but nothing special
Pours yellow. With fluffy head. The aroma is much like bud light. The flavorr is grainny and light.
Toque dulce, va bien con el sushi, o al menos yo siempre me la pido cada vez que voy a un japonés, espuma ligera.

I drink a lot of beers, and this is one that I’d gladly skip next time it’s offered. I wish there was something nicer to say other than there is a familiar malt lager aroma, but not much flavour or bite. Best that I could say is that it’s wet and cold and did wonders for my thirst.
almost no aroma with a vary clear color and a taste that reminds me of watered down beer its still somehow more satisfying from water and doesn’t take the focus of a meal

Thick creamy white head on top of a frotohy deep golden pour, effervescent but viscous. Average carbonation, creamy mouthfeel with a perfect amount of bubbles, finishes crisp. Light lager flavor with some sweet cream smoothness, subtle grain. Very nice Japanese lager with perfect smooth creaminess that balances the sweetness.

Typical pale lager appearance. Corn, yeast, metallic, sugar, and light malt fragrance. Smooth and light bodied. Surprisingly not terrible. Typical pale lager taste initially, but rather than a revolting metallic finish, a pleasantly dry and slightly hoppy finish arises. Preferable to other macros.
Light lager. Water in general, weak aroma, taste, palette. Hard to distinguish any nuances.
Golden bubbly with small white head. Watery sour carbonated taste with minimal bitterness.

Clear golden pour. Normal head volume, very poor retention and normal lacing.

Light nose of rice over a slightly off hay background that seemed old.

Light body with a texture similar to water. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a nice burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is a bit bland, but not bad. It begins with a blend of rice and mild hop flavor that flows into a slightly bitter middle. As the middle tails off, a nice dryness emerges over a slightly metallic hay like component. The finish is crisp and dry.

TIL, that Staropramen helps brew this for Europe, I almost wish I didn’t know this.

Aroma of cereal and a bit of metal
Light yellow color, barely any head, boring
Taste is the same
Semi-refreshing
Overall: Boring, even compared to most pale lagers. Stick to Shochu and Sake, or well better brews. In terms of Macro Japanese brews, I prefer Kirin a lot more.

Kampai
Not as bad as expected- so that basically says it all. Somewhat crisp and refreshing and slightly beer-like. Biscuity and sweet with a strange tinny aftertaste. Tastes like carbonated rice water.

Flesje besteld bij sushi restaurant in mijn woonplaats. In Tsjechië gebrouwen variant. Uitgeschonken in origineel Asahi bierglas. Goudgele lager met kleine witte schuimkraag die snel wegtrekt. Licht aroma van gerstemout, rijstmout, gras en zachte hop. De smaak is zacht, licht droog, graan, rijst, lichte en verfrissende smaak, minimaal hop. Helemaal geen verkeerde pale lager, deze Asahi Super Dry, en laat zich prima combineren met Aziatische visgerechten, vooral sushi. Het is inderdaad een drogere variant van lager, deze minder gezoete smaak is absoluut een pluspunt. Het gebruik van rijst geeft altijd een zachte en dorstlessende eigenschap aan dit soort bieren. Vrijwel geen nasmaak of afdronk. Wel enigszins waterig en weinig hoppig, maar dat hoort bij deze stijl. Een eenvoudige lager die heel gemakkelijk wegdrinkt. Bevalt altijd uitstekend in het Japans restaurant.
Bottle, pours golden with a white head. Malty, sweetish, unremarkable industrial lager.
Clear, yellow. Foam disappears fast. Metallic tasting, not pleasant. Medium sweet. Not very good.
Pours golden with thin white head. Aromas are grass and grain. Light body, hight carbonation. Typical industrial lager. Nothing to add.

Flaska från SB. 
Klar pissgul med mycket litet vitt skum. 
Doftar inte mycket, lätt av malt och metalliskt. 
Kraftigt kolsyrad, torr med brödig smak.

Bottle. The one good thing to say about this is that it is crisp in taste and not oily, like some of the other industrials. Bad stuff.
Limited choice in hotel bar. Basically this or Becks. Went for this to see if it was different. It wasn’t.
Not as bad as feared quite malty and superdry as it says on the can bargain can from b and m
Canned, 330 ml from Lidl, Zagreb. Pours pale golden with short lasting white head. Light bodied, malty and grainy. Watery and barely drinkable.
faint malt aroma. dark golden and clear in color with no head. taste is slightly malty, a little watery
Aroma of grains, corn, cardboard. Flavour is moderate sweet with a light bitter finish. Useless Lager, like drinking cardboard.

Asahi Super Dry pours pale golden with a white head of medium-short lifetime and leaves no trace of lacing behind. The nose is slightly doughier than your average industrial lager and has a decent amount of generic malty and grassy notes. The taste pretty much follows the nose. Pale lager malt and rice make up the attack, followed by a grassy mid-palate and a snappy and crisp finish that would benefit from more bitterness. The lean body and the clean taste make this brew easy to mouth. An alright choice if only macro lagers are around.
Jedyny plus tego piwa to piana i lacing. Reszta to słabizna. Gdyby nie było to jedyne piwo w restauracji to pewnie bym nawet na nie nie spojrzał...

아사히 슈퍼드라이캔에 입힌 고운 핑크. 2015년 스페셜 패키지. 벚꽃 추출물이라도 살짝 들어있을법 하지만 그냥 아사히맛. 판매시기는 이미 끝나 자취를 감췄지만 벚꽃은 이제야 피기 시작!

500ml can. Pours a clean gold with a white head. Aroma is grainy. Flavors are grass, corn, highly carbornated and hint of bitterness. This is a typical pale lager.
Clear light golden, very small white head. Light honey, hay. Sweet, the slightest bitterness. Light body, bunch of carbonation, crisp, medium dry finish. Refreshing.
Can from b&m, Team Valley, Gateshead. Pale golden almost clear coloured with a soapy fruity flavour, fruit and corn notes are followed by a tart mouthfeel on the slight grassy finish. Not very good.

The beer is a clear, oily, dull pale butter color with a foamy white head that reduces to just a thin ring a leaves a light lace. The aroma is reminiscent of corn muffins with a bit of dough and grass, but they fade quickly leaving just a light, doughy funk. The taste is a medium sweetness with a light bitterness. It’s texture is oily with a fizzy carbonation and a medium-light body. The flavor profile is mostly corn muffin with a crisp finish that has a hint of mild and clean, clove spiciness with a bit of a waxy muffin dough aftertaste. It’s an easy drinking lager, but nothing to get excited about.
Well, it’s Japanese, so that makes it special. The taste is not very special.
En ganska blaskig öl utan större smak. Ingen direkt arom och relativt ljus i färgen. Passar nog bäst en varm sommardag men ingen jag kommer köpa igen.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, clear golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grass, corn, bread, some slight yeast into a bit of grain, some slight earth. Taste was a mix of grain, bread, corn, grass into a bit of husk, cereal, finishing slightly sweet.

330ml can. B&M. Brewed in the Czech Republic, it says. Clear gold. Thin, sticky, white head. Unbelievably lacking in anything along the lines of aroma or taste. There is very little to say. So I wont.
Why is this popular? I don’t recall seeing rotten eggs on the label, but this was the dominant aroma. The taste was generic, possibly beer or possibly not

12 oz. bottle from Wilbur’s. Appearance: 2 fingers white head, light lacing, golden color, clear, Aroma: wheat, rice, pilsner hops, cardboard. Palate: light body, average carbonation, light bitter finish, slight sparkling texture. Taste: sweet but subtle wheat notes into a slightly skunky pilsner hops bitterness. Overall, drinkable, but nothing else can really be said.

Same lager as every place. Nothin to say. Light malt. Corn. Rice. 
Only for collection

From a 12 oz bottle, not the classic 22 unfortunately. Highly carbonated, yellow color and extremely thin. The aroma can only be described as beer. No head to speak of. Taste wise, this is not bad like every one else claims. It’s non descript. In a not bad way.

33cl bottle@Oslo Airport sushi. A very uneventful experience but accompanied my sushi quite, well. Does not distinguish itself in any way. Nice color, quite carbonated, good white head but not much aroma. OK taste without any off notes or too much sweetness and a pleasant bitterness in the little aftertaste there was. Refreshing enough, but as a beer experience to remember ....forget it.

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Aroma syrupy, corny, actually quite bourboney. Clear golden colour, inferior instantly disappearing head. Tastes like bourbon diluted 1:8 with water. Yeah, that is probably it. Make your own opinion.

Well at least it is real beer compared to Happoshu. Typical mass produced lager with no detectable aroma. Rice and slight grain taste present. Astringently dry finish. The worst of the big Japanaese brewers in my opinion.
Japonské pivo vyrobené v Prahe. Kyslastá vôňa, pekná farba aj pena. V zložení aj ryža a kukurica. Chuť zvláštna, kyslastá, čakal som horšiu. Dá sa to vypiť, ale raz bohate stačilo.

Bottle from Tesco.

Pours Golden, very clear, single finger white head. Aroma of grains, malts. Taste of light malts, then some breadiness, graininess, touch of grass, and some light fruits. A bit boring
Clear, pale golden. Airy white head. Light, grainy aroma. Malty, slightly bready flavour with late citrus-like bitterness. Rather thin mouthfeel.

Poured from a 750ML bottle into a beer mug.
A common Japanese brew that does not fair well in the States. Has a pretty good look (pale yellow) but the smell and taste are average. Not the best Japanese beer out there.

Bomber to half-pint glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks decent; a completely transparent gold with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells of mild bitterness and lager yeast. Tastes like it smells, but skunkier, with a medium light-bodied mouthfeel. Some corn and rice. Drinkable, but not enjoyable.

C’est pas la bière du siècle, c’est sur mais elle fait ce qu’on lui demande, apporter une note de fraicheur. Pas de complexité, une amertume a peine marquée. A boire frais quand il fait chaud, ou devant un match avec une pizza.
Very bad lager. Not aroma, and uninteresting lager flavor. Little bitter, bad aftertaste
Bottle in a Japanese restaurant, Loughborough. Lightly sparkling golden beer with a head that fades to nothing in seconds. The taste is grain and mild citrus. Fairly bad.
Aroma: cereal, hay, grass, barley. appearance: golden, clear, no head. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palete: light body, slick feel, average carbonation.
Its purpose is as a sake bomb. Not to diminish what it is, but that is what it is...

07.06.14: Can 0.33 l brewered in Czech Rep. for European market, Lidl, Poland.

Jasnozłote piwo o grubej, puszystej i sztywnej ale nietrwałej pianie oraz słodowym aromacie. W smaku słodowe z metaliczną goryczką na finiszu.
Flaska från Saveur-biere. Ljusgul med tunt vitt skum. Lätt maltig doft med metallisk humledoft. Klen smak med en del beska.

Asahi es una cerveza Lager Japonés de arroz, parecido a un lager, de color dorado y con sabor con toque de levadura al principio, seguido por tonos de lúpulo y arroz con un final seco. Ligero en el paladar

First Japanese beer i have ever tasted. I agree with sentence on the bottle sign: " super dry". aroma: vanilla, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, fizzy,
Most common beer in the country. You’ll drink this because it’s everywhere. But you won’t get much out of its intentional blandness and lack of character.

Very weak, grassy smell. Pale lager appearance, with a minimal white head. Taste is slightly bitter, with a bit of malt in the finish. I liked the strong carbonation. It’s by no way unpleasant to drink, but it isn’t what I’d consider a good beer either.
0.5l bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy. Taste is sweet with slightly bitter finish. Medium body and lively carbonation. Overall it’s average pale lager.

Sans surprise. Une bière japonaise jaune doré limpide. Légers arômes floraux et maltés. Goût de riz avec une pointe d’amertume. On a en bouche le goût ferreux d’alcool. Pas méchante... mais pas terrible.

Bottle at Yamatoya restaurant in hod hasharon. Clear gold with white head. Faint malty aroma, slightly oxidized. Cardboard sweetness in the mouth and concentrated apple juice. Light body, very carbonated, fruity aftertaste and not really dry...
2014-07-22 tasted in bottle in Ni Hao Restaurant (Madrid)...................
From a 22 oz bottle. Clean, crisp, fairly unremarkable but inoffensive pale lager. Somewhat distinct rice flavor. Doesn’t get as bad as Sapporo does when it gets hot. Meh.
Had this at a Asian restaurant a while back. Very sweet/skunky brew with typical pale lager traits. Works well with stir fry however.

330ml bottle into schooner glass. Brewed in China. Slight sweet malt nose. Yellow, small head disappears to thin film. Tastes a little malty, a little sweet. Watery abrupt biscuit aftertaste. Inoffensive.

On tap at kinfolk 90, Brooklyn. Pale golden color really nice head and lacing for a pale lager. Aroma is generic adjust lager. Rice, corn, slight maltiness. Flavor is crisp, sweet, caramel malt flavor. Actually pretty nice flavor. Definitely more dry than other pale lagers. Slight tinny taste as well. Not amazing but a good pale lager. Actually pretty easy enjoyable.

Crystal clear golden body with a glistening snow colored head that lingers around 2-3 fingers high for quite a long time. Dry rice like aroma. Faint sweetness but kind of has a wet cardboard taste. Dry finish without any unpleasantness.

Nice light beer, dry finish and a great golden color, as expected it goes

"a little thin and somewhat flavorless, i liked it less than other comparably priced Asian lagers. something there is absolutely no need to try again..."

330ml bottle served in a Weizen glass.
Czech version.
A: Pours a golden yellow color forming a medium bubbled fluffy white head. Medium retention and some spotty lacings left 
S: Sweet and grainy followed by Lager yeasts and Saaz hops
T: Follows the nose. Sweet grains upfront. Sweet malts, corn, adjunct malts, Lager yeasts and a considerable citrus bitter end. In overall, a dry taste which is also very grainy. Hop bitterness reminds Saaz and is not bad
M: Light body. Smooth texture. Good carbonation. Grainy and bitter aftertaste 
O: Medium to low drinkability. At the same time, the taste of adjunct malts is a little bit overwhelming
[ BA Review @ 2/21/2010 ]
330ml bottle, served with ice (?) at an asian restaurant. Clear yellow with a thin foamy white head. Flavors are corn, grass, apples and citrus. Light body, fizzy carbonation, watery texture.

Bottle 330ml. Clear very light golden with quickly diminishing low white head. Aroma of corn sugar, earthy, cooked vegetables. Flavor of corn sugar, grainy, light fruity sweetness, light sourness. Dry sour finish. Medium carbonation, light body.
Weak carbonation, tastes bland yet metallic. Medium sweet, not bitter though weak in flavor.

not really pleasant taste,quite bitterness,thin body and quickly disappeared white heading,easy to hangover

0.5l bottle. Clear golden color with thin white head. Aroma of malt and lemon. Sour and bitter aftertaste with notes of rice.

Transfer from BA review on 10-27-12-
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance – Pours a lighter golden color with a two finger white head. The head fades very fast to leave only a very light patchy lacing.

 Smell – The aroma is malty with notes of rice. With these aromas is a very light citrus hop aroma.

 Taste – The flavor begins with a light sweetness and a malty flavor. The flavors up front are a mixed with some notes of a mild rice flavor. As the taste advances some more sweetness of a more sweet light caramel and corn flavor comes to the tongue. These sweeter flavors then begin to die down again more toward the end, where some light hop flavors come in to the taste and with the drying out of the sweetness, they combined to leave a crisper taste on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel –The body of the beer is moderate in thickness and smoothness with a carbonation level that is a little above average. Rather appropriate for the style and makes it more refreshing.

 Overall – A fairly standard lager style for the most part. Quite easy to drink, non-offensive, but nothing with tons of flavor.

This beer has a freshness that is normal for every beer made with rice. Not interesting at all. Slightly malty, almost no hops. Watery beer. But, as any other, refreshing on a hot day (if cooled down properly). Not interesting at all.

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: grains, bad.
TASTE: metallic, dry, bad.

33cl bottle thanks to Lynn. 
Appearance - golden with a proportionate head. 
Nose - pale malt and just a hint of citrus. 
Taste - more lemon malt and some honey. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - a good solid lager.

On draft in Tokyo, Japan. Pours pale yellow with a creamy white head. Very drinkable and refreshing. Pairs well with sushi.

A bright golden colored beer with great clarity and some carbonation fills my big German mug. On top I got a tall bright white head of foam that quickly faded to a thin wispy covering and as I drank it only made some light spotty lacing. In the nose there is very little to pick up. All I got was a light cracker like maltiness with a wisp of grassy hops. The flavor is simple, light and refreshing. I get a mild dry biscuity/cracker like malt base with a light kiss of hop bitterness. The finish is dry and a tad astringent. It has a light body with light carbonation and a thin watery feel.

Világos, aranyszínű sör, mely erősen komlóaromájú és a nevében szereplő jelzőt le sem tagadhatná: valóban különösen száraz. V pivu marně hledám chuť ingrediencí, z kterých bylo uvařeno... a chmel tam nějak chybí... divný chemnický tupý zemitý dozvuk. Tohle je hodně "zvláštní" pivo

Got this beer to go with a Japanese meal - terrible, lesson learnt.

Bottle tasted on 12/06/2014. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, grain and rice. Taste is dry, low bitternness, malty and some artificial notes. Light body with watery texture and medium carbonation. Next one please!

Taste: low bitterness, malty backbone, quite dry, pharmaceutical atertaste, honey.
Palate: low body and high carbonation, pharmaceutical aftertaste.
Overall: Quite poor lager beer.

330 ml bottle. Clear yellow colour with a small, frothy, short lived, white head. Aroma of grassy hops, malt and corn. Slightly sweet flavour with a mildly bitter, hoppy, dry finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation. Not very good.

Tja een Japans bier, wat is hier van te verwachten, gelijk denk ik dan, het zal niet veel wezen.
schenkt helder gouden in met minimale witte kraag, tja daar begint het al denk ik dan. aroma is voornamelijk graan, zoet en mout, tja dat valt nog mee.
smaken zijn wat droog van de rijst, glad van de mais, en dan de granige smaak op een vrij lichte body, licht bittertje. maar wat is dit, ik ga niet direct naar de spoelbak lopen, maar ben geneigd nog een slok te nemen, tja dit is boven verwachting. het blijft over het algemeen verder dun en licht met een droge afdronk, maar ’t is iig in te nemen,.
Bottle. Clear, golden, white foam, lightly bitter, light body, lively, & astringent finish.

Après le travail, je m’arrête aux Halles d’Anjou pour voir s’il y a des p’tits pains kaiser à la boulangerie. Pas d’chance. «Bof! C’est pas grave, y’a une SAQ à côté» Souvent j’ai levé le nez sur cette belle canette argentée. «Super Dry?, Ouan! Pourquoi pas?!» Derrière cette armure, un liquide des plus limpides se dévoile, sans s’embarrasser de sa mousse. Un nez malté et de vieux sirop de maïs. Un goût insipide, sans saveurs. Je revois la belle grosse vague de la Molson Dry. C’est d’une minceur rarement vue. Ce n’est pas surprenant, mais très décevant. (1072-140514)
Lata de 35 cl, adquirida en un Family Mart de Shin-Osaka, Japon. Color dorado. Sabor a cebada, muy suave, con regusto amargo.

Wasabi étteremben kóstoltam először - húzós ára volt (de nem én fizettem). Könnyed, lágy, még 5%-osnak sem tűnő kukoricás sörike. Kellemes, jól csúszik és totál jól illik bármilyen étkezés mellé. Igen drága, úgyhogy nem mindennap iszik ilyet az ember. Mármint a nem japán ember ;)
Bottle pour with sushi. Clean, peach color in glass. Sudsy white head. Mild nose which could easily go undetected. Faint sweet strands of rice and corn. Light body. Not a lot going on.

Decent
czech hops.. ok at first gets mpre noring and watery after on.. refreshing but boring..
Pours a clear yellow. Better than average pale lager, but not by much. It does have a dry finish as the name implies.
It has a grass and cereal scent to it. It is pale yellow with little clinging to the glass. It has a dry taste with light grasses and cereals.

(Bottle, Heathrow Airport, London, 13 Apr 2014) Golden colour with brief head. Malty, clean nose with notes of cereal, grain and hay. Clean, malty taste with grain, cereal, straw and a fairly dry finish with low bitterness. Medium body, dry. Clean and without faults, but not much going on at all. Quite boring.
not a great beer but is fresh and with the hot weather and with for example spicy food is good to drink this one!
Molt bona cervesa, refrescant, suau i facil de beure. Muy buena cerveza, refrescante, suave y fácil de beber.

Goudgeel pils kleur. Witte schuimkraag die snel
verdwijnt. Smaak licht zoet bitter. Combineerde redelijk met de sushi van oika.

Bottle 33cl. Golden with a rather nice white head. Smells like buxus, not nice. Taste is weak, thin and not pleasant. Very short finish. I didn’t have too hig expectations, and with a good reason. It better be very warm before enjoying this one.

Drank from the bottle on the train. Unfortunately I had nothing to empty it into. Brewed in the UK by Shepherd Neame, as I should have expected. Aroma is malty, yeasty with some hints of hops and citrus. Taste is sweet malts, some lemon, yeasty with some hops. Mild bitterness. Medium sweet. Slightly metallic and spicy. Medium body, medium carbonation and - as described on the bottle - it has quite a dry feel. Unfortunately this doesn’t make it nice.

0.5L can. Clear yellow color. Looks and smells like a pils/lager. Taste of malt and hops. Dry and crisp with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Thin body and pilsner-like carbonation. Boring and average and not good value for money, but good for quenching thirst if it’s on the table already. ;)

Clear, yellowish beer with a brief white head. Smells like a pils/lager. Quite crispy mouth feel from the carbonation. Toffee and butter (because it is a czech beer). Moderate bitterness. Quite OK. I would drink a few of these if Pilsner Urquell wasn’t available.

Light hops in aroma. Can feel the dryness in taste, that makes beer pleasant, but not so much drinkable. Not more than one bottle.A bit of a metalic aftertaste. This kind of dryness havent tried before.

 Can whilst in Manila. Sampled beside the Colt 45 from the same brewery. Pours a bright clear gold with billowing bright white head that dissipates fairly quickly. Date tasted: July 21, 2013 ... Glassware: Baltika stange... Occasion: looking forward to rest after a fun trip to LBI--and a new mattress upstairs....Appearance: clear golden body with slim bubbles; head flourishes and quickly dissipates, leaves spongelike, wide gaps between foamy nooks and crannies... Aroma: funky corn adjuncts plague the nostrils; slight suggestion of floral hops, but they are beaten back by macro malt... Palate: clean, slightly irregular finish with some warmth at its end; rather watery with little character...Taste: light bitterness from the malt adjunct makes this a rather bland mouth rinser; exhibits little of its promised "richness"... Overall: at $1.99 for a 38-ounce can, one could argue this beer actually gives the drinker his money’s worth... unfortunately, this beer didn’t have to come from Japan to deliver its pedestrian malty, bitterly bland aftertaste...at least there was a lot of it?...

Botella de 330ml. Vaso Weizen. Saboreada en jun´13. Color dorado pajizo y transparente. Espuma blanca y buena retención que deja encajes en las paredes. Olores de leve metal y grano crudo. Final seco y retrogusto dulce de extracto de maltas. Aburrida!!
330ml bottle. Weizen glass. Enjoyed on jun´13. Golden color, crystal clear appearance. White froth, good retention, some lacing left. Slight metal, grainy odor. Grainy upfront, quite fizzy. Light body. Moderate/high carbonation. Watery texture. Dried adjuncts, maybe corn & low bitterness in the middle. Dry finish. Sweet extract malt on the aftertaste. Boring !!

Clear golden yellow beer with little head. Aroma and taste is unpleasantly starchy, almost like a fishy kind of an aroma, like something’s gone bad. A bit grainy malty as well. Little bitterness in the finish, watery thin body. Holding my nose closed got me through my glass.

Slightly malty, hoppy aroma, but not very present. Bright, yellow clear lager with a foamy head. Somewhat bitterder than a regular lager, but not a very dray palate. It has a slightly bitter aftertaste.

Licht moutig, hoppig aroma, maar niet echt aanwezig. Geel, helder pils met een stevige kraag. Bitterder dan een standaard pils, maar niet echt een droge afdronk. De nasmaak is licht bitter, dus echt een pils.

Your typical Japanese lager, pours a piss yellow, no aroma when cold or any real flavor. Grassy, bordering on undrinkable as it warms up. Very fizzy, lots of foam. ---update--- Having it on draft at an izakaya, I feel I may have been a bit harsh on this beer. Crystal clear gold, thick head of foam, ok lacing plus a sweet malty aroma gives a decent first impression. The taste is malty, a bit too sweet for me but with a crisp lightly hoppy finish. A decent macro when served cold and fresh.

Boring but well enough made.

Ap 4 P 3 T 6 Ar 4-5 O 8-10

Nice colour. Hate that the foam disaappeares momentarily. Taste is okay. I like the bottle, however it's not what you'll drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

633mL. Clear golden pour with medium white foam. Quick retention. Nose is yellow apple and white grape. Taste is apple and lemon. Palate is lightly spicy with paper. Not offensive, paired okay with very light sashimi like tuna not salmon.

Can. A little cardboard and a little grassiness. Light straw color, little head. Initial has a touch of hay / mid goes to harsher grass and some hops / finish is mild and sweet (not really "dry"). Thin body. Somehow I hadn’t gotten around to rating this one, which is the most popular (all malt) beer in Japan. Not as bad as I remember. Not as bad as happoshu. But not really good.
Bottle, pours pale yellow. Aroma is light malt with a slight metallic note to it. Flavour is lightly malted with a hopbitterness to it.
Bottle at Sushi Zone in San Francisco, CA. Not terrible with my amazing meal. Probably wouldn't hold up without incredibly fresh sushi to make everything in life seem better though.
Gyllen lys farve med hvitt skum som forsvinner raskt. Søtlig smak med en noe bittersøt avslutning. Vinmonopolet.

(Part 1 of a 2-part “Macro Abyss Night” mini-series, 1-Jun-2013)



500 ml can bought at 7-Eleven somewhere in North Point. Having this with a friend while waiting for rest of the gang to have a crazy post-exam dinner nearby.



Pour piss golden yellow colour onto a dimple; One finger head and soapy white foam which last for about 1 minute; Minimal lacing and fizzy carbonation; Strong smell of malt, rice, corn, light bread, light citrus and grass; Light sweet taste of lager malt, with strong rice, corn, bread, light wet cardboard, lemon / citrus and light grass; Mid to light body, dry and crisp palate; Taste profile is rather rich, lean body macro lager malt, accompanied by strong rice, bread and light corn. The advertised dry taste is prominent and that pretty much makes up for the otherwise offensive macro malt and rice taste. Quite neat really. Wet cardboard is only in light shades and inoffensive. Otherwise no other foul macro lager taste is detected; Hoppiness is light citrus and grassy nose and taste, and a light but firm hop bitterness for semi-finish. Not bad; Dry after taste, very crisp and easy to mouth.



Comments: This was Asahi’s trump card during the Dry Wars, a with good reason: a decent lean body, any would-be offensive malt and rice taste are nicely counterbalanced by the crisp dry palate. Adding near-zero fault, pretty low sweetness, and some un-macro hoppiness, this one serves as a text book example on being a good, drinkable macro, which is a rarity these days. A cut above the rest, crappy macros that is.
Bottle from Eagan Liquor Mart, straw pour with a thin white head. Aroma of straw, wheat and rice. Taste is the same, very metallic water like taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Flasche) Es hat eine goldgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist karamellig, süß mit einer starken Marzipan Note. Der Geschmack ist anfangs Vollmundig, danach schwach, diacetylig und süß. Bittere gibt es kaum aber eine leichte würzige Hopfen Note

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of butter, bread dough and light cow manure, with a hint of acetone, cardboard and rotten peaches. flavour is mainy heavy cardboard, with a light hint of herbal hops, bread dough, alcohol and a dry grainy finish. light to medium-bodied with average carbonation.

I don’t get the consistently low scores for this beer.  Maybe it is an Asian beer that needs to be imbibed in Asia.  All I know is that it is my beer of choice when in Bangkok.  Clean, crisp, light, refreshing, sharp straw flavor.  But for me one of the best beers to drink on a hot humid day.  Goes especially well with Asian food.

Bottle.  Light yellow with a pretty big off-white head.  Strong hay and pilsner aromas.  Sour hay flavors with a bit of grain at the end.  A bit dry but definitely not "super" dry...This probably tastes better because I just finished mowing and it’s hot out.
33 cl. bottle @ Nakoyashi, Veenendaal. Pale yellow with a white head. Grainy aroma. Bit of a cheap euro lager taste with some rice. Boring and not so good.
Pretty good when paired with some bomb sushi, but other than that, nothing to write home about.
Bright yellow colour with a fizzy white quickly dissipating head. Faint malty bready aroma. Crisp, light bodied, effervescent, acidic taste with a hint of sweetness.

Big bottle at Sakura. Pours yellow with moderate carbonation head. Nose is corn and cheap beer. Very dry body and corn and malt in there. Somewhat smooth but tastes like a cheap Canadian. 

---Rated via my mouth
Flaske fta vinmonopolet. Lus gyllen farge,stor hvit skumtopp. Ikke så mye å si egentlig . Kjedelig kjedelig kjedelig kjedelig. Vann med en dråpe malt .

pours clear bright yellow with a small white head, no retention. light oxidated notes, corn, rice, very hint of lemon, grass hop extract, spicy. dry and lightly boozy (!) short finish, light body - slightly watery, average to soft carbonation.
Bottle. Light golden lager. Slightly sweet and metallic without much real flavour. Refreshing.

A decent rice beer.  Not a lot of flavor but a nice bitter finish.  Goes great with sushi. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Didn’t get much aroma, just a grainy and sweet mass produced aroma. Taste is nothing like I remember it from a past life: it is super sweet and watery, so watery that, luckily, the over-sweet taste gets washed away. A bit prickly, a bit spicy, and a bit lemony-sour in the finish. Not a good beer.

Russian version "Steiny Bottle", 44cl, 5%, 2.70€. Far too expensive, here you pay only the brand. Yellow color, standard white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is subtle with some grains ad a lagery note. Taste is well balanced and crisp, palate is dry indeed. But way too watery. I remember the original japanese being a bit better. 3-3-5-3-10=2.4


50 cl bottle, czech version retail more than 2€. Yellow color big white head, grainy malts, rice, lagerish but refreshing and dry indeed. Light body, dry finish, quite good lager. 5-3-5-4-11=2.8
Medium white head... clear golden/yellow colour.. smell malts grass taste malts.. nothing special..

Brewed by *gack* Molson. The Japanese seem to like the one brewed in Japan. A bit austere for my taste but good for the style...just not my style. I suppose if it were served by a comely Japanese barmaid I might enjoy it more....
12 oz bottle pours clear gold zero head.  Taste like water and carbonation.
Bottle at Sushi restaurant  in Paris. Rather ordinary international lager.  Maybe a bit as an american pale lager with the additions ov rice and corn.

Jaune pale avec très peu de mousse. L’arôme de malt avec un peu d’houblon. Le goût est d’abord du malt bien équilibré avec l’houblon. Carbonation moyenne. Le goût est faible, mais certainement pas offensife. Très terne.
Bottle @ restaurant. non dice nulla. profum i di luppolo e basta. va bene per sciaquarsi la bocca. la possiamo òparagonare ad un acqua frizzante un po’ amara.
Bottle@restaurant, Amsterdam, 330 ml. Head: white foam. Colour: clear, yellow golden. Aroma: some hops. Taste: bitter-sweet. Palate: dry, thin bitter-sweet finish, medium CO2. Overall: ok.
Flat nose, no head, no retro palate, alcoholic palate. Not even for a hot day. A solid tanned brown colour might be the only decent thing about this beer.

Small nose, dry. 
Clear yellow color, small white head. 
Light to medium body, very dry, crisp, small spiciness, pepper. 


:)
Bolton Brew.

330ml bottles of this were floating about at a recent works event so I tried the one (purely for research purposes) before swiftly moving onto the wine. Pale gold on the pour with a small, slowly fading white head. Lemon, mid fruits, grain and cereal to go round. Light and watery body-wise with medium carbonation and a short length ’hoppy’ bitterness. Inoffensive but even for a lager it’s not something I could drink lots of.
(bottle 30/03-2013) low white head, clear yellow color, slim body, good bitterness, high co2, fresh taste. BB date 06.09.2013.

500ml bottle. Pale yellow gold colour, frothy white head that quickly diminishes and aroma of malt & straw. Sweetish taste of malt, grain & rice, with a dry light bitter finish. Watery, light bodied, high carbonation.

12 fl oz / 355mL bottle into pint glass. Aroma: Extremely skunky and sour. Some malt, but mostly just pure skunk. Appearance: absolutely transparent. Very, very pale gold. Very fizzy. Taste: Sweet malt, but really hardly any flavor at all. If fizzy were a flavor, this beer would be full of flavor. Palate: No surprise here, it’s extremely thin and watery. Overall: Not impressed at all. Fizzy and clear. The sweet malt was new for me. Not the worst I’ve ever had, but not very appealing.
Bottle while eating sushi.  Crisp pale lager in this brew - big takeaway is the dryness - sort of "Guinness-like" in that regard

330 ml bottle, bought at an asian supermarket. Poured into a big english pint glass. ABV 5%
Deep yellow golden colour, with just some bubbles in the body rising fast to the surface. One finger of white froathy head with minimal retention, leaving no lacing whatsoever.
Aroma is typical of an adjunct lager, some malts and even that overpowered by the smell of rice.
Taste is not that bad though, quite sweet, mostly rice flavour and a bit of the malts, but thankfully no corn.
Thin on the palate, quite carbonated and good dryness on the palate.
Not bad, could be worse.

Japanese beer brewed by the Czechs. This is the modern world. Superdry? No thank you, I’m past all that. Talking of past it, the chicken I’ve just eaten was a day past the use by date. That’s about as rock and roll as I get these days.

Bottle@Manderin orient hotel. Small head. Faint malty notes. Yes... super dry. Watery finish. Not my cup of tea. Rerated 23/2-14 Bottle courtesy Isabella. Better aroma dry slight bitter. Not much taste. Low butterscotch.

drank at a sushi restaurant in antwerp. didnt even got a glass to pour it out in.. so yeah.. 
REDNACK STYLE

i can see trough the (full ) bottle though, su it must be very clear.
smell is malty, taste is malty, sugary, ok carbo, sweet, borning, uninspired. very common taste you’ll find in the cheapest lager beers in belgium. onley, they did however charged me way to much. like the price of an expensive lager, times 2,5... yeah.. i think i’ll pass the next time ...
Typical macro lager, short palate, not particularly memorable. Rated European version, brewed in Czech republic.

Pours pale golden, almost yellow. Thin head that peters away to thin film within a minute.
Smells like fermented corn and toast.
Tastes of light malt and corn. Light blend of sweet and sour.
Medium bodied, slightly creamy mouthfeel.
Not bad.

Aug 2012 - mediocre lager, light, dry, bit more bitter than your average.  Not too much more to say about this one. (2.1)


Apr 2015 - Bottle at The Yacht, Temple.  Taste is dusty, dry, tangy metallics.   (2.3)
Bottled 0.5l ; Devon ; UK ; Malty,heavy cereal and light hoppy aroma ; Yellow color with average head ; Medium sweet taste with light medium bitter finish ; Watery ; Not too bad.

Blonde dorée avec mousse fuyante. 
Arômes de houblon et de céréales. Très légère acidité et amertume. Longueur moyenne. 
Une bonne bière dans sa catégorie.

Had a bottle when I was out for sushi. Pours a nice clear orangey-yellow colour with a fluffy pillow head that flattens out in  few minutes. Nice bread aroma with a traditional easy-going lager mouth feel and taste. Little-no lingering aftertaste. Went very well with a meal.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur jaune paille très pâle, mousse blanche ayant une bonne tenue. Arôme de céréales, maïs, citron très léger. Goût de céréales, sucre, maïs, amertume très légère en fin de bouche. Carbonation moyenne, corps moyen.
Bottle at ohana steak house... pours clear golden..thin white head..taste is goid like a typical pale ale with good raste..like it

On tap. Pours a clear gold with a foamy white head and lots of lacing. It has a mild aroma of pale malt and yeast, and similar flavor notes followed by a dry, very crisp aftertaste. This is definitely my favorite mass-production lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Aroma fairly weak, some malty notes. Tastes dry and malty, very "asian". Crispy with low bitterness.
Bottle 0.33l from local Alko. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, malts and some sweetness. Drinkable when very cold.

0,44l "steiny bottle". very clear golden liquid with big bubbles sparkling, medium with head short lasting. sweet malty aroma. watery and sweet malty taste, bread and metallic notes in the aftertaste. milky mouthfeel, quite smooth.

Lager giapponese molto nota come marchio ma pessima al gusto. Improponibile. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

Bottle at Fire & Stone restaurant, Spitalfields.  Amber headless lager with that typical sweet malt character.  No hops, only slight bitterness but crisp.  Far too watery and lacking duration to the finish - but the cleanness (is that a word?) keeps it from hitting a very low score.

Can 135ml. Small white head, soda fizzyness. Clear color, big bubbles. Aroma of hay and malt. Flavour is malt with hint of cardboard.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad
A regular lager to go along with a meal with friends. Not much to point out on a rather simple beer. Not much carbonation or head but a rather lively beer.
16oz bottle-white-yellow/gold.  A-grain, lemon/spice.  T-grain/lt malt/rice, spice hops.  Crisp.
pale golden colour, medium, though quickly disappearing white head; smells like sweat, it is unbearably sinky; regarding the taste: some watery bitterness and light carbonation; very poor lager
Kul med japansk öl men annars var inget speciellt kul med denna. Smaken är tam och kroppen nöstan obefintlig precis som aromen. Funkar kanske hyfsat som en dussinöl men inget annat.
330ml bottle. Clear golden body with a white head. Light bread flavor and a hint of hop. Pretty flavorless.

Light gold tiny cap...... poured from the giant 2L can. Smellless corn, pennies, not skunk but almost, not offended at all. Taste like nothing.... corn, bread, light metalic hops.... I’m done reviewing this.

From the twist off bottle into my pilsener, it pours really light. The one inch super foamy white head stays around for a good two minutes. There is fast rising carbonation. Some light lacing is left. The smell has corn and rice adjuncts up front. The taste is sweet with the corn and rice adjuncts up front, some hops are very faint in the background. The palate is extremely light and there isn’t any harshness on the tongue. Overall, this is good for its style but only decent to me.

Bottle. Clear, pale liquid with frothy head. Bread and hay in aroma with nearly nonexistent touch of grassy hops. Really bitter taste with nothing else in it. Light body with thin texture and fizzy carbonation. Bitter, but abrupt finish. Well, I expected little more from it.
It’s a clear golden beer that is easy and refreshing on the palate, not much to say about the flavor won’t buy it again
Not sure what to say about this beer. I see it’s brewed in the Molson Brewery. ’Nuff said.
Bottle->lager glass.  Clear gold with frothy white head.  Grassy and grainy, crisp and bitter.  Ok.

Asahi has been the number1 beer in Japan for a number of years as it was designed to be a dinner beer. It is in fact a great dinner beer and goes very well with food as it does not impart any after tastes. Nice hops and very dry.
As a casual beer or hiking beverage I would say don’t do it, it’s not appropriate. A bit expensive for what it is, but again as a dinner beer and holiday beer, it’s always present.

2 finger head,yellowy light in front,paler darker away,carbinaded,smell is veary light sweet maltyness & butter. Taste is water,a light buttery sourish malty lager. If it’s a true dry beer and its the same way made in Japan as North american dry beers I had then dry beer it is NOT. Draught it is thought,but heavy body. It’s allright.

Appearance:  Straw golden colour, white creamy head, doesn’t last long.
Aroma:  Light bready/cereal aroma, light hop aroma.
Flavour:  Toasted baguette, slight bitterness afterwards, Granny Smith tartness.
Mouthfeel:  Moderate carbonation to reset the palate, malt sweetness first and then a short dry finish, with a little bitterness.
Overall:  Not bad dry lager.
Drunk out of bottle, not much going on here, some skunky flavours of cardboard and sweet corn.

I didn’t mind this one too much for a pale lager. Smooth, light crispness to the nose and mouth. Good flavor and texture, not too grainy. Smooth malt with a faint hop citrus, but mostly malt. It got the job done, I’d say that.

12 oz bottle at Tokyo Sushi Buffet in Pittsburgh.  Dry as a bone and as insipid as sand.  Severe lack of taste, and the carbonation had disappeared before I could finish the glass.  Guess I won’t be ordering this one again.
Yellow beer with a little head. Smells cereal. Taste cereal and metallic, some bitterness. Boring.
Can. Pale yellow color with foamy white medium head, slight citrus aroma, high carbonation, bland taste, abrupt finish. Good for cooling down.

5.0%, pale yellow no head, not much aroma (what smell it did have reminded me of pub toilets), tastes like slightly sweet over carbonated mineral water but dry. I have read reports that state it is refreshing, well so is water and that costs less.

Slightly darker than straw colored with foamy head.  Slightly sour smell of grain and light hops.  Very light flavor of grain with a slight sweetness.  Watery mouthfeel and moderate carbonation.  Like most adjunct lagers.  Light on flavor, aroma and mouthfeel.  Could down them very easily, but why bother. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille. Nez de grains de malt sucrés, légèrement métallique, léger de riz bouilli avec des notes faibles de houblon floral. Assez mince en bouche et moyennement pétillante avec une texture aux notes aqueuses. Goût de grains de malt sucrés et croustillant avec des petites notes métalliques lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi de notes de pain puis en finale, un léger goût rappelant le riz bouilli et des petites notes amères de houblon floral/herbeux. Post-goût un peu sec et très court, très légèrement amer de houblon floral

Draught @ Grand Lisboa Casino, Macau. Nice head and good taste, at least when you are thirsty and drinking it in a hot climate. Tried also in various locations in Hong Kong and it was better than the rest of the typical lagers available there.
Tin.  Pours pale yellow with thin white head.  Too clear.  Light pleasant hop and grass aroma.  Thin flavour, rather too much rice in the mix.  Almost no finish.

Pale gold with a small fizzy head. Aroma of straw and malt. Taste of A bit of maltiness - unexpected in a beer that calls itself "super dry". A bit of adjunct flavor (probably rice) muddles up the otherwise clean profile, almost no palate.

A really disappointing beer. Expected a popular beer to be more body.  Expensive in Victoria b

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap in a stein. Pale amber-yellow body topped by a thick but collapsing head. Couldn’t find much on the nose. Taste is rather watery with some corn and a bit of a hop note at the end. Not a great beer for beer’s sake, although it does go reasonably well with Japanese food.

Crystal clear light golden with thin white head that disappears quite fast. No lacing.
Aroma.. poor malty with some hops.
Very light bodied not intense in any aspects. Bit sweet with bit bitter finish. Lively carbonation.
Overall.. boring "nothing special beer" . Useful for refreshing purposes. Nice appearance pulls rating bit up

Pours a pale translucent golden with a thin patchy white head, aroma is weak light cereal maybe a hint of citrus, taste is fairly inoffensive not much to wow or offend, slight hop bitterness. Nothing wrong with it, 

via Beer Buddy

hay, bread, citrus, pale, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish and dry. 
Pale golden pour with minimal white head that disappears quickly. Dough and some citrus aromas. Thin mouthfeel and only slight carbonation. Mildly sweet/nutty flavour. Mild bitterness lingering with a clean, dry finish.  Thirst quenching, but nothing special here.

A mid golden coloured beer with a weak white head. A slightly floral hop aroma, with a hint of sweetish malt in the background. Dry mouthfeel. A dry taste, mainly of malt, but there is a matching bitterness, coming from the hops, which also give a slightly floral flavour. The suggestion of other cereals can be detected in the finish.

Bottle. Clear, a bit darker, golden colour with head that looks like snow. Taste is kinda heavy, mostly like earth and smoke. Lightly acetic taste at the start turns into a moderate bitter aftertaste.
330 cl bottle. Clear golden color with average, firm white head. Malts and some crispness, but not much aromas. All in all, normal mass lager with nothing much to it.

From a 330ml bottle on 23/11/2012. Pours a clear light golden with a small head that disappears quickly. Has a slightly stale, grainy aroma typical of a macro. The flavour is a slightly unpleasant bready malt and more grain, with some light hops. Not good.

Pale golden look with average white head. Some far aroma of grass and dough. Light sweetness, lightly bitter and ultimately watery. Light body, thin feel, fizzy carbonation and short finish. Not so good.
330 ml can in thailand Chiang Mai. Gekocht in een super markt. Goed fris biertje.
Bottle. Pours clear with a quickæy vanishing white head leaving thin traces. Light golden colour. Light, hoppy and grassy aroma. Grainy taste and watery mouthfeel. Drinkable, but nothing special.

12oz bottle. Brewed by Molson Canada. Clear golden yellow color. Good thin white head, leaves some loose lace. Corn nose. Lagery bread taste, sourdough. Better than most American marco pale lagers I’ve had, though. Carbonation has an odd texture, but it’s definitely not as fizzy or biting, much more smooth. And yes, dry. Maybe some hint of rice. Sweeter taste, light savory, with a little macro bite.
135 ml can. Smells very rice-y of course. Fairly neutral taste with a bit of bitterness. Okay.
Small white head. Clear golden colour. Bitter-sweet rice aroma. A relatively neutral taste and a bitter sake-like palate. Interesting!

0,33l bottle.
Pours yellow golden, medium big lacing head. Aroma grass, water, rice, Palate is soft, mouthful. Carbonation is lively. Taste is sweet, grassy, watery with cardboard flavors. Finish sweet, with medium dry note, with sweet probably rice flavours. Typical lite beer. Not much taste, watery mild and sweetish on corn or rice or whatever ingredients. This one has though decent dry finish which makes not too bad.

(old notes) Bottle to pint glass at a restaurant. Clear straw yellow pour, medium white foamy head. Mostly doughy bread and grass on the nose, both pretty faint. Cereal and a little bitterness with the expected dry finish. Really thin mouthfeel. Washed down the pad thai marginally better than water, but not much going for it.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma bread, malts. 
Taste small bitter, sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Not super but not bad.

Bottle. Clear golden, regual lager looks. Nice white head tough. Skunky aroma, wet grass. Flavour is faint, light bitter. Medium carbo, watery mouthfeel. Decent lager, nothing special. Did not expect it to be.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear gold with about a finger of white head. Aroma of corn and grains. Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Corn and a hint of citrus with a little skunk. Light bodied with a thin yet slightly sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a slightly longer than expected finish. Overall, not bad. I would almost describe this as a "light malt liquor". I would drink it again but wouldn’t seek it out.

Very good beer for an easy drink.
Not a real flavoursome beer but is nice for a hot day.
Aroma is really good to be a lager. Appearance is basic. Taste is really good to be in lager gategory. Really a good beer.
Great beer. Very refreshing with some sweet flavours on the palate. Best served very cold.
Average would describe this perfectly. Typical mass produced product here in the good old usa.

From bottle, normally don’t rate beers like this... Large white head clear hay color corn adjuncts from the nose. Tons of carbonation and light corn flavor, tastes like skunk. Same level as any other american style macro lager.

Aroma: A sweet malty smell, and some alka-seltzer...
Appearance: The beer is slightly hazy light straw colored, a small white head that leaves no lacing.
Taste: The taste is initially white bread, then some lemon and some bitterness.
Palate: Little carbonation, a bit bland, but some dryness in the finish.
Overall: No not really recommended unless you don’t want a beer that is as unobtrusive as possible.
Note: Bottle. Reviewed 2010-09-24.
Beer smell with notes of grass and grain.  Bright pale gold with a very small head.  Balance and not very deep.  Very dry and crisp.

This beer has next to no aroma, and a bad lager flavor. Not good at all. Will not try again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, firm, frothy, foamy, white head. Grassy, grainy aroma. Taste is minimally sweet grainy with a strange vegetable note that may stem from the corn or rice; a touch of citrus flashes up in between.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear yellow with a white head that leaves basically no lacing. Aroma is malt, grain, and some very subdued floral hops Flavour is more of the same – kind of watery.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow, with small white head. Sweet cereal flavor maybe because of the corn. Somewhat bitter at the end. Not impressed at all

On tap at Berkley’s on Ann, Brisbane. Poured a clear pale golden colour with a thin white bubbly head that produced light spotty lacing. Moderate carbonation. Aroma - not much, if any. Taste initally sweet followed by a slight trace of bitterness, but not much to leave an impression. Light body. Mouthfeel thin - bordering on watery.
Yes it is a dry tasting lager so it doesn’t lie, but nor does this make it a good lager.
Very grainy, old lemongrass and tee. Dry taste, quite watery. Neh. (On my Florida trip)
bottle. golden with small head. very light bodied lager with slight bitterness. flavor is pretty subtle overall.

330 cl bottle. It does have a certain taste not usually found in eurolagers but Im not sure if its for the better. Aroma is non-existant. Aftertaste ultra-short. With a spicy japanese dish, why not? Buy again? No.

Light yellow in colour with a really small white head. Noses of some hops and metallic aromas. Light bitter and traces of sourness. Bit fizzy, thin texture with a light body. The bitterness develops a rather dry finish. Its an ok beer.
On tap in Hawkinge @The White Horse Inn. Solid lager with low head and bright golden colour. Sweetish taste of sweet citrus fruits, quite refreshing but nothing special.

On tap in Hawkinge, Kent. A little bit sweetish and refreshing lager. Very drinkable and after a disappointing hürlimann this one was a great experience. Not a huge beer but drinkable and for fans of lighter and sweeter lagers quite recommendable.
pours pale gold. little head retention, fairly heavily carbonated. Light hoppiness on the nose, Watery taste, dry finish
Bottle. Pale gold in colour little aroma. Taste is of a rather dull average pale lager. Not impressed, the bottle looked good though.
Pale clear with a medium head. The taste and aroma is hop and some citrus. Light bitter finish.  Feels quite thin.

We organized a very interesting tasting of Lagers (basic to average quality): 16 different beers from different countries.
Price range: from EUR 0.3/bt (supermarket) to EUR 3.5/bt (take-away at sushi bar).
All beers have been blind-tasted; we were 4 people, great beer lovers and wanted to know If there is a difference between all these basics summer beers. Answer: no all were more our less Shit, but Asahi was the worst, and not the cheapest!!

Here is the ranking:
#1 Sapporo Yebisu
#2 Baltika 3
#3 Duff
#4 Obolon Svitle
#5 Svyturys Ekstra Draught
#6 Heineken
#7 Kirin Ichiban
#8 1664
#9 Carlsberg
#10 Burger
#11 Kronenbourg
#12 Pilsner Urquell
#13 Königsbacher
#14 33 Export
#15 Tsingtao
#16 Asahi
Bomber.  Light lager that lives up to its name with very dry finish.  Light yellow, clear, lots of carbonation.  Works okay with sushi.
Light and airy, aroma of mild sweet hops. Flavour minimal hoppiness, aftertaste of sweet dryness. Czech version.

Det påstås att japaner är ett hunsat folk, att de i spikraka släktled har ärvt disciplin och lydnad och flitighet från sina kuvade förfäder. För att få en känsla för hur det här har gått till kan man använda sin egen tunga som lackmuspapper och doppa den i Asahi Super Dry. Neutraliteten är så översvämmande att den dränker den egna viljan och spolar rent varenda por från säregenheter. Det här ölet piskar en så länge att man är alldeles för utschasad för att knapra i sig moroten när plågan väl är över.

Golden colour, white diminishing head. Aroma of malts, tetra hops and adjunct. Quite sweet, light bitter aroma. Light bitter finish, tetra.

(From 33cL bottle @ local Japanese restaurant, Breda. Brewed in Czech republic.)

At Disney World. The aroma is sweet malt, grass, corn, adjuncts. The appearance is a clear gold, white head. The flavor is malty, metallic, adjuncts. The finish is spicy hops, metal. Medium/thin in body. Bad.
Czech version. Bottle looks simple. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty-wheaty, not very dry. Finish grasy-moldy, too less. Hoppy. Not very drinkable. Not good.
Bottle at sakura sushi.  Soap and grain aroma.  Same in the taste with lemon.  Ok, light and more light - not unpleasant, just watery.

Varför har kamikazepiloter hjälm? Förmodligen av samma anledning som den här drycken har en förföriskt utseende och kittlar gommen innan man ställs inför fullbordat faktum. När den genomfört sitt uppdrag är den inget annat än ett blaskigt fördärv och som ingen hjälm i världen kan rädda livet på.

Siamo ai livelli della Corona et similia.....
paglierino carico con schiuma bianca abb.persistente....
naso non pervenuto.....secca, watery, amara......
da bere giusto al ristorante giapponese, in mancanza di un buon vino e se volete evitare l’acqua......

Boring, tasteless, very basic smell and taste.  Pilsner yeast water, that's it. Pass.
