Taste is also dominated by light sweet malt with a bland finish. Not the worst pale lager out there and with well hidden adjunct it is still quaffable with my sushi.

Bottle. Clean, clean, clean! Poured a very pale yellow with a thin white head, quickly gone. This beer is basically Perrier with hops, and not much hops at that. Clean crisp and utterly watery, but the nose has a surprisingly hoppy note. Not what I’d call assertive by any means but surprising considering how pedestrian and watery all other facets of this beer were.
500ml can at Samura Japanese Restaurant, Cambridge.  Poured a light gold with a small head.  A eurolager from the far east.  Drinkable, but forgettable.

Pours a golden yellow with thin white head.  Grassy, grainy aroma.  Flavor is rice and a hint of sweet malt.  Light mouthfeel and dry finish.  Typical Japanese lager--light and refreshing, but no real flavor.
Bottle @ Italy. Pours clear golden with a small white head and lacings. Clean and mild. Nose of hay, buiscuit and hops.  A bit sweet and watery. Dry with a fairly smooth mouthfeel and crispyness. OK
Pours a clear pale yellow with a big white head that quickly disappears.  Almost no aroma, or taste( a little bit of corn), but goes down easy.

Very little head, lots of taste of corn and hops, kind of a plain beer but goes well with sushi as it doesn’t overpower the soft tastes. A real Vancouver sushi-bar staple, but hell no, not a great beer.

Sampled at Mexicali´s Baja Beers Fest Friday 2009 Really avergae really, altough good ingredients and stuuf, this taste like a first-class japanesse Budweiser rip-off and quite expensice 8 dlls a cup!!

Bottle.  Mmm, I love slumming it.  Sweet adjuncty (mostly corn) nose with some cereal grain.  Super pale golden with a large rocky white head.  Taste is lightly crisp and refreshing, with a corn and grain aftertaste, but they have the naming all wrong here - this is incredibly sweet.  Compared to recent pale lagers - better than Heinekin, better than Sapporo Light but not regular.  Light-medium body and with only a mild hangover portended.

The European variety, bottled. I’ve been shunning this for 3 years assuming I’d rated it. Bright gold with a tall foamy head subsiding to a rim. Sweet hay, honey, peanut and almond aroma merging into wet grass and sickly almond. A surprising bite of dryness as proclaimed on the bottle; faint pine and lemon hop attempts, crisp nutty pale malt, rubber, blossom, some cooked vegetables and brine. Quite astringently bitter in the finish, with some popcorn softness. Technically sound if unexciting pilsy lager, possibly benefiting from its Czech provenance.

Had this at Sharaku sushi bar near St. Marks, NYC and didnt like it at all.  

Rerate 8.6.09 - Stuck to this like glue in tokyo, relatively good with food.  Sharp and dry with fruit notes.

Bottle. Golden and quite flat. Cardboard
like flavour is a bit off putting. Slight maltiness but not a very impressive beer.

On draft @ Narita hotel. Virtually no aroma - very faint rice. Initially tastes light sweet malt and rice, finish is, yes, very dry. Almost like you never drank it. All in all - it’s not bad, and  whilst here in Japan, it’s generally the best on offer.
Pale yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of corn, barley and weak hops. A flavor of malt and hay.
Molson version pours clear golden with a big white head. Aroma is sweet malt, metal. Flavor is sweet malt, grass, dry finish.
iL Can. These type of beers, can’t be asked for much flavor wise, was very drinkable, did finish the entire liter.
Bottled. Clear, pee yellow with a tiny head. Aroma - not much of one. Flavor is typical of an Asian lager. Not much to talk about, but at least I drank the whole bottle.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet aroma with cardboard notes. Flavor goes the same way...it is what it is...
Bottle 33 cl. Pours a pale yellow with a small white head and an aroma of hops and cardboard. The taste is also hoppy with a slight maltiness and some yeast. Drinkable, but not much more
Draught at Bento while eating sushi !!!!! Clear yellow - white head. Light malty, sharpness, light , hoppy, straw, hay, citrus. Plain - but works with sushi.

Overall Impression: 
Had this one a few different times, usually with dinner at a Japanese place &#40I mean they don’t offer great beer, so you might as well be authentic&#41
Bottle. Very sweet and very hoppy. Dry and a little bitter.  Not bad, very drinkable , like most Asian beers.

Enjoyed a number of times at Genghis Grill. Pours a pale golden pils color with ample white head. Aroma is very dry and clean with pils/rice on the nose. Taste is quite dry, refreshing, and crisp. Very nice/refreshing macro Japanese beer that is quite enjoyable and refreshing on its own and that is the best for Sake bombers.
On tap @ Bento. Clear and pale golden in colour with a medium sized white head. Quite refreshing, but also quite anonymous.

Purchased at Planet Hollywood in LV, this is in the 1000ml can for a good price of $3.50. Typical pale lager, slightly sweet malt and yeast. Dry light and perfect for walking around casinos and getting hammered.The pure experience of slamming cans of this on the Strip makes this rate slightly higher.

~Pours a clear pale gold color with small white head.
~Aroma of sour hay and sweet malts.
~Sweet rice flavor. Malts and rice. Perhaps a slight bitterness.
~Dry, light feel. Makes mouth pucker up desiring more liquid. Feels like it dries up before it hits your throat.
~ I like the rice flavor. Unfortunately the beer is pretty bland. Not bad just eh.
From canada.  Twist off cap. Looks like ubiquitous pale lager. Taste is a sharper clean sterile flavor. Decent carbonation. Not too bad.

330 ml bottle. Brewed by Staropramen in Czech Rep. From Tallinn, Estonia.

Deep golden colour with medium size white head. Grainy malt and corn aroma. Grainy malt flavour with corn. Some sweetness. Quite uninteresting.
Thanks to Maniac. Clear gold with a medium white head. Aroma was corn and ginger. Flavor was the same. Inoffensive beer flavored water.

Bottle from World Market on 04/24/2009. Very clear pale yellow body with a medium frothy white head. Corn and pale malt aroma. Corn and cheerios flavor. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.

500ml can 

5.1% ABV 

I tried this beer on August 13, 2008 after purchasing from one of my local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a translucent pale gold colour with very little head.  The aroma was grainy malt with some hoppiness.  The mouthfeel was thin bodied, watery, and highly carbonated.  The flavour is grainy and otherwise tasteless.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Grainy/husky, metallic, hay, faint hops, cooked vegetables, a bit of sweetness.
gold blond coloured little sparkling body with a white head a herby hoppy aroma a hoppy herby spicy taste with a herby bitter finish
Clear golden blond coloured beer with small white head and midium carbonation. Herby slightly hoppy aroma. Medium palate bit sparkling. Finish is sweeter bitter dry. Good one fo tJapanese beer.
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is pilsner malts, skunk, rice, rice, honey, a little floral, and some peppery hops.  Flavor is honey, vanilla, floral, and a mild pepper hop finish.
Can. Very dry beer. Taste is rice and corn..Nothing too flavorful. Mouth drys the mouth.

330 mL Bottle. Straw yellow with a thin fizzy white head leaving no lacing to speak of. Aroma is cereals, somewhat biscuity, and an innuendo of wet dog just in from the rain. The flavor is better than the smell; it has a certain crispness to it, some malt to it but rice appears to be a predominant adjunct making for a very thin taste. The aftertaste? It’s hard to describe; no it’s not metallic but it is strange, kind of like wasabi minus the burning sensation. Super Dry says it for the finish and that seems to be this beer’s best feature. I’ll have it with my sushi but that’s the extent of it.
Bottle. Pours light golden with a moderate white head, which disappear fast.Grainy aroma, metallic sweet taste, unpleasant

can, golden colour, white head dissapearing much too fast, tastes like a real artificial-beer, a bit grainy but not enough, sweet, no big taste or big palate and the little things I taste stink a little bit, but it’s drinkable
Pours a clear light yellow.  Aroma is very faint, but that of dough and grain.  Taste is very light and lively with hints of grain.  Not that great, but not horrible.

Multiple tastings. Catching up on some of the beers I drank in the past - this is one of those crappy beers that I only drink at jaapanese restaurants if there are no other choices. I try to avoid beers like this.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a very pale yellow with a two finger white head.  The aroma was mainly corn.  The flavor was metallic, with a grassy finish.
Bland...near colorless.  Corn on nose and taste.  I did not pick up the metallic taste as mentioned.

(Bottle on 2009-03-07) Golden and clear. Medium sized quickly disappearing white head. Meltallic and grassy aroma. Light, dry palate with lot of carbonation. Metallicness, grass, bitterness, wateriness and sweetness in taste. Short bitter aftertaste.

No 702

Rated: 06.03.2009

Bottle brown, 330 ml

Appearance: Pours hazy and with sediments, nasty looking, pale and poor golden body with a very weak carbonation, head is initially medium, white, frothy, slowly decreasing to small, nice lacing, quite firm head in deed.

Aroma: Front is artificial, alien, unfamiliar, werid, strange, bizarre, quite strongly alcoholic and without character, very weak, reduced to nothing, thanks its not repulsive.

Flavour: Totally repulsive, harsh, agressive, very nasty-dry front, sandy-rough texture on palate, very unpleasant sensation, no malty sweetness in base, some aromatic, herbal hoppyness and sour, nasty aftertaste, leaves parched aftertaste and palate overally, finish duration is long, rice, corn and general kingdom of adjuncts, sauerkraut.

Palate: Body is light, texture is dry, carbonation on palate is rather weak, finish feel is nasty dry, weak wattery, plastic, artificial, rough and sandy, nasty oriented impression on palate.
Poco da dire su questa lager bionda giapponese,aroma nullo,gusto poco di più,molto acquosa...in breve: mai più.

bottle from a thai place in knoxville suburbs. between the other two (sapporo and hitachino) in terms of color. this helped with the spicy food great. smelly distantly of fruit. sweet again. not dry, despite the bottle saying it’s super dry.....  that was the rating from my blackberry.  if it’s incomprehensible, sorry.
A slightly metallic taste prevents this from being better.  Finish isn’t "Super" dry, maybe mega dry, ultra dry, but not super.
Golden yellow in color, true to its name of Super Dry.  A very dry finish with a crispness in the end.  Overall a dry beer with nothing special to it.
Pale yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of straw and pale malts. Flavor of sweet malts and corn, some yeast and bread towards the finish. Crisp. Light body.

500 ml can from the LCBO. pours pale yellow with a fizzy white head. almost no aroma when cold but as it warms you get some nice pale lager grain. very clean aroma but there just isnt much of it. the flavour is also quite clean. no hops show at any time but the finish is quite dry. the corn doesnt show and this one goes down easy. would make a nice golf course summer brew.

Bottle. Pours a light golden yellow, little head.  Smells is not enough to comment on.  Taste is limited, and dry.  Very little malty sweetness, mostly subdued hops dryness. Little character to this brew.

Clear yellow. This lager is simple in taste. Light malt and hops flavours. Has a grainy complexion to it and, the alcohol stands out moderately. Light body too. Some sweetness in the middle and medium bitterness at the end. True to its name - dry. Crisp and clean generally. But, there’s a little metallic twang somewhere, which is a bit of a put off. I guess it’s easy to pair with most foods.

This is actually not a bad beer. It had a nice sweet taste to it. It was a fairly decent pale lager. Not a bad palate,but still, pale lagers are always too thin for me. The beer beer had a somewhat dry finish. I wouldn’t say this has a "super dry" palate, but it was slighty dry. Had this at Ru Sans in Atlanta. Overall, a decent pale lager that is above the other cheap pale lagers.
Yellow beer with a small white head. Some grains in the moderated aroma. Weak body with a strong carbonation, grassy hop, some malt-corn taste, watery texture.
Solid corn yellow with a thin white cover.  Corn, metal, grainy malt aroma.  Taste is cheap, corn and metal.
Clear golden colour, medium white head. Aroma has faint malts and grain. Flavour has sweet malts. Dry finish.

Found this a local Japanese joint.  Pours a clear golden in color with medium carbonation and a thin white head.  A little sweet scent but otherwise almost no aroma.  Sweet corn flavor up front with a crisp alcohol presence about half way through and a very dry finish.  Overall the beer isn’t half bad when served ice cold and flavor is very non-offensive since there isn’t much there and palate is fairly decent for a light lager.

smells of gun metal and water soaked rice ... very fizzy white head .. muddled slight bitterness .. might be good with sushi but avoid in any other scenario .. well sir, i might not agree with what you have to say but i’ll defend to the death your right to say it ..
Pours yellow with a white head.  Flavor is crisp, but bland.  A little better than some other macro lagers, but nothing amazing.  Refreshing though.

Pours a typical lagerish clear yellow, OK white head. Aroma is crisp, simple, not too strong. Flavor is crisp, strong, malty, better than most macro lagers if lacking in complexity. Texture is fairly smooth and firm, not at all watery. Not great, but acceptable.
Brewed in tokyo, 1000ml can. Slightly sweet crisp lager aroma. Fairly dry lager, very sligght bitterness on the finish. Good drinkable lager.

pours a transparent golden color with a thick white head
Taste good for a pale lager with some malt and sweet taste

12 oz bottle

12 oz bottle.  Pours a crystal clear pale golden color with a nice frothy white head that had decent retention and nice lacing.  Very nice looking beer.  The aroma is slight malt and a bit of cooked veggies.  Flavor is well...your typical pale lager.  Very slight malt sweetness with a backing of cooked corn.  It does finish dry but not as dry as something calling itself "super dry".  Not really a big fan of the style, but I’m sure it would be good paired with some sushi.

Bottle from Trader Joe’s. Pours a had that quickly dissipates. Clear golden color. Almost no aroma. Taste is, like the other fella’ said, prickly. A good bit of carbonation. Mildly bitter taste. Overall pretty tasty. Not too complex. A very...tight beer.

Oct 11, 2006  
Bottle at Saporo in A’dam. Tall, tall head. Prickly lager taste. Always coupled with sushi, for me, so goes down delisciously. Refreshing.
This clear yellow beer poured with a semi-thick white head and a musty aroma. There is almost no flavor. It’s like drinking stale water.

330ml bottle (Rimi, Tallinn) - BUL in Czechia<br />
Mid gold, scummy head. Sweet malty aroma. Fairly bland lagery taste, with a subtle hint of papery hops, fortunately without any nastiness. Actually drinkable.
12 ounce bottle at Pei Wei Rest. Pembroke Pines, FL Available at Total Wine for $1.49. Good.
Golden colour with a thin white head. Weak malty aroma. The flavour is malty and a bit sweet. Finish is dry and slightly bitter.

this beer pairs very well with food. Its got a light refreshing taste but still has a nice dry finish that allows the flavors to stick to your palette a little longer. I like this beer actually, its unique  IMO...

Bottle in Fuji restaurant in Braine L
Alleud. It was cold and refreshing but thats it. Quite watery.

Clear goldern colour, small thin head little aroma. watery, just another beer
a little drier than most but nothing xciting
Clear golden colour with large white fluffy head.Taste of hops and malt.Flavor is thin and watery with thin body.Short mild finish.
Clear yellow with no head. Minimal aroma and flavours present. Flavour lives up to the name and has a somewhat dry finish from rice adjuncts. Another overpriced trendy beer around these parts.

Pours clear pale yellow with a couple fingers of white head. Aroma fairly sweet and honeyish. Mouthfeel fairly smooth and refreshing, but a bit prickly. A bit dry. Flavor is a bit sweet and bready with some paperiness. Decent enough for the style. Bottle from Rum Runner.
Not much character.  A few hops here and there, otherwise pretty characterless.  Not worth the effort.
Fizzy yellow color pour with a small head.  Pretty typical macro lager.  A hint of hops and lemon.  Watery.  Just a beer.
Pale yellow with a short lived white head.  Clean crisp hoppy smells.  Light malts and lemony hops.  Week and watery. Meek.
Average piss yellow pour. Smells grainy. Tastes grainy, and alcoholic like a bad malt liquor. Goes down hard like medicine.
golden yellow with large white head.  Sickening corny, sweet butter smell.  Like drinking water.  A little bitterness.  Avoid if possible.
Well, definitly not ""super dry""... have to say the flavour of cardd board was so dominant, that i did not find any kin d af dryness.... or anything else than card board.

500ml can from the LCBO
Looks and tastes like water
Might as well be a light beer
Not bad but very standard. Light body, not much aroma. Golden coloured with a fast diminishing white head. (Bottle 33cl)
poured from a bottle had a nice smooth light flavor,  Goes great with sushi  and habachi.
bottle. has a nasty skunky aroma. medium yellow in color with a thin tan head. very plain tasting with no real bite.

Not much aroma which is great when paired with seafood and sushi.  Flavor is light, again coplementing japanese dishes.  Light on the palate.  Overall, a good light drinking brew with an excellent flavor with sushi and seafood.
golden, clear, frothy, medium bitterness, long finish, light body, lively, average lager from staropramen brewer in czech rep.

Boring and forgettable.  It’s aroma is absent, maybe some hops.  It looks like a thirst quencher.  That’s sort of my base marking though, so really nothing special.  Golden color, common to pales.  It’s flavor is nothing special.some unbalanced hop and malt flavors.  It’s a chore to drink.  I didn’t like it at all.
Almost no aroma. Poured clear pale amber with a thin fizzy head. Dry finish but not much in flavour.  Went well with the curry dip I was snacking on.

Bottled poured into pint glass at a great sushi place in LA. This is not an overly fantastic beer by any stretch but it really does go well with sushi. I enjoyed the crisp flavor to accompany the fish and rice. Good pairing.
Little taste.  Aroma is slightly malty.  Are there hops here???  It is 9 percent above malt liquor and natural light! Nice gold color though.

Had Asahi super dry in a perfect temp 500ml can at a sushi place last night. Goes good with saki. Not an everyday beer it tastes a little too metallic and dry but it is fantastic for spicy foods. I recomend this not only with sushi but it would be good with a hot curry. Pours nice and clean with fresh aroma. Tastes a little like a weißbier becuase if the certian type of grains in it. I would get this beer again especially in the winter.

Had with a meal somewhere. Looks like a lager and tastes like one. Pretty average, not that dry, not that flavoursome. A little metallic and watery with a decent hint of malts. Not terrible by any stretch and if I want back to the same restaurant, I’d certinaly pick this over the usual carling type lagers on offer in England.

I had this at a Japanese restaurant, and this was fairly light and went extremely well with my meal.  It is light and refreshing with a golden color and moderate head.  Finishes cleanly and was very good, though I am not sure how well it would be for all day drinkability.
Had at a sushi restaurant. Yellow color with moderate white head. fairly effervescent and not much going on aroma or with the flavor. A little dry, I guess. Not very impressed.
An educative experience, Bitter flavour, with corn like flavour and ricy after taste. Very light body with a white head that faints before you say "Asahi Super Dry".
33cl bottle, pale yellow colour, medium white head, lively carbonation, malt and watery aroma, light sweet flavor, light bitter finish, simple and boring pale lager

I lived in Japan and really liked this beer. It was always reliable when you were out and needed a drink. Now it’s nostalgic more than anything else. I like it when having rice based meals. It just works good that way.

Served in a lager glass from a 330ml. bottle. Nothing special but, a good drop for a thirsty drinker. Inoffensive taste of grain, rice etc. Not a "trashy" or fantastic lager but worth drinking while watcing a game on t.v.
Bottle, 330ml/500ml.  Light yellow, bready aroma.  A bit crisp, slighty watery, quite fresh when cold.  Thirst quencher.

Had in a 0.5 L can. Pours a gold colour with a frothy finger sized white head. Smells skunky, cheap and of rice and grass. Taste is of subtle malts, rice and hops. In my opinion, it is just like other Asian Beers- Tiger, Tsingtao, Yinjang, Sapporo, etc. Cheap and plain.
Bottle @ Sushi bar. Straw golden colour, frothy white head. Aroma of grass, malts, hops. Flavour is dry, grainy and hoppy. Bitter finish. Dry mouthfeel. Nice lager.

Worth saying MOST of the reviews on the first page are not drinking the Japanese Super Dry but their own version (made under license). So take their reviews with a pinch of salt. Bought it at 7-11 in Yong-he Taipei. Crisp, easy to drink little bit ricey , its got a slightly malty after taste which doesnt last too long. Super dry has a miscellaneous quality in that it is easy to drink and is addictive in the sense that you can drink a pint of it and never get bored of it’s taste. It goes down so easily and is perfect with food. I really can’t say enough positive things about this lager despite it’s mild taste. After 10 years of living in Asia it has surpassed my love of Euro lagers and is now my fave lager. Good stuff.

500mL can from the LCBO, because I felt like having a generic crappy Asian lager. Pours a nice gold, with a medium white frothy head, and a curious looking single strand of bubbles coming from the bottom of  the glass that looks like a tornado. The taste is, super dry! Super clean! Super so-so! Actually it’s decent for what it is, a little dry all the way through but with some alright malty sweetness of no particular distinction. Almost a creamy touch to it in the finish. Mouth-feel is good for a pale lager. Considering the sheer amount of adjuncts used in it it’s actually not undrinkable, but I think I can actually taste the rice, making it seem like some sort of Sake-Lager hybrid. Hits the spot nicely on this gloomiest of days I’ve been having. Also with some weird and unnatural adjuncty fruity elements, most notably banana. "Fresh, crisp and clear - with a sharp delivery that slakes thirst before slipping gently on.", uh, yeah! Whatever that means..........

Pretty decent beer overall, used to have a girlfriend that kept this around the house constantly.  Just a bit of a step up from your typical pale lagers.  Creamy mouthfeel, light carbonation, smooth and dry in the finish.

This is a very crisp and easily drinkable beer but there’s just nothing special about it. I’m not sure what the price is because I got a free sample at work but it’s not one that I would go out of my way for.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. It poured a pale orange colour with a medium head that vanished quickly in the glass. The aroma smells of rice and soil. The flavour is bitter and tastes of rice, water and a hint of malts. It has a very short aftertaste.
Clear and golden. Smooth, but at the same time quite tasty. A bit sweet and bitter. Tasted good on a summer day.
Pale golden color, very fizzy white head. Mostly malt and cereal aromas. Light bodied and probaby a bit over carbonated. Not terrible.
Pours a clear pale yellow colour. head is odd, off white but sits like a ring around the top of the brew. aroma is awful. rice, rice milk, straw, and ewe shit. BLEGH!
Pale yellow, aroma of breweing cereal and some strong notes of earth and dirt. Flavor a little bit better, the bitterness is actually there but overall its thin and the finish is quite metallic.
Bottle: Poured a golden color with a medium white head. The aroma was sweet with some hops. Taste continues sweet with barely and hops, finish is drying acidic.
Poured pale yellow with no head.  Nothing special in the aroma or flavor.  Taste crisp and empty bodied.
Pretty much tastes like a dry Bud Light. A standard beer. Not much of a aftertase of any taste at all. Not a bad beer but not very special at all.
Fairly standard lager pour and look, taste is pretty decent, crisp and refreshing, nice enough for a lager when kool.
Not bad at all, went down smooth, with a grainy,  clean taste. Malty finish. Nothing special at all, but overall I was pleased.

12 oz bottle into shaker.  Not as bad as expected.  Firstly it is the only pale lager I have ever seen that exhibited great lace (!?); and had longest lasting head I have seen on a PL.  Pretty good for a style faint aroma and flavor of hops and corn.  Overall: extremely simple and basic - a victim of its own style IMO - but still highly drinkable and definitely worth grabbing over a Miller, AB, or any other cheap domestic PL if at a Japanese restaurant.

I’ve lived in Japan for coming up to 7 years and I can honestly say that this is the worst of the real beers. That is, the ones that are actually allowed to write ’beer’ on the can/bottle.

Pours a super-gigantic head that tastes slightly better than the actual liquid.  I’ve drunk copious amounts of this stuff and for the first time tonight I’ve tried to discern some actual flavours.  At a loss, I’ve deferred to my wife who said, ’it tastes light’.  This is from a woman that literally gets smashed on half a 330ml can. That says it all.  Tastes like water and plays havoc with your digestive tract in the morning (probably due to the amount of chemicals used in the making). The colour induces images of sickness with its pasty hue. 

Its one saving grace is its smell, which reminds me of the stale beer smell outside pubs of questionable reputation (The White Horse / Live and Let Live - Coventry) -I love that miasma.

Draft at a ramen place. Surprisingly not terrible, this was very mild with a pure, clean barley flavor. No hops, but an easy drinker. Not the nastiness I associate with American pale lagers by any means.

From can.  Pours a bright piss color with large white head.  Aroma of nothing and grass and grain.  Flavor is also grainy, thin and a touch sweet.  Finishes (true to the name) quite dry and amazingly devoid of flavor.  Refreshing, but very forgettable.

12oz bottle: Flat yellow pour with a spritzy head that really wants to fade fast.  The nose is predictible - vegetal with some wet hay.  The body is so light on this.  I am really surprised actually - at 5% they must use a bunch of adjuncts to thin it out.  As far as flavor, you’d be hard pressed to find any.  Watery, thin texture dilutes the small amount of corny malt that is perceivable.  No hops whatsoever.  Man, this would be great after an hour of mowing the 95 degree heat, but isn’t good for much else.  Not flawed, just not interesting at all.

Bottle.  Pale straw color with a white head.  Faint aroma, a little grainy and some mild hops... very weak.  Same can be said for the taste, though there is a decent malty sweet base that stands along a better than average body for the style.
three 16 lounge in hamilton, ON.  thin and watery, not much flavour.  a little disappointed.  worth trying once, but not twice.

world market tallahassee, bottle, thin and watery, weak gold pour. flavor less except for minor grain and maybe just a touch of malt but kinda hard to find in all the water. i guess it would be good to wash something down if it was spicy. not worth the money.
Best Jap beer out of the ones you’ll find in the states.  Amazing with japanese cusine.

Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Carbonation is decent. Faint aroma of grain and fruit??. Slight sweetness and a bit of bitterness in the finish. No great guns but altogether a crisp refreshing beverage quite suited for enjoyment with Japanese cuisine. Kampai!

Subtle simple syrup and puffed rice nose.  Pale yellow, small head that dissipated quickly.  Slightly stale malt sweetness, mild bitterness. Big carbonation, crisp, but nothing remarkable.  Not offensive, but not very good.
...bottle.  Thin, dry, watery, ricey, flavorless.  Good to cleanse away a spicy dish if they don’t have anything else relatively decent.  Otherwise, no point to drink this overpriced, tasteless brew.

In Australia we get the Thai brewed version which costs more than something brewed in Europe. Work that one out. I’m not a big fan of it. My rating is based on the Japanese brewed version. For some reason, when I’m in Japan, I really enjoy drinking the local macros (Asahi, Kirin and Sapporo). They compliment the food and seem to taste much better over there (probably some sort of placebo effect, who knows). I’m suprised to read that a previous rater has stated that it pours a head which lasts - it certainly doesn’t!

Still the classic Japanese beer, I’ve tried numerous others and this one I always come back too. Crisp, clean drying lager that probably started the "dry" style in Australia. The Japanese version is the best I’ve tried.
Pours a straw yellow with white head.  Sweet malty and grain, with some yeast on the nose.  Flavor is crisp with sweet grain, and malt.  Light crisp body with a tangy finish.

Pors pale golden with a beatiful 1.5 inch white head that lasts. It has god bubbling and medium lacing. Aroma is of  bland malt and hops. and smels slightly sweet. Flavor is crisp, well balnced malty and hoppiness, and refreshing, and only a little sweet. Texture is average, a little watery, but not bad, and carbonation is good. Finish is a little sweet and sour.

Pours a pale golden color with frog-eye-sized bubbles forming a quickly disipitating head.  Despite the unusually large bubbles, there was some lace retention visible on the glass.  On the nose, aromas of zesty citrus rind, sweet cereal grains, and caramel.  Light bodied with lots of fizzy effervescence.  Sweet malty start quickly gives way to a short, crisp, finish that is, of course, very dry.  This was a surprisingly refreshing brew.  Despite being ostracized for the dubious distinction of introducing the world to "dry beer," Asahi Super Dry deserves its place in Beer history and is worth seeking out as an alternative to the usual pale lagers.  Very versatile, try with a spicy sushi roll or fresh calamari salad.

Bottle. Yellow with some white head. Grain aroma. Light body and lively carbonation. Flavour is grain with some sweetness, maybe a slightly fruity taste and a little metallic bitterness in the finish. Overall it’s refreshing and reasonably drinkable, but far from exceptional.

This, shockingly, is not as bad as the elitest rank it here on ratebeer.
Yes, it’s pale lager made with adjuncts but it’s ’’super dry’ and it’s finish keeps it from being a terrible beer.
Better than rated.
633ml bottle from Country Club Liquors; Nose is slightly fruity with a light caramel malt note; clear gold with a medium off white head; flavor is light grassy hops  with a little sweetness.
Clear golden with medium white head. Sweet aroma with cardboard notes. Flavor goes the same way. Ends sweet.

I’ve said it before... I wish they had a nostalgia rating.  If they did, this beer would get higher score than it did.  I really enjoy this beer and it reminds me of my years living in japan.  it really isn’t any better (or worse) than any major us or canadian macro.  i wish i could get a hold of some Japan brewed stuff.
Bottle.  A piss poor yellow foam with artifical  carbonation.  Nose and taste are corn and rice.

Poured from bottle 5/2008.  Malt aroma, not much else.  A bit darker than I expected.  Any head disappears quickly.  Actually a pepper flavor along with the dominant malt.  Something like hops in there too, noticed in the burnt veggie aftertaste.  OK finish.  Could be good with Indian food.  Not bad, drinkable brew.
Pale yellow with aroma of light corn.  Taste is of corn, with a dry astringent finish.  Kind of thin and watery, but better than an American macro.
Yes, this is my beer of choice with sushi.  Crisp and refreshing.  I don’t drink it any other time except at Japanese restaurants.

pours like you expect from a pale lager, straw-colored and with little head. No detectable aroma except for a touch of wheatiness. Taste is much like an american macro light beer, that is, what taste?

22oz bottle. clear and really clean yellow color. not much odor. really watery and light. this is the brew of choice at the best sushi bar in Vegas. the chefs can pound this shit all night and still not cut their fingers off. i only drink this when they buy me one. but late night, it’s OK.
500ml Bottle - Clear, clean golden colour, very fine light white head, crisp clean taste, nicely dry, slight bitter, very good beer, easy drinking, beautiful cold on a hot summer day, very very good

Straw gold with good, white head / Mild grain nose / Light bodied, crisp with fine carbonation, and surprisingly good dry, slightly bitter, wheat finish / Simple but clean flavors of corn and wheat / A very well made beer, for what it is.

bottle.  golden pour.  wow.  I’m really suprised at a 9 percentile rating. Don’t get me wrong this isn’t a great beer but its a pretyy descent brew.  I prefer Kirin usually.  Still.   drank with Sushi.  Dry, crisp, light and goes down easy.  not bitter or sour.  works for me.

33.8 ounce novelty can. Not much flavor here to speak of, though a little. Better than Sapporo in my opinion, though that’s not saying much. This seems like the Coors Light of Japan to me, but in a much cooler jumbo-motherfuckin’-can, thus a novelty, if nothing else, to be walking around a party showing everyone your massive silver unit.

Pours light gold color with a small white head, no lacing.
Aroma is minimal.
Taste is super light, clean and crisp.
A good beer with a meal. Little character but a nice sightly bitter dry finish. A good beer for people who don’t like beer. Despite the light character it has a pretty good kick for such a light tasting beer. Good thirst quencher.

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, this was nothing special.  Japanese macrobrew with watery flavors.  Refreshing for washing down wasabe, but not much else.
this beer is boring but has a clear refreshing taste.white thin head leave alot to wish for.in a pinch a ok beer to drink.

CAN: Sometimes a super cold beer with no flavour is refreshing. So ya, have some sushi and a super cold Japanese beer. I swear there is no smell to this beer. Watery yellow, kind of sweet taste if any taste can be found.
Re-rating: not too bad and it is quite different to the other macro lagers for the rice They used for brewing.  Crisp and tasty.

Gold colour good carbonation,head thin back to lace.Aroma,hops plesant,bread notes,malt.Flavour good hop taste and bitter,sweet malt,better than sapporo,nice dry bitter sweet finish,good thirst quencher.

0.5l can. Pours a golden yellow, high carbonation, sparse head. Smell is pungent hops and yeast. Very strong, not pleasant. Palette is smooth and fizzy - carbonation is strong. Taste is watery, but it’s mostly just tasteless. It doesn’t taste bad, at least..
Looks like a pale lager.  Aroma is bit of hop and grass.  Flavor is a somewhat dry with some bitterness.  No much happening here.

Yellow fizzy beer with light malt, corn, and grassy hop aroma. Flavor is light, crisp and refreshing with notes of corn/rice sweetness. Works well with sushi. Is really nothing more than a palate cleanser.

Bottle. Quite hoppy, grass and citrus, light bread. Yellow clear body, average white foamy head. Light sweet start, then it gets very fast very dry, light bitter finish. Short duration. Light body, dry and a little bit watery, lively carbonation. Normal lager, nothing else to say...
1 L can.  Pours a pale golden yellow.  Slightly dry finish, but not quite as dry as I would have predicted.  Paired well with the sushi I just finished.
Lata. Color dorado. Espuma con retención media. Aroma casi imperceptible. Sabor algo amargo con un final metálico. Pobre como casi todas las pale comerciales.
16 0z. bottle, nice dry lager with good body and a lot of nice crispness, not a big beer but has a nice bite and taste to it

Bottle. Small fizzy white head that mostly diminished, very little lacing, transparent, fast rising carbonation, and a yellow hue. Nose was semi-crisp, some rice and corn notes, and lightly hoppy. Ditto for the flavor. Yuck!! Mouthfeel was somewhat tingly. Light-medium body. Thanks, but no thanks. This was close to being a drainpour. Lacks character, aroma and flavor. Do not waste your time and money with this one IMO.

Bottled. This is so bland and favourless it makes almost no impression whatsoever. The only hint of flavour is from the rice, which, as far as I’m concerned, shouldn’t be there anyway. Indeed, it is so lacking in any flavour or character whatsoever, you can see why people who don’t like beer feel cosmopolitan when drinking this swill.
Clear gold, no head.  Timid aroma of grain and hops.  taste is also blah...sweet; dry finish.  A little if unclean.

Bottle at Kyoto in Santa Barbara.   Pale with a fluffy head.   Very light aroma is a little metallic.   Flavor is clean and dry, but pretty empty.   The dryness has kicked everything else out.   Easy to chug for saki bombs though.
Külsőre nincs benne semmi különös,talán egy kicsit gyorsan esik össze a habja.Illata visszafogott és az íze is.Talán egy fokkal jobb az ice söröknél de nem fogok utána kapkodni.

A Mes rate: Bottle in a church.
Ok it’s a converted church that is now a venue. The church was amazing. The beer wasn’t. Metallic coated cardboard box with a bit of the cereal still left in aaaaaaand... yeah I’m done.

I’ve had this beer a couple of times and, to it’s credit, I’ve had the same experience each time. For me, the aroma is the worst part. It doesn’t smell right. A little burnt bitterness. Just a weak, musty stale smell. The pour is weak but it actually forms nicely at the end. This beer is pretty consistent from first sip to final sip. I find it works well with steaks and mexican food, actually. A decent option.
Very heavy and dry beer, tastes good would like to have it with some food next time, would buy again!
from a 32 ounce can, poured clear with a fair amunt of head.  Not much flavor with a lingering finsh.

Dinner with Heidi Kim on Feb 12, 2008 in the Acko Lounge Sushi Bar.  Imported brown bottle with silver label. Nothing special about this, just another pale lager from Asia. Went well with my sushi so I won’t complain too much, slight better than most pale lager available here but it just didn’t stand out.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a brief head and an awful stale lager smell - why did I order this? Taste delivers exactly what the aroma promises: crappy lager. Overcarbonated. If I had been at home it would have been a drain-pour, but as it was I was eating sushi and was thirsty. Never again.

Pours out of the can a clear golden color with a thick and lively head. Aroma is light of corn and hops. Well I’ll give them one thing, it sure does finish dry. Pretty clean little beer all in all. Taste is crisp and heavily carbonated. Not too bad I guess.
Served at Azuma in Houston.  Bottle poured into a tall flute glass.  Big white head, golden in color with no apparent smell.  Taste rice, corn, with a dry aftertaste.  It is what it is.
I have enjoyed this beer on a number of occasions however the truth of it is it is largely uninspiring.

They’re really not kidding when they say super-dry. Not too much finesse to this beer, it relies on its brute force to push a dry maltiness to your tongue, adequate carbonation, and not much else. Drinkable, but not quenching.
Bottle. Pale golden colored. A small white head. Water all the way! Some dryness in the non existent flavor.

Pleasantly surprised by this one... Poured a very clear yellow/gold color with a medium foamy, white head.  Aroma was almost non-existent, but dry and of a little hops.  Flavor was surprisingly complex for such a light beer... dry, floral, citrus, yeast, and cereal were present.  Went well with the hibachi steak I had.

16 oz. bottle.

12oz Can - The Liquor Collection - Honolulu, Hawaii 

2008 – Great Hawaii Beer Run

Aroma – Light lager aroma with some light hops bitterness. 

Appearance – Light golden color, nice head and clear.   

Flavor – A light pale flavor.  Very little to no hops tasted.  
 
Palate – Had nice Mouthfeel, easy to drink and a good beer for a super hot day. 

Overall – A decent beer could have been much worse but it was a good Pale lager.

12oz bottle poured in an English pint.  ASD pours yellow and clear with a fairly substantial creamy white head.  It looks like a typical macro brewery output.  The aroma is, again, typical macro.  There’s the smell of treated water and corn along with tin.  The body is thin and carbonated but still manages to have a touch of oil.  There isn’t much of an after taste but some bitter vegetable residue does remain.  The flavor better than the typical AB product but certainly nothing to get excited about.  The hops are present but they don’t really meld well with the corn taste.

I really like this.  It was just what I wanted.  Not much aroma to speak of and the appearance was very basic american macro.  However, the extremely crisp effervescent taste was just what the doctor ordered.  I got this at Yamato, a japanese steakhouse, and it did the trick.  Not filling, very crisp and clean tasting, it left room for dinner.

Can.Very pale yellow color, tiny head.Apart from some grainy and the usual chemical aromas, not much of a taste. Had it also on draft in Berlin, where it left a better impression, maybe because it was summer. Still, more interesting than some European lagers like Tuborg Green or American like Miller.

Fast head, piss-yellow, light malt, grain aroma. Malt, corn taste, like a super Miller. Dry aftertaste.  Why is it that the Orient wants beer that taste like american macro-brews when america would rather have beers that taste like they came from Europe?

Sorry guys but this is my favorite "Japanese" beer. Smells like malt and grains. Pours a clear yellow color with a somewhat fluffy white head that hangs around for a good while and believe it or not, laces the glass. Tastes of grains and malts as well. Sweet with a tangy grain taste. Has some body to it, crisp carbonation and it actually has somewhat of a dry finish, much like the bottle states. I dig the dry character of this beer and its not as sweet as a Kirin or Sapporo.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a transparent typically carbonated orange colored body and a poor lacing. The aroma was hoppy malty and grassy. The crisp mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt hops and grassy. Not one that I would buy again.
(Bottle): Pours a light yellow color, small white head. Malty aroma, fresh. Clean, nutty taste. Watery. Refreshing. A little alcoholy, a little dry, but not too bad.

Not too terrible at all I thought.  In fact it was fairly decent for the style.  Typical light gold pour with light head and smelled of corn like malt mainly.  Taste was corn like malt with some sweetness, but not too much and no real off flavors.  Average body and carbonation for a pale lager.  Nothing too special but works fine at a sushi bar.
Light yellow color with no head. Light malt and hop flavors with a bitter aftertaste
Pores like a typical pale lager, flavor was lite with little bitterness. It was mostly just carbonation flavor.

Definitely a step above most American macro pale lagers. Aroma of grain, cerial, honey and subtle floral hops. There is nothing really exotic or different about this pale lager when compared to others, but it is definitely more quafable than your standard bud-miller-coors, as I can actually drink this without making a face of pure disgust. The flavour is mostly corn syrupy malts, cereal and grassy hops with a faint bitterness in the finish. No shitty adjucnt taste.

Light yellow body with a small white head. Lots of grainy cereal in the aroma. The flavor is lightly to moderately sweet and very lightly bitter. Slightly dry finish. Light to medium body and water texture. Lively carbonation. Crisp enough to make it drinkable, but overall fairly boring.

12 oz bottle poured into lager glass- poured transparent golden yellow, very thin white head.  Aroma of faint grain.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, nothing really distinguishable, dry finish.  Disappointing.
Not bad. Bought as part of ’Asian Selection’ . One of the better two (along with Singha). Nice and dry, crisp and refreshing. Good with nibbles.

50 cL from 7-Eleven in Hong Kong, thanks Boris. Pours clear yellow with a diminished white head. Grassy aroma. Flavour is slight sweet malty, only vague bitter in the finish. Soft and slight boring flavour. Ends mild bitter and with a mild citric note.
I really didn’t know what to expect out this beer.  I did enjoy the “dryness”. Otherwise it wasn’t that out of the ordinary for a pale lager.

Wow, pretty rough. Out for some Asian food, limited beer options, and I figure I’ll go with something crisp and dry to battle the spice. Just another anonymous pale lager, with a fairly lively body as its only notable characteristic. Almost prompts the question as to whether it’s even really beer.

Can, 500 ml, savoured on June 13 2006; eye: straw, clear, light effervescence, white head that disappears almost immediately; nose: light hops, light corn, a bit metallic; mouth: not pleasant, thin, corn syrup, malt, corn, finale in corn syrup with a hint of bitterness, sticky texture, harsh, quite sweet, lightly bitter; overall: once is enough

FRANÇAIS 

Canette, 500 ml, 5 %, savourée le 13 juin 2007 
oeil : paille, claire, légère effervescence, mousse blanche qui disparaît presque immédiatement 
nez : léger houblon, léger maïs, un peu métallique 
bouche : pas plaisante, mince, sirop de maïs, malt, maïs, finale in sirop de maïs avec une petite pointe d’amertume, texture collante, râpeuse, assez sucrée, légèrement amère

I simply adore this drink. What more could a man want from  a glass of beer? Nicy and dry, with a hint of bitterness. The one beer to drink with food. It’s been around for a long time, though be aware that its taste varies, depending on where it is brewed.
Faint hay aroma. Yellow color, no head. Very little flavor. It’s simply a waste of time.

it doesn’t smell particularly good, or taste particularly good when you buy it from any of the non-japanese sources. if you have a chance i recommend buying the ones that are imported from japan, instead of the more local ones. the beer lives up to its description of being crisp, fresh and clear, but one wonders if they could do better...

This is a decent, but rather basic, bland, weak lager with little taste, and I really enjoy pale lagers.  It is gold with a thick white head that lasts and leaves some lacing.  The aroma is actualy somewhat strong, but typical for the style with mild malt, grain.  The taste is very mild grain, specifically a definite rice quality, not particularly sweet or bitter.  It has a faint metallic hint and a mild rice-grain aftertaste. It starts of bland, gets a little flavour, but part way down it loses flavour completely before the mildaftertaste.  It is very watery, even for the style, with a rough, unpleasant palate.  As my wife said in comparing it to Schlitz, this tastes less like beer, which mostly sums it up.
Bottle. Pours a light gold with a white frothy head. The taste is smooth and crisp; some hops and a sweet malt. The body is watery and finishes dry. Not bad.

pours yellow with a small foamy white head.
smell is wet grain, silage, skunk weed, very bad aroma, yuck.
taste is dry just like the label says "super dry", but the taste is more like "super bad", grain, a weird taste that i just cant put my finger on.
the beers appearance really hides how bad this is, all i can say is that this beer really sucks.

22oz bottle.  Aroma:  Light grainy maltiness with slightly sweet corn.  Appearance:  Light golden in color and clear.  White head was full and foamy with good retention.  Fair lacing.  Flavor:  Light malt.  Hops?  Nope.  Light bitterness.  Clean finish.  Palate:  Light bodied and watery.  Medium carbonation.  Overall:  This was one of those situations where someone ordered a beer for me, and thought they were getting me something ’gourmet’.  Courtesy demanded that I thank them and drink it.  And so I did.  Inside, I died a little bit.

330ml bottle. 

Pours a clear gold with a medium white head. Has a fruity apple smell. Taste is alcohol, wheat and apples. Med body. Soft carbonation. Not great.
it is what it says... super dry. very clean lager, no detectable nastiness. pale, clear, moderate carbonation. dry on the palate. very little flavor. wish there was a tad more bittering hops.

1pt. 6oz bottle.  Aroma of corn/rice and macro skunk.  Large white foamy head that mostly lasted.  Yellow gold hue.  Grainy flavor of macro corn/rice and metal.  Watery fizzy palate.  Brewed by Molson for us gaijin in N. America.
Big frothy head. Pous a straw colour beer. tatse is weak and metallic. Barley and rice are discernible. Dry finish with lingering metal taste. Not very nice.
Bottle. High fluffy but lasting white head. Clear golden body. Weak barley malt aroma. Mild and watery with only a little hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Short aftertaste.
Bottle/draft.  Pours a very thin straw color with a white head.  No real aroma, no real flavor.  I prefer Kirin Lager with sushi.
Pours a nice straw color with a small medium white head. No real aroma to it(Grains?). Slight hop flavor and very crisp. Went well with japanese food though!

Poured a nice straw color.  no real detectable aroma.  Taste is rather clean and crisp just as the commercial description with no flavor.  Basically this is a Japanese version of Bud.  It goes well with Japanese food (obviously) but, surprisingly goes well with other food.  Has some with steaks I made and it was great.  If not for it’s ability to go well with food, I’d probably rate it much lower.

Pours with a smooth head.  Very, very light straw color, and lots of carbonation. Theres not too much to the aroma, kind of grassy. The taste is not too complex either, but has hints of rice and hop and super short finish.  Tried it with seaweed salad but it was nasty, thank jesus for the Asahi to wash it down with.  The palate is very flat, and overall this beer tastes like a Miller Lite, but with a Japanese feel to it.  Easy session beer, ok with snacks, and the short finish make it worth the while.

In the 3-neck race between this, Sapporo and Kirin when choosing a beer from the small selection at the sushi bar, I’ve most often selected the Asahi Super Dry. Odd because I think Sapporo Premium is a slightly better beer standalone. Certainly an abrupt finish and a minimal chopped-off aroma here.  It does however let me best enjoy the soy sauce and spicy tuna roll without having to take centerstage as the beverage.

Canned: Brewed in Czech Republic!

A bit pale looking. Very fresh, neutral aroma. Flavour is a mildly dry and hoppy. Quite high carbonation. Overall it’s quite plain but nevertheless very fresh, clean and easy to drink.
Drank it in Costa Rica.  Pours a light yellow with no head, and very fizzy.  No taste, a bit metallic.  Finishes very dry.  So then again no taste at all
Super dry, yes.  Only thing which makes this beer stand out.  Doesn’t taste bad, but rather barely tastes at all.  Strangely refreshing, however.  It does go well with Japanese food.
Pours a light golden color. Not much aroma, flavor/mouthfeel is barely there. I love the "super dry" finish to it. Nothing I’d drink when I want a good beer, but it goes along well with chinese food.

can:  Well at least they are not lying.  Super Dry is true, but also no flavour or texture at all.  It is smooth but has sacrificed all flavour so what is the point? Funny, the can states it is the beer for all seasons?! Maybe this would taste good on 45 degree day and you are dying for a drink, that’s it.
Clear yellow body under a filmy layer. Lack of aroma and flavour except for notes of malt and some oily hints. Very thin mouthfeel (Bottle at a drinking session in Tromsø, 06.09.2007).

[575-20070901] 500mL. Light fish aroma is mostly light metallic straw. Clear, orange yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Flavour is light generic fruit, straw, more metallic grains, sweet corn and hints of hops. Light-medium body. Refreshing if cold (and while eating sushi).
gold with a small creamy white head.  light and dry.  not much flavor.  yeah.

Rating #300. Wow, what a beer. There is nothing to compete with the flavor of raw fish, that says it all. No wonder Tokyo corporate types drink so much of it, the flavor barely arrives, like some HB who teases you on and flakes on every date. Wow.

Bottle. Super light, super dry, super Asian. Fortunately they left some grains, some lemony notes and some  hops in this beverage...  Quite quenching, but  sadly, most of the beer is  removed out of the beer.
33 cl bottle. Golden color, moderate white head. Malty, some sweetness in the finish. Extremely watery.

Bottle. This rated a little higher for me than most people, I see. But I thought it poured very nicely a beautiful golden color. Light to medium carbonation. Aroma is bread-y with some malt. It is definitely a dry beer with some hops. Not remarkable but well-built and drinkable.

Light grassy aroma. Brassy gold color with an impressive white head. Medium body with moderate, kind of fizzy, carbonation. It neary turns things creamy. The flavor is rather dry, and there is some bitter. After a bit the mouth gets an astringent impact. It has sugars, but not much. It’s about as dry as lager can get, I suppose. Drinkable.
Bottle. Pale straw color with a small white head. Sweet malt and grain aroma. Flavor is dry malt with too much sugar added. LIngering sweetness. I just didn’t like this one at all.
Bottle: well, it’s quite boring and bland, watery, some corn, weak bitterness, dry finish, that’s about it.

Pale straw yellw.  Nice bubbly head.  Slightly skunky hops and grassy scent.  A lot more taste then expected.  Dry crisp finish, very thirst quenching.  Not too bad, as good as a Canadian Macro like Blue.

0.33L bottle. Version brewed in prague. The best thing i can say about this beer is that is technicaly correct, and has no major faults. But it also has no major attributes. The most boring beer i had the "dubios" pleasure of drinking for a long time.
No flavor at all, and only a little bit of aroma.  Is this the Japanese Bud Light?
Pale, Fizzy, no flavor, very dry and yellow. If there were ever a light soda drink with beer taste, this would be it.

Very pale golden color, with a great head and big soda-pop carbonation bubbling up. The aroma is metallic. Some kind of flavor to grains, but only initially. The finish is to dry. 
This is a very wrong beer.
Another Asian restaurant staple beeer. Its like the Molson, or Labatt of Japan I guess. Pale yellow, fizzy tasteless drink. Its a lager, what more can i say?

Light pale color, refreshing, corny, low hop flavour and aroma, light body.
A refreshing beer, if it happen I will drink this beer again.

Rated 7/20/07.  Clear gold color with a small white head.  Aroma of grainy malts and flowers.  Flavor was primarily corny, grainy malts with a bit of a floral aspect and some faint spice.  Overall, not very good.

330 ml bottle - Clear pale yellow with a white head which died almost immediately. Thin bodied with medium carbonation. Sweetish with a mildly dry, short finish.  Refreshing enough but rather lacking in flavour.
(330ml clear yellow/green glass bottle) A clear pale yellow liquid with average carbonation. Light bodied. Refreshing but watery and has very little flavour. Slightly bitter finish.

Bottle. Clear yellow color with a small frothy fair lacing mostly diminishing white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, sugar. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light malty light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Moderate bitter slightly metallic average finish. Watery palaye. OK pale lager.

Bottle. This version is brewed in Prague. Clear golden lager with a small white head. Light aroma of malt with a bit of corn. Very light in flavor, but with some dryness (as the name suggests), that make this beer a bit refreshing.  Light-bodied.

steiny, 334ml / yeasty nose that dies very quickly; creamy, buttery palate... at first; typical, japanese macro appearance; watery, a bit sweet, cereal... beer / yeaup! it tasted even more watery when i drank it out of the steiny and it is neither sharp nor slipping gently on.

Well it is not skunky and that is about the only plus.  While I have used the words "fresh, crisp, and clear" as adjectives in describing a beers taste, never in a good beer and with those as being the only description.  So yes with the above words and no as far as this being "good."

I don’t know maybe it was because I was really thirsty and this was very easy to drink.  I was not off-put by this beer.  I mean don’t get me wrong, far from great.  Nice soapy looking white head into straw body.  Cereal aromas with a clean almost crispness to finish.

Can. Nice golden color with a persistent white head.The aroma is some corns or rice, I really don’t know, flavor is dry and refreshing, low bitterness, finish is dry!

Cerveja dourada com espuma densa e persistente, aroma de milhou ou arroz, nção consegui definir bem. sabor refrescante e pouco amarga, deixa um sabor seco no final.

500 ml can: Typical lager pour...blah, blah, blan...golden,white head etc. Yeasty/floral aroma. ’Wet’ on the front of the palate with little else going on. Slight dry finish...not the super dry I was expecting. The can says it’s ’the beer for all seasons’. While I’m not sure if this is true, it does go down well on a sweltering June day while working over a hot BBQ. Pretty bland overall.
12oz bottle.  golden color.  no head.  aroma of corn flakes.  Light body.  No flavor but malt.
Bottle. Aroma of stale grains. Pours yellow with a white fizzy head. Very mild flavor, mostly of corn and straw. It goes down smooth enough, but I wouldn’t say it’s even as good as a Budweiser.
Bouteille. Couleur jaune-or, claire, mousse mince qui s’estompe lentement. Arôme léger de grain. Goût de grain sucré, finale très dry. Effervescence moyenne, mince. Aucune particularité.
Weak in color and aroma.  Drinking too much of this can help your karaoke skills, but that is about it.  This is better than a Bud Light, but that isn’t saying much.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a small white head. Malty aroma and taste with a dry hoppy finish. Still boring.

Bottle, no pour. Aroma has some floral notes and some malt, no skunk is a plus. Taste is slight malt and maybe some floral hop, which is more flavor than I expected. Finish is dry and somewhat fruity-sour. Palate is highly tingly with a bit much carbonation, and light and dry as advertised. Almost seems like a mild bitter lite, and is one of the better industrial lagers. I still wouldn’t ever drink this if there were a good ale (or even a micro lager) available.
Yeah. A piss poor pale lager, Japanese style. Nothing redeeming about this. Only good for washing down some late night sushi. I’m done talking about this.

Just a shade from clear hay yellow with some white foam that settles quickly. Aroma is a mix of herbal hops and a saw dust metallic sour note. Vague bile sour flavor that recedes into a little herbal hop finish. Just so little going on here. Vacuous. Not surprisingly, dry. And water-like. But not necessarily an improvement on water.

Bottle -- Very unimpressive looking beer with next to no head with no retention and no lacing. Pale, unexciting yellow. Aroma is weakly malty. Thin, watery mouthfeel with soft drink-like carbonation. Flavour is crisp, light (very!) and refreshing but that’s it. A singularly unimpressive pale lager.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with a white head. Light grainy aroma. Very light lager flavour.

goes well with the obvious type of food. not a bad brew. clean tasting and palate cleaning. a fuity flavor that is watery and weak and seems to have been skunked down with an opposing taste. extra points for clever chemistry. nice carbonation that is not overpowering. can’t imagine just drinking the beer. it’s a food brew.

Received from my Japanese father in law.  He loves this stuff.  Gone in 60 seconds.  Thick full lasting head, and not bad lacing.  Slightess of skunkiness.  Watery, light yellow color.  Watery, but not watery enough, theres some off flavor hiding in there.  Still drinkable, but there are times he offers me them, and I have a hard time quaffing it down.

A gold lager with a thick white head. Aroma of crisp malts and rice, a bit of burned corn. In mouth, a light sweet malt, with clean finish, not offensive, and thirst quenching. Bottle from singles bin at LCBO.

Canned 500ml. Pours a yellow, light golden beer with a quick diminishing bubbly head. Weak metallic malty aromas. Sweet taste, metallic, very low bitterness. Cereal, some rice... Very weak, metallic, grainy. Bitter finish. Indeed, there is a dry finish, but it isn’ t pleasant at all though. To bland to be offensive. Very watery.

Bottle, a clear golden yellow, very carbonated with just the odd bubble for a head. Grainy malt mostly, not a very strong hoppy aroma. A dry palate, yes, but also tartish with just a touch of sweetness. Some malt flavour, but not so much. Pretty poor.
Bottle, 33 cl. Pale clear golden, small and shortlasting white head. Weak but clean malt aroma, no hop profile. Thin and watery, with a dry and moderately bitter finish.

Bottle. Light golden colour. Medium white head. Aroma of malt and light hops. Must be drinked very cold. A decent pale lager. For Europe this beer being brewed in Czech rep. at Staropramen, since 2000.

Well finally i had my first japanese beer. But it produced in Chec. Republic. Actually not a good beer, pathetic finish but malty taste, i have never like these kinds of lagers but have a aroma a little.

Aroma is light malt and barely noticeable hop odor. Some notes of sulpher as well.  Pretty simple. Absolutely no complexity, no substantial flavors other than alcohol and a little generic hoppiness.  Weird aftertaste in the malt tastes a bit like cardboard.
golden colored asian beer with little to offer other than crappy flavor. leaves a gross aftewrtaste in ones mouth.
Pretty typical lager but im liking the crispness of these "extra" and "super" dry brews. Decent head and nice pale golden colour. Pretty fizzy and clean taste. Not too bad.

Light golden color with a decent sized white head.  Aroma is light with mild malt notes.  Flavor is light grainy malt.  Short, dry finish.  While not having much in the way of flavor,  it is exactly what the brewery tried to create.

Pours pale yellow w/ a medium sized, semi creamy froth. Nice head retention w/ full residual lacing. Aroma is mild to nonexistant. Light nectar w/ ample residual effers. Theres a malty graininess w/ a mild yet persistant bittering component. Some off flavors on the finish w/ a mild bittering.

I tasted this beer at a hibachi grill about a year ago, so I am going from memory.  I had this after a Sapporo or two.  Pours a light yellow color with a smallish head, I smelled malt on the nose.  Very carbonated.  I would say that the only reason to drink this beer is to fit in while eating in a Japanese restaurant.

Overlooked for so long by my ignorant self and yet such a triumph of technology and bounding ingenuity in a bottle as to leave any techno-geek agasp. But is it beer?
Into its own frosted tallboy as to give an impression of depth, a dull gold body presides. Off the pour a clean glass produces a decent thin, dense pad of white that holds and legs well. Classically dry but CO2 weighted nose barely releases from the glass. A hint of burnt rice and boiling brine liquor joins in, not too enticing at all.
 Super feather-weight in the mouth, crisp (accordingly!) bouncy, and bubbly, whilst actually living out to its label description of being ’smooth’. Hey, soapy too! Flavour? The term ’Super-dry’ is in a bigger font than the description below mentioning ’Great taste’. Who needs that? Feint, distant cardboard and cracked pepper granules linger after the swallow, very little else. It succeeds well in enticing the Dry era of drinker to get drunk, no flavour!
Not offensive, not distasteful, not tasteful, not anything, this is the real deal of dry lagers. Ahhh, hum!!! (33cL, 11/09/07, The Beer Store Morley)

Pours a translucent yellow with a small bubbly white head that very quickly went away to nothing.  Aroma of corn, rice, grassy, sweet malts.  Flavor of cereal grain,s, rice, clean, crisp and dry.  Nice option at the Japanese steakhouse...but that is about it.

Pours golden with a large fizzy white head.  Aroma was corn and maybe a bit of malt.  Body is rather fizzy.  Flavor is muted, but some malt, and hops.  It’s just another macro.  There are much better Japanese macros out there.

12oz, no date.  Pours a crystal golden with a one finger white head--it does last for a minute or so, which I find good for a pale lager.  Aroma of grain, corn, sweat (though not necessarily offensive B.O.), and some sweet malts.Flavor is fairly papery, mild hop bitterness--maybe a little grass--with some grain and a bit of metal.  Semidry finish.  Moderate carbonation with a watery body.  There was nothing offensive about this beer, but there wasn’t hardly anything to it.  So for a pale, it’s decent.

Certainly very dry. Aroma is pretty much nonexistant. Appearance is not bad, very cloudy but doesnt have much structure to it. Mouthfeel is smooth (with warm sake) and flavor is sweet and acidic, not a good combo.

Tried one warm and a few cold.. the cold ones didnt have any carbonation and the flavor was strictly of malt.   the warm one actually had decent carbonation, head and a nice taste of apples....  mb this is a lager to be enjoyed a little warmer than most.
Very light, easy drinking brew, clean on the palate, watery, great with japanese food,but so is an Iced tea, or sake, a nice thirst quencher!

bottle into schooner glass, very aussie... mostly metalic with very (very) slight floral aroma, really lovely clear beer...no head. flavour is of metal and some kind of cleanser, palate is thin and medium carbonation, good for excessive swilling. not exactly the best beer in the world...it’s a change from VB and Carlton draught...not much of one tho
Bottle at a hibachi resteraunt. Poured light yellow with a thin head. Taste was slighlty hoppy and watery but better than a Bud light. Went well with the meal.

12 oz. bottle- color of pale yellow, with a short off white head - nose of mild hopps , some cereal , oats , and not much else – taste of mild hops , malt , and acidic quality - body watery ,  crisp , and dry – aftertaste of  almost nonexistent except  minimal hopps

A bit hoppier than Sapporo and farily dry finish.  Very lite aroma with watery pale gold appearance.  

re-rate notes: Lite grain aroma.  Clear golden with frothy white head that quickly disapates.  Full body lager, rice, and grains.  Carbonated with mild dry bitter finish.

As far as pale lagers go this isn’t bad.The usual evidence is there. Weak aroma, pee-like pour with no head. Metallic and watery taste. But this beer would be very refreshing as a lawnmowing break. The commercial description says it all. It is very crisp nd clear. No aftertaste at all....then again...no taste at all.
the taste of asahi super dry is best described as fresh crisp and clear with a sharp de;ivery that slakes thirst before slipping gently on

Bottle. Pours a yellow with a thin white bubbly head. Served a bit too cold for any real aroma to develop, but what was there was some kind of dusty hop with some kind of dead grassy hints. Mouth is virtually non-existent, hoppy and slightly watery, finishing to a dead palate, no show on that front really, a bit bitter, but not really "super dry". Below average, but good in the restaurant I was at when I didn’t want something obtrusive
a good alternative to purchasing the standard beers for a night in with mates. not a strong tasting beer so easy to drink a few.
Clear golden yellow body, no head with slight lace.  Corn, grass and hops to the nose.  Metallic flavor permeates all aspects.  Super dry finish indeed.  Good beer, but nothing special.
It is what it is, I suppose.  Almost no aftertaste and therefore quite refreshing.  Goes well with Japanese food as a palate cleanser.  Try some ice cold Sake, though.  You might be surprised.
Pale lager which tasted about like I expected. Yellow color, which did not have a lot of taste to it but nothing to turn you off from it. Average beer.
It is fresh, crisp, and clear, and a little bit dry (not super dry) but we all know the Japanese are pretty big fans of hyperbole.  This is about a million times better than Anheuser World Select.

This is totally drinkable and unappalling.  I was expecting a nasty skunkiness and I was pleased that I found absolutely none.  Always a good thing in pale lager land.  Lightly sweet with an almost citrus lightly bitter bite in the back.  Choose this over crap like Heineken.
Pretty tasteless in all respects there are. Pale yellow with a head that doesn’t last. Bready with a little bitterness. Kind of carbonated. Fresh I guess is the best thing you can say about this one.

Bottled, pasteurised, 500ml. Yellow gold with fizzed white head. Extra marks for not being ovecarbonated, this is a dry, thinnish but with the benefits of being malty with no adjuncts, one of the better pale lagers. Beats the rice brewers hands down.

Convenient 135ml can.  Monstrous foamy artificially-induced head.  Pale yellow color.  The aroma is that of a typical pale lager.  Reminds me of being a kid and catching a whiff of whatever my grandfather was drinking.  Flavors are pale lager-ish:  corn, rice, a bit of hops.  Very light and watery body.  The finish was, in fact, quite dry.  Though not in the usual hoppy/astringent sense... more of a watery, nothing-to-it kind of sense.  Easy to chug and/or funnel.
Bottle. Pale yellow color, minimal head ,watery and light beer. Very very average lager.
From bottle poured yellow with very little head.  Nose of rice.  Flavor is very mild and there is a touch of hops.  Very bland.
Stupid sushi restaurants never have good beer. This one is watery, and a bit ricey. Completely forgettable macro stuff.

Bottle at Manggha in Krakow. Little head, goes off completely. Odd flavour, slightly acidic, sweet and with strong corn notes. Less hoppy than european lagers. Nothing extraordinary, but drank kinda well to sushi. (Note that my bottle read that it was brewed in Czech Republic; the Japanese original may be different)

In comparison to Sapporo, this is very good. My friend was having a Yeuling at the time and he said it tasted just like the Yeuling except the Asahi is extremely light in color. I disagree with the taste but I’d order it again with a hibachi meal. Very decent.
This is of one the more unremarkable beers I’ve tried in awhile. Very smooth, dry, and plain. Virtually no taste, but at least it easy to drink.
grassy, flowery aroma. Pours a light yellow, white head. Pretty standard restaurant beer. Grassy taste, dry finish. Japanese Bud.
Neutral aroma and the flavour has notes of hops and flower as the initial impression. It’s bitterness is OK and it is a refreshing beer. (Early rating, too short)

Sampled from 1 Liter can, poured out.  The beer was a lighter gold, see-through color with a medium white head, that hung around a little bit.  Aroma was mostly of grainy hops/slight malts, but nothing stood out.  The beer was wet to drink, but had a dry finish.  The flavor was a mix of medium bitterness with a slight sour taste too.  Not a bad Japanese beer, but not one that I will remember too fondly either.
Bottle. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is malt and rice. Flavor is the same and pleasantly dry. I can easily drink alot of this beer.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt anf hops.
Solid, if unspectacular session lager, doesn’t stand up to suntory malts, yebisu or kirin, but perhaps on par with sapporo

Gold color, with a fully diminishing head. Faint, bread dough aroma that I wish was a bit stronger. No pronounced malt or hop flavors, but a nice level of carbonation. Extremely non-offensive, and very drinkable. Would be a nice substitute for water with any meal.

The commercial description "fresh, crisp and clear" say it all. It’s all that and feels smooth in your mouth. It’s very dry, strict, well behaving and balanced. Perfect companion for sushi and other delicate food. Good even by itself. One of my favorite lagers.

Top selling beer in Japan and it is good! Nice yellow colour with a nice lasting head. Mild aroma of malt. Dry taste yes, with a touch of malt. crisp aftertaste. Quite weak tasting beer actually but so refreshing.
Just like the bottle says, dry ,very dry at the finish. An ok beer clean,crisp, refreshing. I enjoyed the extra large bottle it come in at the japenese steakhouse.

This beer is very dry. VERY, VERY dry. It finishes very clean and tastes extremely good with Japanese food in general, especially dishes flavored with ginger because it mixes with the flavor of the beer.
It sure is dry.  Not bad ... quite good with food.  I recommend the can as it keeps a bit better.  The bottle I tasted was a bit "worn out." The flavors weren’t as up front.  NIce aftertaste.
Used to drink this all the time in hawaii.  Has a wine/citrus aroma.  Pours out with a large foam head.  Taste of slight wine and malts.  Not too bad.
easy east drinking. dry as in very dry. nothing to it. no hop flavour no malt flavour just thirst quenching easy drinking no taste beer
Bottle. It’s certainly dry, I’ll give it that. But a bit of flavour wouldn’t go astray though. Bit like ginger ale without the ginger.

Despite the bad reviews, I quite like this little Japanese beer.  Others mention that it does, or does not go with sushi.  Who cares what goes with sushi?  Sushi is a disgusting creation only eaten by trendy, gormless city posers for effect!  What matters is what the beer tastes like and this is a good little refreshing lager - not much taste I concur, but slips down a treat on a summer day and it’s brewed by Shepherd Neame, which is always a bonus!

Bottle 45F Lager. Smells of rice nothing special at all no hops to speak of.  Very clear maybe a touch darker than most pale lagers. Finishes dry and not so bad, plenty of metallic taste,  Decent carbonation and mouthfeel. If it were not for the taste and mouthfeel this would be a drain pour, but really its not too bad.
Thank to MJuarez. Can: Pours a huge foamy white head, strong aroma and taste of what must be rice; grainy. Really super dry. Finish is chemical, iron-like.
Yellow beer with not nuch aroma, not much aroma, not much nothing. I feel only carbonation and watery body.
Bottle.  When I am having sushi, this is my beer.  Not that its the perfect pair, just usually my favorite on offer.  Slightly bitter for a Pale Lager macrobrew, certainly dry as name implies.
500mL can.  Standard macrobrew.  Probably adjuncts, I think.  Better than Molson, probably equal to Blue.  Could be worse.
500 mL can.  Orangey-gold with a thin film of head.  Malty aroma.  Flavour is very thin and grainy, with a flat finish.  Corn?  Lagerish.  Once is enough.
Bottle with Sushi. Kind of big head. Flavour was slightly bitter and finish was very slightly bitter and dry.
Bottle at Saporo in A’dam. Tall, tall head. Prickly lager taste. Always coupled with sushi, for me, so goes down delisciously. Refreshing.
Can.  Very common here on Guam.  Hawaiians seem to like it.  Japanese like it.  I don’t like it.

(Bottle at Stockholm Beer Festival)
Drainpour. Absolute and utter shite. There was a time when I’d say that this would have worked with sushi.. I’ll never say that again. I’m sorry sushi for having offended you so. I bow my head in shame.

Super thin-watery pour and appearance; quickly dissipating thin white head. Nasty aroma of corn, wheat, and grain.
Unrealistically thin mouthfeel. I feel like I could chug these all day and not feel anything!
A crisp, refreshing beer. One of my favorite selections while eating sushi. I don’t usually have it unless I am enjoying Japanese cuisine.

To "rate"  this beer, to me, is like a food critic reviewing Mac ’n’ Cheese.  A bad sign in a beer is when, after 10 minutes tops, it runs out of carbonation ... Corn and rice are here put to their most efficient and inoffensive use, synthesized rather than brewed into a pale, yellow fizzwater.

Not a great offering here.  It begins with a flat straw pour.  The nose is somewhat macro and skunk equally.  The flavor is peppery skunk and huge corn notes.  The finish is purely macro corn(ish), with a poor hop contingency to boot.  The mouthfeel is watery and overcarbonated.... again, not a top-shelf brew.

341ml Bottle: Huzzah, another pale lager for me to rate poorly.  I know I shouldn’t judge beforehand but what choice do I have?  The pour is boring with light carbonation, pale yellow body, and a head that left quickly; I should have taken its advice.  Aroma is AWFUL, like compost and sweet corn.  Flavour isn’t much better with that distinct corn-water flavour I’ve come to expect from macro pale lagers.  Poor, wouldn’t try it again.
I  Drank a lot of this beer from the vending  machines in Tokyo.Iits  A Standard lager, a little on the watery side.
Bottled, Leen restaurant, Utrecht. Clear yellow color, short head. Typical rice and corn aroma of a bad pale lager. Bit brackish and sharp metallic taste.

Not much here. This went well with the spicy noodle soup I was eating at the time, but at that point, anything wet and cold would have worked. Without the label, I would just assume this was another BMC macro product. This had the same lack of aroma, taste and finish.

500ml can, 5% a/v

Pours a nice straw colour with a decent white head. The smell is of citrys and malt. The taste consisting of a crisp albeit very watery. Not bad... nothing special though. Id call it a situation beer, IE match it to the situation at hand, such as eating sushi (not to be racist). This isnt an everyday beer
Pale yellow with a little carbonation, slightly bitter aroma, taste was very bland with a slightly bitter vegetable finish, not much to this but I guess it worked with the sushi as a palate cleanser.
