22 oz bottle (brewed by Molson in Canada).  Pale yellow with a good head.  The aroma is light and malty.  The body is thin, with a drinkable palate and finish.
bottled 330 cl, 5%, brewed in Czech. very watery dry lager. light carbontion

From a twist cap 633 ml. brown bottle with a coded freshness on the shoulder of bottle, a short blurb on the front label.

Poured a clear pale yellowish golden with a foamy white head that settled into a fine lacing.

Aromas of grain husks, metallic as well, sweet rice malts with a subtle, light old grass hoppiness.

Moderate carbonation overall, soft, soft, softly crisp and smooth light bodied mouthfeel.

Bland tasting, sweet, almost tasteless, rice malts with a grain metallic malt twang, subtle hayish hops that have a soft bitterness, and a dry rice malt finish, pretty clean in it’s finish, o.k. drinkability, not a lager I would drink on a regular basis.

I am in St. Louis on business and I just didn’t have the energy to go to restaurant for dinner tonight, so I went to the deli at Whole Foods for a light meal that I could take back to my hotel room, had this lager with a slightly off beat meal of sesame seed tofu, black thai rice and three pea stir fly, this beer didn’t get in the way of any of the food tastes. And yes, I paid too much for the deli items at Whole Foods.

This smells horrible!  The aroma was so bad, I was ready to pour it out without taking one sip.  I braved through the smell to find some extremely watered down brew.  The taste is water like, but has none of the skunk associated with the smell.  Definitely goes down easy.

absolutely nothing special here.  Very bland flavor, with a bitter aftertaste including flavors of grass.  color is of piss, and a little cloudy. The aroma reminds me of a crappy beer that has been strained through an old gym sock.  Look elsewhere for good beer.

21.4 oz bottle. Poured piss yellow with lots of bubbles that disappeared lightning fast!  Flavor can only be described using my Bloom County "Bill the Cat voice:  "ACK!  ACK! "  It was pretty nasty stuff. Grassy water flavor was pretty much it flavorwise.  It was almost completely FLAT.  There was hardly any carbonation whatsoever.  Zero aftertaste.  Nothing here would ever make me crave the opportunity to try this beer again.
Very thin and watery, and has a sourness. Crisp and refreshing, finishes clean, however, there’s that grain-like sourness and smell. Simple masses brew.

Bottle. Minimal flavour. Dry body which is light suggesting cereals but they dont let any of that flavour in. Very little bitterness and zero hop flavour. Cold this is a slightly gassy thirst quencher which is terminally boring due to the lack of flavour.

(633 ml bottle: $2.39 at BevMo in La Jolla, CA) Blecht, paper products in liquid form.  Only mildly sweet, not even a hint of hoppy bitterness, not really even a grainy flavor.  It just tastes like cardboard.  The beer’s aroma is very light grain, but it definitely smells less like paper than it tastes.  Body is light and carbonation is ample, but without that clean lager taste, the beer just sits like a dead weight on the palate.  The strong point of this beer is how nice it looks in a glass.  Pale golden, super clear, unrelenting streams of rising carbonation bubbles, and a tall, white head, it doesn’t get much better than this.  With better retention (it fades to a filmy layer), and more than a wisp of lacing, it would be perfect.  So pour the beer into a nice glass, admire it’s beauty, then dump it down the sink because the flavor is awful, even when ice cold.

330 ml Bottle, Canadian, 4.6º Flat yellow color, surprisingly with no bubbles. Frothy white head that disappears very quickly though leaving a fair lacing. Aroma is very weak with hints of corn and soap. The flavor is sweet with notes of asparagus, unidentifiable vegetables and corn syroup (eeeewww). The body is light and the carbonation is extremely flat for the style. 

Bottle shared with  Panzerfaust

Re-Rate:
Can, 330 ml:  Ok, this is more like it. A crisp, decent macro pale lager. You can feel the malty, bready and cereally flavors. Not much hops there, but I wasn’t expecting any. Not exciting in any way but drinkable.



Original Rating: 2/2/2/1/4 = 1.1.
Bottle at Sicosis. Brewed in Canada 
Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white fizzy and rapidly diminishing head. It leaves a small lacing.
Aroma shows corn syrup, clear adjuncts with some distinct macro-lager malt and minimal hops. There are notes of straw and cereals like rice, vegetables and soap. Weak.
Flavor is pretty bad. Sweet corn syrup with asparagus. No hops present. There are also touches of dough and paper. 
This is extremely watery and flavorless. Not as dry as the label says. Short finish. No aftertaste. That’s it? Bad Lager. Maybe I had a bad bottle.


Bottle shared with Lilith

Another pale lager goes down the pipe, through the liver, and out the, well, you know. Appearance was pale yellow, ok head, weak lacing. Aroma was adjunct lade, rice or corn. The flavor was malty sweet, same old same old, Japanese Budweiser. Mouthfeel average (if not heavy for the style), carbonated.

Served in a bottle. so can’t comment on appearance.  fizzy on the tongue, too much fizz to distinquish any complex flavors if they are there.
Strange, I used to like this type of beer.
When all is said and done:  VERY WATERY.

....How did I miss this one? I’ve had this several times, this completely blows soporro and tsing tao out of the water so I drink this on occasion at work when it’s hot and busy. A typical pale lager, clean, lifeless, snappy and refreshing. I guess it has everything that I’m looking for according to big name beers, eh?
Very incipit too. But it has some Japanese Beer distinctive taste. Very pale but dark golden too.
12 oz can.  Macro look and aroma, but the flavor was a touch better.  Crisp and clean and well... boring.

white head lasts not long
middle yellow color
smells a bit malty,a bit hoppy, a bit of cutten grass, some citrus,a bit metallic
middle carbonated
some malt taste and a a bit sourish taste, "dry" is true, but not much taste, 
aftertaste malty, some straw-like flavour,some very hidden, honey-like aftertaste
not really for drinking it for the tasts of itself, a bit boring
Urine colored body with a light white head.  Corn aroma with some very light hops.  Sharp and dry taste, rather boring overall.  Heavily carbonated ending.
Bottle, licence brewed in the czech republic. Refreshingly dry. Fine with sushi, but not a beer I would drink on its own.Not much flavour or finish. Pale, a little cloudy.
Pale golden-yellow colour with no head. Some maltiness in the aromas - a bit of popcorn as well :o) Taste is limited, a bit malty dryness. Low carbonated.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a pale golden color with a small white head. The aroma is light dry malts. The flavor is dry light malts that turn a bit bitter towards the finish. Very dry, rather bland but overall inoffensive.

Pale yellow, thin head. If you concentrate you could sense some hops in aroma, but the unpleasant artificial lemon and the corn tries it best to cover it. Flavour is (surprisingly) malty, with some sticky sweetness. Dry?............ok, i´ll go for that.

500ml from Tesco. Pale gold with lasting white head. Lemon and cereal aroma. Bit of malt. Actually pretty good. Better than I was expecting, none of the usual Uckiness (techincal term). Bit too carbonated and a bit metallic, but otherwise fine, some hop bite on end.

The bottle poured a polished, pale yellow beverage with a small fizzy white head that was mostly diminishing and left almost no lacing on the glass. The aroma was very light and delicate with a barely detectable presence of roasted grain and bread. There was also a note of old leather in the background. The body was light with a fizzy carbonation and dry texture (as the name implied). The flavor, what there was of it, started off lightly bitter and ended up the same way through the short lived finish.
The taste of Asahi Super Dry is best described as ’fresh, crisp and clear - with a sharp delivery that slakes thirst before slipping gently on.

Bottled. Poor. Very weak and watery, greyish colour, nothing taste. Maybe I need to try it with sushi as many here seem to recommend, but it’d have to be some dramatic turnaround to make this beer half-decent.

(0.33L Bottle) I asked the waitress at a sushi place in town to give be the best beer she had (out of three different Japanese beers). This is what she brought out. Little aroma and head. Goes well with food (sushi), but probably would have tasted worse alone. Overall, not much taste but refreshing.
I sampled this with 6 other Asian beers and this was the weakest of the bunch. I didn’t think “Super Dry" meant "Super Bland".

This one got me through some tough times in the land of the rising sun. Doesn’t need to be said, but it tastes much better over there than in the States. Pours a pale yellow, not much of a discernable scent, slight lacing. Flavor is smooth with, as to be expected, a dry finish. Perfect for sushi and edemame.
There is very little aroma except for some grain.  The color is a very pale golden with a white head some slight lacing.  The flavor is grainy with a dry light finish to the palate.
Bottle. Pours  golden with a white head. Aroma of sweet malts and rice. Flavor is sweet malts, grain, smooth, and rice.

Bottled. Pale golden with a small white head. Unpleasant aroma with malt, rice and some sweetness. The flavor is mostly rice-like, with some floral hop notes. Thin body. Hope to get a chance to re-rate it some day, I don’t remember this beer to be this poor. (060413)
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Light malty aroma. Dry  light malt flavour. Short finish.

Golden Pour. Thin bubbly head. Nose is all incredibly clean, wiped of all traces of beer smell. Malts are a razors edge. Acrid carbonation. Very carbony smelling. No hops...zero. Flavors taste as clean as a hospital in a very awful way. Sparkly carbonation. Awful. Truly.
Perfect with sushi and saki bombs!!............................................thats about it.

Typical watery Asian lager, but excellent with sushi! I was drinking it like soda! Crisp and refreshing after-taste. It makes you want to drink more.I guess Asian lagers go well with food...Recommended with food.

(12oz bottle.  03/2006).  I periodically drink Asahi.  It isn’t terrible.  Some aromas of riciness and earth on the nose.  A fizzy, quick-dissipating white head and, frankly, unappealingly pale, straw yellow appearance.  Flavor isn’t overly grainy and is relatively crisp and hoppy -- yes, hoppy.  Relatively dry finish.  Not terrible.

12 oz bottle: I actually liked the stuff.  Pours a very nice golden color with minimal head, and carbonation lacing.  The aroma is also minimal, but the taste is bitter, hoppy, dry, crisp, clean, with a bite of flavor.  Not complex and not a beer snobs beer, but much much better than the American big boys.

Bottle 05/07/2004
Golden coloured smooth on the palate and hoppy. Slightly dry malt finish.
Bottle. Golden pale body with short white head. Some malt flavour and little bitterness. A dry lager with short aftertaste. Quite ordinary, but definitively drinkable.

Both bottle and tap (basically the same).  Pours light yellow with a medium head that quickly dissipates.  Fairly strong initial floral scent, although that dissipates with the head.  Taste is rather nondescript.  It actually is quite dry, oddly enough, which makes it lack the off-taste sweetness of many pale lagers.  Not particularly exciting, but if you find yourself having to drink a macrobrew from Japan, this is probably the best choice.

Medium-gold appearance with a nice, clean, balanced lager aroma. Flavour is
a little watery, leading to a slightly bitter hop finish. Blatantly average.

Rating added 3/1/2006
Shared bottle with and from rickgordon, thanks
Light yellow color. Dominant malty scent. Malty taste with low bitterness. Higher body than expected.
5/3/6/3/12=2.9

The best thing about this one, is that it is in fact a bit dry. This means that the flavour isn’t as damn sweet as most pale lager. Otherwise, it just sticks to the same old formula. Why did I bother...

Bottled. 
Golden colour, pretty rich head. Apart from diacetyl in aroma, I found roasty notes and even hints of chocolate. Butterscotch is pretty dominant in flavour but the bitterness was not to be found. Very clean pale lager - I took it for a pilsner. Mouthfeel was almost medium. But then I sampled homebrewed bitters just before.
Sweet hop malt aroma. Clear amber colour with poor head and lacing. Sweet malt flavour. Flat palate.
My favorite of the Japanese beers to enjoy with sushi.  Nothing special, just the best of the 3 bad japanese beers.  No real aroma.  Did pour with a nice creamy head.  Yellow, fizzy, dry.
Tasty with Korean after a few drinks. Enjoyable, kind of a sharp taste to it upon drinking.

Biggish white head of fine lace, subsides quickly. Pale yellow body. Sweetish light clean malt aroma with faint fruity spicy notes. Almost no taste at all, just faint fruitiness. In a way it’s impressive that it’s not watery, despite being almost devoid of taste. Faint hoppy aftertaste. Clearly extremely well made, but sadly all that skill has been expended on removing the taste rather than adding it.
Very minimal aroma, and transparent bubbly appearance with very light yellow/gold color.  A pretty good Asian beer.  Great with spicy Thai or Burmese food.

bottle - Brewed and bottled by Molson in Canada.  Pours up a thin, rapidly fading head.  The aroma is minimal, just a bit of malt.  The taste is as weak as the aroma and is a bit sweet, but it’s mostly just watery.  Palate is thin and bubbly.  It’s a typical fizzy, yellow pale lager with really nothing to recommend it.  Avoid.
3 Feb 06 - Low hop aroma.  Clear yellow colour, low head but good lacing.  Slight sweet hop flavour.  Dry light hop finish.  Overall - Plain taste.

12 oz bottle.  There is really not much difference between Sapporo, Kirin, and Asahi.  All 3 are Coor’s light type clones.  I mean come on, do you expect rally good beer from Japan?  No, of course not.  You expect good food!

Not bad for a pale lager. Pours a clear gold with a thick white head. Slightly sour malt aroma with little hop presence, if at all. Flavor is very, well, super dry ... crisp is a good word. Not bad ... better than most American macros, but still a pale lager.

Pours a golden clear liquid that gets almost no head at all. Typical asian lager: little aroma, but refreshing and easy to drink. Not much to notice, there are thousands of beers like this in the world.
J’aimais ça au début, j’était heureux de l’avoir au LCBO sur Rideau à Ottawa avant qui soit disponble au Québec. Là depuit quelque années, je l’ai délaissé.
Ligt yellow clear colour. Thin lacing head. Nose of sewer and a hint of hops. Very dry and intense iron flavour. Sour with no finish at all. Feels like a battery on the tongue.
Straw golden with a carbonated white head.  Smells like rice and herbs.  Tastes like rice with a bit of floral hops.  I prefer rice to taste like rice, not beer.
Well now I think that this beer is the best dry or super dry in the world, it has a wonderful dry and silky taste.
Golden colour, small and dimishing white head. Malty aroma, some rice and dry herbs. Taste is dry. Finish is dry, rather smouth. Not really convincing.
Poured a pale yellow.  Smooth beer, but very little going on.  Typical Japanese beer, not bad, not good.
Light golden in colour. White head. Malt aroma with some hints of hops. Crisp and dry flavor with a little hops in the aftertaste. A slight bitteerness aswell.
Pours a light golden yellow color.  Aromas of grains and maybe some minor hop action.  Flavor was crisp, but sort a bland.  Still better than most lagers.
Light beer taste with a tinge of a hoppy flavor at the finish. Good for cleansing the palate between each course.

21.4oz bottle at a Jappanese Steak House - chose as an alternative to Sapporro or U.S. Macros.  Poured with with a thin head - unappealing aroma similar to Coors Original.  Nice and dry tasting, with a slightly hoppy flavor.  Cleansed the palate pretty decently and was a good, palate cleaning, unobtrusive complement to the meal.
Bottled, clear yellow, light  head, malt and hop aroma, very dry with heavy carbonation, subtle grain flavor with a hint of bitterness.  I’d buy it again.

Bottled.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of malts and hops with notes of corn.
Flavour of malts and corn with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.

Can. Had this beer in a huge can a few months back but I remember it very well cause it wasn’t very good. Very light yellow in color and very wheaty smell. Slightly better than an American Macro but not much better. If you smelled the top of the can it smelled skunked. I’m sure i’ll drink this sometime again.

Pours yellow with a fully receding white head. Smells somewhat appealing, notes of sweet corn and bready malt. Tastes like bready lager yeast, a bit of rice, and some toasted malts. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with lively carbonation, not overly fizzy. A pretty good companion with sushi.
I had it in a japanese restaurant in manchester. Its pretty boring and tastes just like budweiser. I guess its the japanese version or something.

Bottle. Poured a light yellow with a substantial white head. Smelled like rice and urine. Tasted about the same. Slightly sweet with not much hop flavor. I gave into my fraternity brothers and decided to try sake bombing, which (slightly) improved the flavor.

In the bottle from the grocery store. Pale yellow in color, white head, but very fine bubbles. Not an over carbonated beast like many of this ilk. Aroma is faint- maybe a little sake-like rice, but not much of that. No hops anywhere to be found. Mildest of palates, you could be drinking rice water. I remember that the price of a pitcher of this stuff in Yokohama was around $25 US in a fancy-pants bar for tourists.

Bottle.  Poured out gold with a decent white head.  Not much to the aroma, pretty dry.  Palate is thin and a little watery.  The flavor is medium malt with a very crisp dry finish.  Not worth the import prices as it is really not much better than our own macros.

Had this one from an Asahi pilsener glass, been on a good run of getting the proper glassware at pubs.  Another one of those beers that I really wanted to like.  Amazingly pale color that just makes it look great.  Light ricey smell, not much in the hop department.  The light grainy taste comes in, politely bows and then leaves quickly, as if not wishing to offend, leaving a very dry, empty finish.  AS a sessional beer, it really isnt that bad but in the grand scheme of beers, it isnt terribly good.

Beer #4 at the WBF in Durham.  I can’t say that I was really impressed by this beer at all.  But then again, it was the World Beer Festival.  I assumed that I’d be drinking through a bunch of really crappy macros in order to get to the good stuff.  Unfortunately Asahi is one of those crappy macros.  I want to have faith in the beer of Japan, a country which I will be travelling to in the near future, but beers like Asahi, Kirin, and Sapporo, are more than a little discouraging.

Has a massive off white( eggshell) coloured head, even with a careful pour, regulation pale yellow/gold colour for the beer, livelly carbonation.
Smell is fresh and not unpleasant, weak hops and quite grainy.,
Taste again is light with essense of grassy hop and some sweetness from the malts, not great but not horrid.
At the start i sort of liked the dry mouthfeel  but as this 633ml bottle went on it became less pleasurable and more annoying!
Overall not a beer I would buy again, but its far from disgusting.
Notes: This was brewed in Canada by Molson.
Pale gold colour with thin white head. Very mild grainy malt nose. Mild malt taste with dry grain notes and finish.

bottle.  Pours ridiculously light. The smell is very artificial, like cleaning agents accompanied with some grains. Mostly just some corn in the flavor with some crisp hay. Better flavor than smell, that doesn’t say anything though.

Bottle. Pours pale yellow with soapy white head. Smells skunky and a bit perfumy (in a bad way). Tastes like hay, rice, skunk, garbage water, and aspirin (which I will need after drinking this. Headache central). Gross.

I have a soft spot for this beer.  By itself it is very weak, yet not watery, but not particularly good.  When paired with food, especially Japanese food, this beer is absolutely fantastic.  Salty foods and Asahi Super Dry are perfect together.

ehh what to say all japanese beers are the same to be honest some fellow wanting to make alot of money quick, so they make an entirly tasteless beer and make it 5% so ppl get drunk enough so they have a few and dont notice. Aroma is sweet corn. Taste is seriously minimal, soda water has a similar taste, but a sweetness to it which makes it more barable.
Bottle at Addison Oktoberfest. Looks like urine. BMC nose. Very light rice adjunct taste. Lingering adjunct aftertaste. No personality whatsoever.
Extra light in color with a thick white head. Very little aroma but it is a bit sour. Nearly no flavor but for some hints of cardboard. I guess it’s just too delicate for me. Very clean though.
a pale lager from japan.  one of the few you can find commonly in the states that is actually brewed in japan as opposed to in brewerys in the US like guiness is.
Depsite all the negative reveiws I liked this beer.  Perhaps my expectation was low or it was due to the fact that I had it at KOI in LA.  Grat carbonation.  Pured nicely.  Not much flavour though.

Bottle, 33cl. One of the worst beers that i’ve ever had!  Very pale yellow colour,  with a medium white head. Almost no aroma, flavour or carbonation! Very light body. Not unpleasant but not really a beer! Maybe we could call it hops&water or something similar.... Just works as a thway to kill the thirst.
One of the hoppier finishes of any Japanese lagers I’ve had.   Decent and drinkable but nothing to really recommend itself.  More corn adjunct flavors than I remembered from past samples.
It seems like there’s a million other beer with the same taste. Looks like Ginger Ale, but ain’t better.
I have to say that the aroma is not unpleasant and neither is the taste, which are the things most going for it.  Very smooth.  Has a very nice finish and is actually quite refreshing.

Got this in a can, the aroma is pretty much non existant..maybe a whiff of rice. The pour is clear but nothing special, a pale gold color. The carbonation is very active, I would say its overly carbpnated. The taste is very crisp and clean with a small hop bite but not much flavor in this brew, this would pair well with sushi as it is crisp and refreshing but on its own it’s very bland. Recommened with food only.
Resturaunts serving Japanese beer should list this well above that nasty Kirin skunk bottle. This, though boring, was tolerable and an easy stomach. Personally, I wish these places all sold Red Rice.

Can: Pale yellow, quite translucent, moderate white foamy head, spotty lacing, lively carbonation.   Grassy aroma, cereal and oat accents... not as sweet as the Kirin before it.   Dull maltiness, moreso on the grassy/oat side but without any of the sweetness.   Fairly clean, but boring.   Moderate body and mouthfeel, for a Pale Lager at least.   Fairly clean finish, but not as interesting or sweet as the Kirin before it.   One I cherish from my past, but unfortunately too bland, even these days.
RICE. Need i say any more? very very ricey. it did go good with the sushi i ate maybe it was the rice in the sushi and the rice in the beer.
Had this with Kirin Ichiban. Tasted almost exactly the same, this one was a little more pale. Unoffensive but not enjoyable lager. Worthless.
Like American (industrial) beer: fucking close to water. The beer deserves some points though as the initial flavour is somewhat crisp malty. Bitterness is low and the body is very thin.

Bottle at home, I find it to be a great crisp (not dry as advertised) summer day beer.  It has become one of my favorites for regular consumption.  It is said to be the 4th best selling beer in the world, so I would definately call this a Macro-brew even though it’s not carried most places around here.
[bottle from ichiban cafe] pale yellow colour with a small head. smells of very little, has that pale lager aroma a little dry in the finish, certainly not "super dry".

Bottle, at home.
Light yellow with white head, mostly diminishing, no lacings. Moderate malty and light/moderate hoppy. Light sweet, moderate acidic. Light body, watery, lively carbonated.

21.4 oz bottle.  slight rice aroma.  pretty much nothing special.  rahter average taste.  is very smooth but not thin or watery so i liked that feature.  Would be a good beer to drink while watching the movie gettysburg from some reason.
rice rice rice super extra mega dry rice goes well with super rice rice rice rice This beer did not taste bad and went well with some sushi.  japanese beer "imported" and contract brewed in canada

Not an inspiring appearance: pale and lacking a decent head. By no means an unattractive aroma, but though the taste began as pleasantly grassy, the flavours of decaying grasscuttings began to predominate.  The final impression was thin, watery and lacking the promised bitterness.
Poured from a cool little 135ml can. Clear golden colored, fizzy white head. Weak hoppy aroma, same flavor with some maizy hints. Drinkable, but uninteresting, as expected! Crispy.

Bottle.  "the beer for all seasons"  - we shall see.  Poured a clear, bubbly, bright pale yellow - huge white, creamy head, draught-like lacing on glass.  Smells terrible - sour and composty, stewed mushrooms, wet newspaper, soggy straw, bit of artificial sweetener over the top.  Taste is strong metals clanging against minerals and chemicals - a bit of big-brew maltiness and a tease of hops and grains, and still that sweetness at the edge of perception - like overripe fruit, almost.  Light and somewhat chalky/dusty on the palate, slips away quicker than thought, leaves a dusty, vaguely sweet and brackish after-echo.  Not really awful, overall, but I won’t touch it again.
I usually get this at Japanese restaurants, simply because I think its the best Japanese beer that you can find at most sushi places. Dry, yet crisp and refreshing. A nice lager.
Vague hoppy aroma. Regular looking pale lager with some lacings. Flavor is one of the anonymous ones ever. I could never pick this out in a blind tasting.

Bottle. Pours a yellow/golden colour with a white head. Sweetish aroma with cereal notes. Flavour is weak - hops, maybe. Faint notes of cardboard. Don’t really know about that ’super dry’-thing either. I don’t even find it regular dry. Moving on - yet again...
Bottle. - Very faint malty nose.  The taste is bland and watery and almost nonexcisting. I suppose it would be ok as a mindless thirst quencher.... - then again so would water.

1 liter can.  Light sour grape aroma.  Light golden yellow color with quick collapsing head.  Flavor - barely detectable malt and hops.  No bad flavors - hardly any flavor at all.  A nonoffensive thirst quencher.
Pours gold with a generous white head.  Smell is of grapefruit and light malt.  Taste is watery with a slightly bitter finish.  Is there really a difference between this one and the Draft beer?
Bottle.  Had this at Benihana’s, a japanese steakhouse.  I thought it went well with the dinner,  very dry and, well, it tasted like a pale lager, but I did enjoy it with my meal.
Thin, watery, yellow body with no head. Also, it has no taste. I like how they use "slake" in the commercial description. Sounds like something the devil would say.
Bottle 12 oz. Clear light amber with medium white head that diminished quickly. Small malty aroma. Light body  with little texture. Small flavor with little finish. Below average brew.

Very pale yellow with a good head that didn’t last. Malty and a bit metallic on the nose, typical pale lager palate with a very dry finish indeed (which I don’t mind from time to time-- with spicy food for example). Best of the Japanes pale lagers I think, but that’s not really saying much.
One of the lightest beers out there in color.  Aromas are earthy and grassy.  Taste is dry, yes, but at the expense of flavor.  Very macro-tasting.

Apparently good all year round. No. Designed, not crafted - it’s a minimalistic aesthetic manifested in beer format - and it’s bad. Crisp but hard, over carbonated, with all the character squeezed out. Try with sushi, light salad or as a palate cleanser if you must drink it at all. The nicely designed labelling may attract the image conscious.
Pours a pale, straw colour and is VERY carbonated with a grassy smell and sweet, hoppy flavour with a dry finish.  My first Japanese beer. (500ml can)
Bottle at Korean resturant.  Not bad at all.  Sweet flavor that was a little different than I am used to from a pale lager.  I actually liked it.
Golden color with film for head. Super-dry your not kidding, almost no aroma or flavor whatsoever. A little skunk with some spiciness. Sorry can’t say much else.

Bottle at a sushi reataurant. Pale yellow with a puffy white head that quickly disappears. Hyperactive carbonation that made it look more like ginger ale than a beer. Mild aroma, a bit of malt and some canned veggie notes. Very little flavour. Went OK with my sushi as I didn’t really want anything with a lot of flavour to get in the way of the taste of the fish - but I could’ve gotten the same effect with a bottle of mineral water...

(Bottle 33 cl) A South Korean beer brewed under English license in the Czech Republic - that is indeed a trulu multinational affair. But I’m sorry to say, that in spite of all the effort this is a very, very sad beer. Main flavour is old mushrooms. The czechs should stick to their own quality lagers.

Had this one after a Kirin, and found it less flavoursome, but more crisp. Typical citrus hopping for a beer of this style, ie. nothing unexpected, along with being low on flavour with the malt (rice adjuncts are responsible for this I guess). A carbonated mouthfeel added to the crispness/dryness of the beer.
Pours a urine sample yellow... kinda stinky... very dry, but easy drinking... not much flavor... though prolly good with sushi... I was not impressed.

Poured a sickly pale straw color... tiny white cap that vanishes immediately, no lace, no aroma, no real taste...but very crisp and dry.....acheived with agressive infused carbonation and bittering oils. Much like club soda with lemon.

At least this is one mega brewer with the guts to ’fess up to using rice as a main ingedient.

not the best, not the worst. pretty average if you ask me.  Dry, with bittness in the middle and after. I’ll assume that rice is a ingrendent.

Probaly goes good with Sushi.
Pours very pale yellow with little head.  Low on malt and hop aroma and flavor.  Not much there.  My least favorite of the Japanese lagers.
from a 1L can. pale yellow color frothy white head.  Mostly malts no hops. Dry finish.  it certainly is crisp and clear.  Really smooth.
Quite pale. Not much color, not much head, not much aroma, not much taste, not much body... not much.

If Mr. Myagi had anything to say about this, he would slit his wrists.  Dry, with no malt or hops to speak of make this a kamikazee’s dream.  Drink before your death, coward; this stuff sucks, and so do you.

Dry beers didn’t work for long in America and they don’t work much better in Japan.  This beer lacks flavor, and aroma.  It is way too light to be called a premium beer.  The only thing good about it is the size of the bottle!
Weak, tastes of corn and rice and is over-carbonated. I strongly disliked this beer and don’t understand its comparatively high rating here compared to other pale lagers.

Drank this at about 4am at an apartment in Clifton, NJ after a night out carousing and meeting people, chatting, etc.  Wonderful time for this unexpected rating to pop out of my friend Angelo’s fridge.  He claims that he likes the "superior quality" of Japanese beers in general.  Well its certainly dry, I’ll give you that.  And has that nice rusty mouthfeel that shouts to you that you’re drinking in the crazy mountains of the United States.  Taste problems abound, but it has a character in its language.

(Bottled, brewed in the Czech Republic by license) Paleish golden color with a small head. An aroma of rice and some grassy hops. Dryish, moderately malty flavor with sweet corn and bitter hops in the finish. Light-bodied, quite soft-carbonated and slicky palate. A semi-decent, dryish and rice-corny lager. Nothing memorable.

Aroma is lightly malty with alcohol. It has an average head but has some clumps in it after it subsides, very little lacing. Golden amber color typical for Pale Lagers. Taste is a little weak and the only things that save this is the unique hops. Too bad there is not much of them to taste. Brief maltiness in the finish. Aftertaste is almost non existent but being a super dry beer that would be expected. Pretty so so.
better than a tsingtao, but still not that great of a beer. nothing special here it tastes alright is drinkable not 2 skunked but it doesn’t leave you with any impression just another regular beer

Hmm..this is interesting..a "Japanese" lager brewed under licence in the Czech Republic. I suppose if you MUST brew under licence that would be one of the best places to do it..we’ll see!! Pale straw in colour, there’s not much in the way of a head, and there’s no bead of bubbles. Aroma is disappointing, little in the way of hops, and grain..slightly...thats about it really. Palate is medium bodied, with grain to the fore, lacking the smooth sweetness of malt(hence the "DRY" of the name I suppose) there’s no indication of hops on the palate, but they do claim on the back label, to have used them in the production of this definitely NOT premium lager. Finish is all but non-existent. All in all, a sadly disappointing glass.
Corn aroma. Light golden color, very small head. Flavor is grainy and corny, unpleasant sourly, light bitter, light fry finish. Another one please.

Poured from a large bottle, the golden brew had a mild and not unpleasant taste.  I tasted a hint of rice, but I had just eaten rice so that might have played a factor.  Fortunately, I did not detect the rotted metallic vegetable matter on a stick others experienced, but I think I was drinking from a fresher batch.  It’s not great, but it’s a lot better than most of the refuse-based brews around these parts.

Bottled. Pale golden colour, not much of a head. Aroma consists of maize and hops and is pretty bitter. Flavour is made of maize and hints of rice with a bit bitter finish. Dries your mouth. All in all a boring beer.
Light yellow coloring with a thin white head. Aroma of corn and cooked rice. The taste has some corn and dry rice. The flavor is almost like a bad malt liquor. Awful.

nice light flavored beer with a crisp finish.  not overly impressed, but i would order again.  slight golden colour with a moderate carbonation.  not to much of a malt or hop flavor.  similar to an anh-bush type beer, but better.  when in rome (japaneese steak house) do like the romans do.  drink japaneese!

Clear yellow coloured, dying head. Weak grainy nose. Grainy and malty flavour, bit bitter, perhaps even some apple (or am i just drunk?). More sweet in the end. Watery mouthfeel. Not great, but i’ve certainly had worse.

Straw-golden colour, fluffy white head. Very dry, dusty grains nose; bit of honey aroma. Super dry grains taste, use of enzymes/rice is obvious. Sweet finish, nearly pur malt sugars. Slickness, light body, but not watery, however. Starts dry, gets (quite) sweet and has no aftertaste, dry again. Super ridiculous.

Bottled and brewed in UK (BB 10/2005)

Pale yellow, small white head. Very light corn aroma. Harsh maltyness in the metallic palate. Some late bitterness in the aftertaste.  Uninteresting basic lager - not offensive.
Sour unpleasant aroma, tastes exactly like Grøn Tuborg - that is to say, a crisp disagreeable flavour of sour piss. Double-plus ungood.
This beer is ok.  In Japan it is one of the cheapest, not the best quality.  The taste took a while for me to get used to.

Another osama corner store beer .
Poured yellow with a decent white head and lots of caronation.
Aroma of very light corn.
Corn flavor with very heavy metalic flavor on the palate.
Not that good.

This smells like cooked green vegetables I swear. The appearance is golden. The flavor is very crisp with a sourness to it. Super Dry describes this one well. I feel like I need a glass of water after drinking it. Nothing that great for sure.
Might work with spicy food but has little to recommend it as a quaffer. Rich hoppy aroma. Thin body. Dry finish, as the name suggests but little else to remark on. Hello taste?

Pours yellow, slight bubbly head.  Light malty aroma, thin thin taste (if any), but highly enjoyable creamy smooth soothing palate.  Great beverage for intensely flavored foods.  I would try this again.

Yellow witha bubbly medium lasting head. Has a decent malt aroma that promises much more than the beer can keep. The flavour is extremely thin, mostly water with a hint of malt. Worked OK with my curry though.
This is indeed a dry, chalky offering.  Smooth, but unimpressive.  Grainy.  Definitely pairs better with spicy Asian food.
Bottle. Grain aroma. Light yellow colour, big white unstable head. Mouthfeel is not bad for a lager. Not much flavour. Hint of bitter aftertaste.
Stinks of corn and rice. Tastes of corn and rice. Piss yellow, mine was contract-brewed in Canada (?). Not worth the three bucks for the 16oz. bottle. Tastes like BMC. Pissssssssss.
bottled.  kind of a light golden color with a light oaky aroma.  texture is heavier than Am used to but acceptable. taste was slightly bitter.
Bottled.  Corny lagerish aroma to this old gold colourd lager.  The taste is typical lager bite with a refreshing edge.  Quite crisp and inoffensive and refreshing but lacking character.

Clear very light orange. Boring nose, a little stale. Not a heap going on flavour wise but I’ve always maintained this beer is about texture, feel and the fact is it generally succeeds as a crisp, dry style.  And it’s worth a few points to that alone. A little backended sweetness on this occasion.

Had this at Sushi King in Troy.  Japan’s #1 beer, huh?  Well, it’s good to know that the masses of Japan know as much about beer as the masses of America.  Poured light yellow with a small white head that dissipated quickly.  Faint aroma.  Flavor is strong corn wtih a metallic, slightly hoppy twinge.  Body is very light and the beer disappears in your mouth (the meaning behind "super dry"?).  I should’ve just stuck with water instead.
Pours is a bright yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is hardly anything.  Flavor is corny and slightly metallic.  Not good in every catagory.

Pours clear golden with a white head. Lightly malty aroma. Taste is grainy with notes of lemon, corn and light hops. Moderately sweet, not much bitterness. Dry finish. Medium body, very fizzy carbonation. Decent head retention and lacing. Not good, but drinkable.
No hop taste, no real after taste.  Light and refreshing but so is water.  Gets a 10 overall because it does go well with light fare.
Bottled. Light and crisp, little to say. Escaping and little long-lasting aroma. Grainy, sweet.

Better than most domestics, but still not good enough to try again. The only things that suck out in my mind were the carbonation and the ugly yellow colour. I honestly don’t have much more to say than that.

high carbonation, and balanced maltiness. gold in colour, with rice and slight citrus tastse attacking the tongue right off the start. finishes crisp and clean. Very refreshing and great with any japanese food (go figure)
For a macro brew, this one tops my charts!

Wow, a "schmiddy" of this at the Cargo bar in celebration of some guy’s Australian citizenship cost 8 bucks. WELCOME DOWN UNDER SON!!! This stuff is terrible without being the absolute pits. Tastes like it’s based on rice malt: very thin and watery...

A fools gold color and thin soft fluff head.  The aroma will give me a headache if i sniff it anymore.  It reminds me of that smell of a carpet after a party and beer bottles and cups laying around everywhere.  Flavor has some corn with grass and light malt aftertaste.  I’ll admit i do drink this more than i thought cuz its the only thing good at sushi restaurants.

Pale golden color, with thin white head.  Weak skunky aroma of an american lager.  Flavor is better though; corny and weak, but dry and crisp.  A refreshing beer, and one that I’d choose over the domestic lites.
Golden color, light weak aroma, light malty taste, light watery body, light dry finish.

Had this one in the bottle, and from what I could tell this was like a classic american light with a bit more flavor.  The aroma was pretty bland and devoid of anything memorable.  This was an okay beer I guess, though not one that I really think will ever grace my beer shelf again.

10.17.04  Quart can.  Pale yellow pour; massive, craterous head.  Some light hops in aroma, mostly boring lager smells.  The flavor and palate are practically non-existant featuring only some damp tissue tastes...but the finish is like a whirlpool that sucks any hint of flavor or wetness down the drain.  Dry indeed.  Flavorless and dry, I’ll give it a couple bonus points for living up to its promise -- but what a strange style.  I could’ve done without this one.
330ml brown bottle. Golden brew, short lasting white head. Aroma a bit skunky. Dryish flavour, corn notes. Just a bit of malt makes an appearance. A little too plain and boring.

The colour is clear, bright yellow. The foam, made of big bubbles dissolves quickly into a thin lid.

The smell is mild and dry with notes of corn and pilsner-malt. 

The carbonation is strong, but not too strong, it is very refreshing.

The taste is quite mild, malty and dry with a touch of diacetyl. The aftertaste is somewhat sweet (from the corn) with a tone of wheat flour. 

I think this is a pleasant thirst-quenching brew. Uncomplex? Yes, but I think it is a good quality adjunct beer (both corn and rice). This is probably a good selection for really hot Asian food.

The particular bottle that I am reviewing was brewed under license in the Czech Republic.
From can.  Actually the largest can ever in the history of cans I think.  I mean this is really a 1 liter monster.  This seems to be the japanese equivalent of budweiser.  Not bad, but not good
Golden and heavily carbonated are the first things that come to mind. A tad watery and malty but nothing too significant to suggest.  An ok accompaniment to sushi.
Pretty good with food, much in the same way that a lot of beers are which are from the far east. Golden, light and not too interesting

BIG ASSED CAN@!(cant believe I paid $3 for this...)  Aroma is sweet, corny and somewhat skunky.  Transparent pale blone with a small white head that hangs around a bit.  Kind of peppery/carbonated.  Sweet maltiness in the middle.  Small hops to finish.  Rather bland and somewhat watery, but I have had worse.
Bottle  Small, creamy, white head, which disappears mostly.  Spare lace.  Flat, yellow body.  Nose of hops.  Average carbonation.  Lightly bitter initial flavour.  Moderately bitter finish.

Pale yellow color with fizzy white head.  Reminds me a lot of a dryer version of a coors.  Very lacking in actual flavor and the dryness gets rid of any refreshment value.  Wish I would have ordered something else.
Golden color with a white head. The taste is water with notes of rice or light malt. Very thin and boring.
Pretty boring stuff without any fo the kick of Sapporo.  This is kind of the Budweiser of Japan.

moderate wheaty aroma, white head dissipates and the straw colored body seems flat.  i’d say watery over "refreshing," basically my father who ordered this over lunch today ended up ordering something else.
golden honey color with creamy white head that quickly dissipates.  Wheaty (very simple) aroma, with a lager like flavor and a hint of bittering hops.  Very simple, no complexity

I found the main body a little too over-powering, it didn’t seem to let the finish through. However i’d never though the Japanese were big on beer, so i wasn’t expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised.  6/10
Straw yellow coloured, the head is quite high but quickly disappearing. Almost invisible sweet malty aroma and palate. No (after)taste.
Pours gold with big white head.  Smells hoppy and sweet and sour, but then loses aroma.  Tastes watery but is smooth.  Wasn’t feeling this one that much.

Poured golden color with a medium sized, and quickly diminishing white head, that did leave sparce lacing.  Nasty aroma of corn, wheat, and grain.  Lightly carbonated mouthfeel led way to tastes of sweet corn, metal, and malt.
No head. Typical golden color. Has an unusual smell to it. It also has a weird flavor. Just tastes like a cheap beer.
I don’t know what beer they were rating ("fresh, crisp and clear...") Not the same silver labeled crap I drank...A little more hoppy than your average lager...dry sand tasting finish...

I want to address the sushi issue.  If you are drinking this with sushi, add 0.5 to 1.0 points to my score.  Then again, I’d rate dilute lemonade a 3.0 if I was drinking it with sushi.  As for the beer alone, this is an average lager at best, with slight citrus/hop notes in aroma and taste, and a slightly dry finish.

330ml brown bottle at lunchtime in The Japanese Cantten on High Holborn. hilled but probably not quite enough. Poured a clear light gold with fizzy white head into a 25ml transparent beaker. Fresh grassy nose. Quite bitter with maize/rice notes. Good mouthfeel with bitter citrus finish but its not Superdry as it claims. Not as crisp as I expected either, stillit went down well enough with chicken Katsu curry.

Had this at a sushi bar on the road and was surprised by it. Not much to look at, but a surprising hoppy bite and whaddaya know...it actually IS "fresh, crisp and clear" as advertised. Went quite well with the soy and wasabi of japanese cuisine. I suppose all the low ratings this beer has received are from people who simply don’t like pale lagers.

Bottle.  Super thin-watery pour and appearance; quickly dissipating thin white head.  Piss-yellow.  The coolest thing about this beer was that I could read the Katakana memo  on the label: "Asahi Birru".  I gave it a 4 on appearance just for that!  Other than that, it’s a skunkfest and not even a good skunkfest.  Slight wheatiness.  Unrealistically thin mouthfeel.  I feel like I could chug these all day and not feel anything!
only beer you can drink in a sushi bar, its an average lager, barely any type of aroma, good only for sake bombs...light goldish hue, small off white head.  not a horrible beer. its OK.
Thin in both flavor and palate. Aroma is very light. All in all a disapointing beer.
A decent tasting lager.  With lots of flavor a light taste.  light bodied with barely any aftertaste.

Well it´s a thin watery golden colour beer.Quite dull looking actually.But loads of hops flavour and a strong bitter aftertaste.I actually enjoyed this beer.It definetely is as "fresh crisp and clear" as it says.
another descent lager.   little head, mild taste.  cold, cheap, and it did the trick.   wont search the world over for it, but liked it ok
Very pale golden colour with a quickly disappearing white head.  Malty and grassy/floral aroma.  A slight sweetness on the front with a clean finish.  Very typical.

33 cl. bottle. Served in generic lager glass.
Pale gold. Refreshing, slightly dry, with absolutely no finish.
My bottle was flat, dry, and moldy flavored, with unpleasant rice overtones and no finish.  I did not enjoy this at all.
Light yello beer with small head that dissapears fast. Quite thin and light tast and palate. No aftertast.
It’s a very crisp lager.  Tastes a little better than the American standards.  It goes well with salted edomame (soybeans).
Light yellow, watery looking, no head. Smells nasty and cheap. Tastes watery, plain, and grassy. Pass on this one.
Crap.  Pale yellow swill.  Aroma of bad beer.  Weak and watery.  Flavor on a par with Corona and Bud Light.  Use for watering your driveway.
Ok beer. I was expecting worse when a friend gave that to me. An easy to drink macro-tasting beer. Not tasting a lot, but its not tasting bad, and its refreshing!

Pours a pale straw and overcarbonated body typical from the asian lagers. Head is bubbly and thick but do not resist to the first sip. Light malty aroma with light grassy hints. Taste is OK. It is well balanced, lightly hoppy and the final is relatively long and bitter. A step above Sapporo Premium.
very pale yellow. Head fades quickly. Almost no aroma. Fairly generic mega-lager flavor. Not bad at all, but nothing to recommend it.

Has a very generic flavor, with some graininess, fruitiness and a cardboard-like dryness. Not really bitter at all. I suppose it could be considered crisp and easy to drink, but I can’t imagine myself having too many of these.

Bottle:  Virtually no aroma.  Only thing I can really pick up is a slight skunky aroma, but when I say slight I mean slight.  Pours a transparent pale yellow with a small white head that disappears almost instantly.  Somewhat malty taste with a slight bitter finish.  That is being generous though because there really is about as much taste as there is smell.  Almost none.  Watery mouthfeel and not much aftertaste.  Very boring beer.  The Bud/Bud Light crowd would think this is a good beer.  I don’t.
I tried this at a local bar that has numerous different kinds of beers.  It wasn’t as bad as I thought it would be but I wouldn’t go out of my way to drink it again.
(Bottle) Pours a pale golden color with a thick foamy head.  Beer was drinkable, but had no character and was kind of boring to drink.
Ice cream cone head.  Good carbonation.  Soapiness predominates but still fresh and dry.  Bland but very drinkable.
It is like japan's Michelob, it had no harsh aftertaste. It looks a pale gold, with a dirty white head. Not too bad first japanesse beer i ever had.
Clear & crisp with no nasty after taste, compliments spicey food extremely well, such as Thai or Malaysian.
Clear gold color with a quickly dissipating medium white head. Sweet malt and corn aroma. Light malt and corn flavors. Thin, watery feel with a crisp dry finish. No yucky aftertaste. Not bad.

Clear golden yellow color with a medium white head that quickly diminished to a sickly film. The aroma was full of sweet corn, dusty/musty tones, and a little vomit. The flavor was sweet...very malt liquor-ish...some dusty/musty tones in the aftertaste. The feel was watery...mildly crisp...dry (duh) finish.

Finally got the dry style! Had this tonight with dinner at a sushi restaurant(Soya). Pours a blond body with a tall white head. Nose is malty and kind of sweet. The taste is more malt and very faint hops and a faint grassy note. Finish is sort of bland and not really dry like I expected. Decent beer and damn good with dinner tonight, but nothing I'd go out of my way to seek out.
It's best to taste Japanese beers away from the sushi restaurant.  In which case, Asahi dry is a decent quaffable beer with no aftertaste.
not that bad.  pretty much taste neutral, but that can be a good thing.  Definalty had the "dry" flavor, but none of the aftertaste that dooms it's american cousins.
Not completely bad.  Good malt presence, a bit of actual stickiness, and something that seems like a noble hop or two.  Crisp, clean, and not rancid and full of adjuncts.
Pale yellow.  Aroma of cigarette smoke, corn, lemons and grass.  Fizzy and light, mild flavors of grains and fuel.  Sweet malt finish.

This is an expensive beer for people that either just enjoy curious slogans printed on what they are reading or wish to have some kind of exotic appeal to 18 yr olds doing japanese for the HSC.

I am going to claim I drank it for the rating only, it was my 100th and I wanted something to giggle at.
Light straw in color with a small white head. Aroma of faint hops. Flavor is mildly bitter,dry and clean.

Pours a light gold color with a medium quickly dimishing head.  Aroma is light in all regards.  Flavors are of light malt, light hops and a slightly metallic taste.  Body is about the same as water.  Not too bad.
Bland, but not horrible. Gold (which is darker than I thought it would be). Practically no aroma to speak of. A bit of hops, with a clean finish. Ok with some foods, but not great on its own.

Bottle.  Ack. Awful.  Dull, flavorless macro taste, with a huge amount of carbonation.  Reminds me quite a bit of soda water, sort of a mineralesque taste.  Not much going on, clear yellow, big white head, little aroma.  Couldnt finish.
Very carbonated.  Not bursting with flavor -- it is listed as super dry, after all).  Despite the above, it is quite refreshing.  A very interesting beer.
A very bland tasting beer. Kind of skunky, bitter also. A weak aroma and basically everything else.

Clear golden effervescent body with a quickly fading eggshell white head. Has little character in the aroma. Flavor is mild, kind of bland but has a bit of hops character. Goes well with spicy foods. Overall, a decent Asian beer.

Stale cardboard and flowery hops. Typical clear golden with surprisingly large, white, large bubbled lasting head. That's where the good news ends. Flavour is in short supply with a bit of a puckering finish. Palate is smooth but manages to slip by without being at all satisfying. Grade A Hooch. At least it looks good. Brewed under license in the Czech Republic - very strange. Bottle.
Yellow, big white head. Only moderately vile. While being sickening sweet, it still has some bitterness to round it out. Carbs carry it along but leave too quickly. Not really dry at all.

Sample- 355 ML- Golden straw colour. Super white head that didn't last long. No peculiar smells, but no pleasant ones either. Light carbonation, along with a super "light beer" type of taste. Overall, it was very refreshing, and went down easy. Good on a hot day when you just want refreshment.
Had this at a Japanese restaurant with sushi. It was served way too cold - which perhaps was not a bad thing - the pale-gold beer was dry to a fault. All in all, a boring clean beer.
Not bad at all..Refresh tanging feeling when its in your mouth i like it but thats my taste

Either dry to the point of desiccating your palate, or a burst of freshness, taste depending.
Spanner.
Tastes like a skunked bottle of Bud. Was just plain gross to me, but it kills the sashimi taste.

bottled: with the sushi food again.  nothing too exciting to report here. pretty much your typical asian style pilsener with rice adjunct flavor, slightly bitter and skunky, good with spicy food and on a hot day. crisp clean and DRY. for some reason i usually drink sapporo over this??

Golden yellow colour. It is dry and, no doubt OK as a thirst quencher on a hot summer's day. Unfortuantely it is a rather cold winter day here. Alternatively, I suspect, intended as a "designer" beer for poseurs who value style over substance.The rice and hop adjuncts introduce an underlying tang that compromises the cleanness. Otherwise, quite thin and boring stuff. Mine was produced in the Czech Republic & this seems to be the only Asahi beer imported into the UK. Bottled.
Very clean and refreshing. A great thirstquencher. Not as watery as expected.

Looks an almost hazy yellow. Minimal aroma, but fresh, aley hints of hops.

It almost tastes like beer. Weaker, though, and sweetish. Is this supposed to be dry?
typical of the japanese style super dry lagers, no flavour/aftertaste/character, drink ice cold on a hot day.
This an alright run of the mill bottled lager, which does its job.  It claims to be super dry, but I think its just dryish, without a particularly strong flavour.

Clear golden in color. Looks and smells like a mass produced crap beer but it surprised me in the flavor department. I wasn't expecting much but this didn't taste half bad. In fact, I think I'd drink it again.
Nice simple yeasty aroma with a nose of dough.  Small, fully diminishing head.  Initial flavor is lightly sweet with a moderately bitter finish.  Light, dry, and flat.
Clear light yellow body with a white fully diminishing head.  Light malt nose.  Slightly sweet initial with a little bitterness in the finish.  Fairly mellow overall.  Just passable
Super dry is right. Slight hop flavor and thats it. Great if you want a beer flavored thirst quencher
Pale goldon color, not much head. Wak and watery, not much aroma, not much flavor. A rather boring lager.
Golden colour with a thin fizzy fully diminishing white head. Virtually no aroma, light malty cereal flavour, dry finish. Fizzy and prickly mouthfeel.

Very pale yellow on the pour and a fleeting head. The nose is wheaty with citrus as is the taste. Quite sharp with too much bubble. The body is as thin as the picture on the left. I wonder how many raters have this as their favourite style?
Asahi super dry certainly lives up to its name.  Its very dry with a crisp gold colour and easy drinking flavour.  Its very refreshing and all in all a pretty good beer.

Faint grainy malt aroma.  Light golden in color, sparkling and with slight, white lace and head.  Light, cereal malt flavor, with just a tiny bit of sweetness.  Fizzy palate, light in body.  Not as dry as I remember, but still somewhat refreshing.

Very pale yellow clear body. The best word to resume it all is TIMID. It works fine as a refresher, so does a glass of water. The aroma is thin and cerealic. Taste is sweet, malty, very watery. The finish is a black hole. It's unexistant in the sense that it never starts.
Ranks up there with Kirin. Maybe a little better. Semi dry and refreshing. Not bad but not great.
My pick of the dry beers.  It has an enticing aroma of malty goodness, and goes down the throat so easily.  The japanese put a slight spin on a typical dry beer. cheers
Very sweet and very hoppy. Dry and a little bitter. Quite different to beers that i usually drink. Interesting.
clear straw/gold colour with fluffy head. bitter hoppy tatste with dry finish, hints of rice.
Mild hoppy aroma. Not much to the palate. Thirst quenching, as dry beers can be.  Nothing offensive yet nothing outstanding. A modest beer.
Mild sweet hoppy aroma.Fizzing gold appearance.Very thirst quenching and pallate clensing.The best choice for sushi.Clean hop finish.
Pale golden, small bubbly head. Slightly malty aroma, not much else. Thin and fizzy boddy with weak notes of malt. zzz.
The typical mainstream beer. This is the most typical of all typical beers I have ever had :)
Not much going on. Its like all the others. A little malt and a little hops. Perhaps a little more bitter than normal. ZZZZZ
not bad with dinner.. very decent, nothing I havent had before, but drinkable

Clear golden-yellow color and sudsy white head. Aroma of grain and faint leather. Less flavor than any beer that I've ever tasted. Papery texture and super-dry finish (as advertised). Ironically, these beers brewed to have no bitterness do have an aftertaste... an aftertaste like stale crackers. There's simply not enough here for me to enjoy.

Starts off with large, sharply carbonated bubbles that feel like granulated sugar on the top of the tongue.  Then followed by metallic flavors on the sides of the tongue.  Sure, it finished kind of dry, but it was far from super.
This is just a great beer before or after dinner. Super drys really are dry and this one won't bloat you before or after dinner
Weak wheaty nose, no head or bubbles, almost clear an little to no taste. It is dry though, but other than that nothing too exciting.

Clear, light golden lager. No head.
Not much in the way of aroma or flavor.
Light-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation.Very dry, crisp, clean finish. Goes well with sushi, otherwise, don't bother.

Bought this one at Schiphol Airport. Indeed a dry beer, basically I would say 'dry' means totally uninteresting in this case. Well, not completely, the japanese words and signs were funny and amusing, especially when there are people around you who can explain something about those funny signs.
Beer looks ugly boring with no head. Smell is acceptable, not very skunky, some hops and malts are there. Weak however. Taste is empty. palate... what palate? Some points for the funny japanese language.
This beer reminded me of Michelob.  Awfully carbonated and yes, this beer was fairly DRY.  Cool can, I was glad to have been able to add this can to my collection.

Poured clear and golden with a moderate white head that disappeared oh so quickly leaving half a dozen meager bubbles forlornly clinging together in the center of the beer's surface.  Malty and somewhat skunky lager aroma.  Initial malt flavor quickly gives way to a tart, citrus hoppiness and a mildly metallic finish.  Surprisingly, the mouthfeel was my favorite part, light bodied with a refreshing, creamy carbonation.
Had this after having a kirin and thought this one came out much better although it did not have much going for it, oh well I will have to go back and re-rate it.

Crisp yellow body with fast fading white head. Generic grains and light hoppy bitterness.  Faired well as an intro to the sushi. Nyeah... ok for a mainstream lager but not something I would bother with on a regular basis I don’t think.

Light golden color with a wispy/foamy white head that ends up looking like a waxy lid. Aromas od mild cider vinegar and old wood. Dry, yes. Good, no.  Harsh dry floral and herb flavors with only watery insipidness to wisk it to the back of the throat.
Nothing. Oh god nothing. No tastes orther than a skunk with a bitter bitter ass thrice removed.
Weird grainy nose.  Very thin, mass-produced, and super-dry.  My first dry, I think, and I dont know if Ill ever have another...

Only ever had this when eating Tepanyaki.
Nice brew, best had cool, not overtly cold.
Nice on the palate.

Had this at a Japanese Steakhouse last night. Good companion to sushi and tempura.  Slight malt in the nose, decent snow white head to the pour.  appearance - very light golden. Very dry flavor - but does not leave you thirsty and in need of water like some other "dry" beers do.  A bit of hoppy zing to it - nothing to get too excited about - and it does go down smooth.
Dry beer, I like dit a lot. No aftertaste, just good dry flavor, not too sweet.  I could drink this regularly.  Thumbs up.
It does have a sharp, interesting delivery - good hop bitterness? Pretty good stuff. Funky lagerish nose.

Not much to be said here.  Pours up yellow and fizzy with a head that quickly totally dimishes.  The aroma is at least a little better as there is a tiny hint of hops in there somewhere.  Flavor is not unpleasant, just totally underwhelming.  Would be good to give to a man dieing of thirst, otherwise very forgetable.
Clear, light golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma is sweet malty/grainy.  Taste is much the same, with hint of bitterness at the end.  Finish is dry.

A cereal fizz pushes a swill aroma...A dry finish battles with a urine-like astringency...This minty fresh thirst quencher vanishes with agility from the tastebuds and does not leave any calling card whatsoever...Part I of the bored senseless "Free on the Plane, Wouldn't Have it Otherwise" endeavour...

Aroma:  Has a musty smell to it and not much else.
Appearance:  Poured from the bottle with a small white head which quickly faded.  Didn't leave a lot of lacing.  Amber in color.
Flavor: Drinkable, but tastes pretty much like an American mass produced beer.  Nothing special here. 
Palate: A good amount of carbonation adds to a medium mouthfeel.
Overall: This beer was just plain boring.  It wasn't bad, but it didn't have a lot going on.  It could have used some hops and malt.  I think the word DRY in Japanese translates to BLAND in English.
Pretty much like most other Asian beers.  Very comporable to Sapporo, or Kirin Ichiban.

Smelled skunky....ugly yellow color w/ decent carbonation, no head...tasted skunky, metallic(coppery?) yet kindof crisp (lil bita hops).......didn't suit me very well--->went to the old compost bin...

Good malty pilseneresk aroma, very crisp.  Pours to a golen colour with a white foamy head.  Super non-dememo  taste, super dy yes, but also super taste less.  Has np real body or flavour yet the dryness in the finish is pleasant.

Very light yellow colour, nice white head.
A sweet aroma with some bitterness and sweetness.
nice crisp asian beer, nothing to blow your load over, but definitely better than the rest of the crap coming out of there
Instead of crisp and refreshing I am getting boring and bland.  Not bad for washing down sushi, but on its own it is very boring.
As the name suggests, its dry. Pretty much zero flavour, some light riceyness, but pretty close to flavourless, boring.

If you knew Sushi...
Well, this may be the beer to have with sushi, but I think that water could also be an alternative. Dry, yes, flavour (see water).

Can. Pale gold colour, with a light, fine head. First sip...WoW BanG!! smacks of dryness its slight shock if your thirsty (the first of the morning). It was served so cold the aroma's escaped me and come to think about it, so did the flavour!?
Reminds me of what a Lite beer brewed by Warsteiner would taste like: same grainy flavor with a watery palate.  Quickly disapating head.  There are doubtless much better things to drink with sushi.

Light to medium gold color and white head start this one.  Aroma is very light...not much to it at all.  The flavor also lacks any real definition.  Not crisp, not much of anything.  Not a very good beer.
This is a great beer with sushi. It's aroma is not that great, kinda like Budwiser. The taste is much better. It does not have a strong aftertaste at all. Overall pretty Damn good beer.
Asahi Super Dry is a great beer. It's crisp and clear and has a slightly sweet tone to it. Definitely a good compliment to Japanese food.
This is my Sushi beer.  Sapporo and Asahi Super Dry taste great with Sushi.  I've never actually had outside of that.  It is crisp and dry and leaves the flavor to the fish you are eating.
This beer pours yellow with a small white head.  The taste is a bit dry (as stated) and it reminds me of a slightly watery bud light or something similar.  This is a good beer.
Yellow color with a bright white head, very little lacing.  Slight citrus aroma.  Mild hop taste with a dry aftertaste.  Not any strong flavors, but nothing stands out.

Pale gold with a short head, rather faint aroma. 
The good news is that it does actually taste dry; the bad news is that there's not much else to be said about the flavor. I rather like it anyway. This is how it's supposed to be: clean and refreshing, with a nice, slightly hoppy aftertaste.

Pours a light yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is minimal but a touch of alcohol. Thin and watery, but the overall taste isn't that bad. However, there is very little taste. Nothing to brag about, but I like the 33.8 oz can.
Clear and golden with minimal head.  Aroma of alcohol and some hops.  Flavour is pretty bitter and plain but is quite dry upon the finish.  I still prefer my sushi without this though.
Clear piss water...a mild citrus aroma...very few bubbles in the glass. Tastes like a nasty domestic...so essentially tasteless.

Clear golden yellow. Bubbly with no head. 
Smells like alcohol. Taste like a canned domestic beer. Not much flavor.
A crisp dry lager. and a must drink when feeding on sushi. The bottle says "Honourable to your tongue. Treat your tongue with the utmost respect."
Pale gold. Very carbonated, mildly bitter. Pale malts and floral hops make this refreshing, but almost tasteless.
It was really light and didn't have much taste to it.  There was a little hops flavor to it.  An average light beer.

(Bottle) I d past this in the store a thousand times and thought I had rated it, obviously not so I bought a bottle. Pours a large, frothy, quick dissipating white head and a light gold body. Weak hop nose, though slightly more flavour of hops. Watery and boring.

Essentially odorless, smells like any light American beer but this is Japaneese so it's more fun. Pretty thick head and surprisingly good lacing with a nice pale golden color (the beer not the lacing). Light bodied with low carbonation. Drinks as smooth as water which is mostly what it tastes like. Sort of a sweet-sour-flavor and maybe a touch of hops are also noticable. No finish. Lacks any sort of aftertaste.
Hoppy but Budweiser-esque nose, light golden hue with no head, traces hops but watery, virtually no body whatsoever, unpleasant drainpour aftertaste
Clean smooth beer that goes quite well with oriental cuisine. Light color with very little head to it.
Not very characterful at all; paradoxically I'd like it better if it had just one flaw, some sort of idiosyncracy to distinguish it from other dry lagers.
Crisp, clean taste. Light to medium body. Nice light golden color. Great with asian food of course
Did not enjoy!!! Still, than most Asian beers. I had the Thai version, which may have made a difference.
A little more hops than I expected.  Clear clean quickly thinning head.  Washed down the chinese food rather well.

this is a damn decent tasting beer. i prefer the draft version to anything else, but out of the can or bottle is still not too bad. this is definetly on my top three maybe top two of japanese beers, but i also have some others in mind. defineltly goes well with food, but is still enjoyable by itself.
Negligible aroma, very light colour. No malt taste but slight bitterness. Light flavour & yes it is dry like club soda. May go well with spicy food. At least I can chalk up another country.

This beer is kind of yummy.  From the glass it looks just like any other beer in its class, nothing special there and then you take a sip and it is almost as all the saliva in your mouth is gone, now that is a dry delivery.  as the description say, a very crisp clean taste.
Pale yellow, pretty stable head, dry flavor with some acidity. Lively but fine carbonation. Refreshing.

One of the better tasting traditional Japanese beers that I'll often grab when enjoying sushi.  Out of the 3 basics to be found in more restaurants - Asahi, Sapporo and Kirin - Asahi is, to my palette, the best of the three.

While I dub it a Japanese beer, its is not a true Japanese beer but is more or less modeled after traditional Czech pilseners.  Truth be told, Asahi is made in the Czech Republic for all markets in the world, except in the United States where it is brewed and bottled by Molson Breweries in Toronto, Canada.

As for the beer itself, its clean and refreshing and works well with food.  On its own, it isn't overly enjoyable, but its blend of hops and malts, with an emphasis on the hoppier side of things makes it a great accompaniment to some good food.

Light gold with big white head, just what a lager should look like.  Not much nose at all.  Taste of a little malt, some floral hops, then bitter finish.  No joy at all to the palate, just a lager.  Initial impression is a well-made but generally uninteresting lager from another large factory and another large conglomerate.  My first thought was that this is a pricey and classy alternative to Budweiser with an overpriced hotel Japanese dinner, but the beer gets a little better as it warms up, which the large bottles certainly will do.
Watery. Some malt. Very clear. Strange taste in finish. Not so bad..........

Poured a shiny yellow with moderate carbonation and a ghost of a head.  Slight cornesque aroma.  In the mouth there was some grassiness but mostly a smooth rice character somewhat reminiscent of a water sake.  While lacking in malt profile or complexity, it did live up to its billing as dry.

Asahi - Maybe the japanese word for watery rice beer?  Light yellow gold in color, very clear. Head is foamy white, sibsides quickly. Nose of rice? I don''t know - rice wine, rice beer, Japanese cuisine likes its rice. I''ll stick to sake.

Bottled version. Some malt character reminiscent of a German lager. Better than Kirin and Sapporo. International light lager. No off flavors. Clean. Nice golden pour with a strong white head. Light, sparkling and dry.
Canned(250ml). -gold color crisp and clear good aroma but not so good I've tought it is
Ok so I used to like this. Laugh it up......................................

Clear golden straw. Sticky, bleach white head. Central carbonation. Rice husk aroma, not much else. No harsh chemicals or unknown aromas, which is a plus. Crisp, bitter and bland with a wet paper maltiness. Rice flavored and super dry (Hey, they''re onto something here...). Light body. Stale rice aftertaste. Sharp, even with a low carbonation. Not very clean. Tastes like licking cardboard and then running your wet tongue along a candy wrapper. Finishes lemony bitter and so dry you need another drink afterwards. Label says "has an excellent richness.". Yup. Made me buy it. Big, 600(+)ml bottles available for sadists.
better than i thought it would be. better than any australian dry beer. good for a hot day. quenches your thirst.
A fairly decent beer overall. Though it is quite plain. Fairly cheap too. ..
decent beer to go with sushi. i would prefer sapporo..but that''s me. decent taste with a little to bitter aftertaste for me. decent beer all around though.
A must have beer if your eating sushi or sashimi.  Find the flavour abit hard with out the food.

Very dry.  I personally think it's more refreshing in the heat, as opposed to a regular pale lager.  Nothing really special about this beer, other than the new monstrous can, and the fact that it's a little sharper on the finish.  I'd take this over another standard lager from another huge brewery.
Tasted like cheap American beer.  So dry, I wasn''t sure I even had a beer by the end.  Skunky smell, extremly pale, no taste.
Standard Japanese mass-produced beer. Super Watery would have been a better name for the beer.

Almost neutral aroma--perhaps a hint of hop essence detectible...Color is a pale yellow-gold with light head---slight lace...Flavors are muted: light sweetness underneath a mildly bitter top-end...However, the sweetness does not taste as if born of malts, but rather out of a sack of C & H from the corner market. Carbonation is suitably light, lest all flavor be lost...Finish is quite clean, but some hop bitters linger pleasantly...Body is light but not as watery as many, but the overall character lacks definition...All one can say is: "There are worse."

urine tinted yellow apperance, frothy/marshmellowy bright as light white head, I might have detected a slight, a very slight hop bitterness in the aroma but that was all that the aroma could offer, fizzy...no flavor or least I couldn't come up with an english word to describe it, Metallic/sugary finish, pretty blah, although a dry beer is, as the description notes, supposed to have no aftertaste, this beer had a lingering 'dry/metallic' aftertatste, that, in fact, lasted longer than most
This was a case of "Japanese Resturant / Japanese Beer". I would probably never try this beer otherwise. Wholly unremarkable, but it doesn''t interfer with food. Get the Sake instead.
Dry and crisp with a clean flavor.  Not a whole lot going on here...........
Your standard large breweried lager, totally ordinary.  Nothing bad, nothing to make it stand out.  Grainy aroma, metallic malt flavor.
Definitely not the same beer I had in Tokyo.  Is this stuff made by Molson?  It has a lingering aftertaste.
Pale and watery with that certain asian beer flavour that comes from brewing with rice. Unexciting to say the least.
Bottles had with a fine dinner at a Ryokan in Kyoto, Japan.  A foamy white head.  A crisp dry flavor that goes down easy.

A light yellow beer with only a little head. It has the aroma of brewing cereal - on wich it is brewed. The flavor is that of brewing cereal and is flat and metallic - it ends of in a slight bitterness.
Light yellow, grainy aroma, very dry, no flavor.............................
Very dry and light beer. Not much to talk about. Boring ....................

Medium gold color, medium head. Dry hopped and slightly malty. Medium bodied. Crisp and clean taste. Good hop/malt balance. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is very dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Crisp, clean and refreshing.

Sept, 2002Nice silver label. Even though brewed in the Czech Republic this is nothing more than slightly malty water. [2.0]

Oct, 2007Dry. Lacking in notable flavour. Mildly astringent. This is more about the texture than the taste. No real bad flavours, and it does clean the thirst. But it’s boring, and tastes thin and mean, even though it does have an acceptable body. Some mouldy bread flavours, and some metallic notes. [1.8]

Not much in the way of aroma. White, fluffy head. Had right after a Kirin, and preferred Asahi by a notch or two. May be listed in the "Dry" category, but is still very similar to the National Pilsner seemingly every country in the world copies from Budweiser. If you are inclined to stick to the cookie cutter Pilsners, you can't do much better than Asahi.
clear pale golden colour, fine head, nice lace, medium hop aroma, full-bodied, grainy, sweet and slightly dry - modest
pours with a small head that sticks around.  some cereal-ish grainy malt.  not very bitter.  dry-ish I guess.
Not the most incredible beer, but pretty good for sake bombs and as a compliment to sushi.
Very dry (hence the name).  Reasonable aroma, and a finish that doesn't really stick.  Not really worth it.
Blond lager. Very light malt aroma. Watery, pretty dry......................
I didn't rate this beer that well, but I do enjoy it now and then.  Mostly at restaurants when someone else is paying, it's not nearly good enough to justify the premium you pay to get it in bottles.

Medium light gold under a large white shortish lasting head and some blobby lace. Faint metallic sappy hops aroma. Light faintly sweet more bitter start, bland to light bitter middle and everything else. The bitter is somewhat harsher and more flavourless than I remember. On warming a (wheat rice corn) grainy flavour appears.
i like to get this when I go to a Japanese steakhouse like Samurai or Benihana.  Otherwise I don't have much use for it.
Heavy carbonation no head. Only slightly better than average international standard swill

You can do better for cheaper than this.  Mine said "Brewed in Canada."
...
Dry, burnt.  I have it with Sushi somtimes.  The big bottles are good and cheap, if you want a buzz with your dinner.  Not real flavor here.  It just cleans the pallete.
One of these was good, one of these was bad.  I guess I'll average them out.  A pretty good flavor, but weak and Ummm, urine looking.  I'm not going to buy anymore of this stuff.
A boaring beer that had absolutly no charecter. It was average in every respect although it lost points in aroma because it had a strong skunky odor.
Nice & dry with authority. Less harsh than many Japanese  brews.............
Good for drinking with excellent Japanese food.  Less harsh tah other Japanese beers.
I think this beer serves its purpose and that it is unobtrusive while eating sushi and other delicate food.
